text: I have dined here many times, and have had many good meals. Buttermilk Channel is a very nice restaurant that can get a bit loud once it fills up, and can be a bit pricey. I also don't  like waiting on a line to get into the sole bathroom in the place. Try the mussels, they are always tasty, and the toast points are perfect for sopping up the juice. They frequently run a steak special that is overpriced, but tasty, and wines by the glass can be great sometimes. I keep going back.

Where can I possibly start?  From the moment you enter this place, the amount of natural light filling the room makes for a beautiful dining room.  The bar is to the right, and is truly a bustling spot.  I've been twice: once with girlfriends and the second with a friend and fellow blogger.  I'll share my review for both visits because I am OBSESSED with buttermilk channel.First visit:We came for lunch on a Friday.  Glad we had a reservation bc the place filled up quickly.  We ordered several items and were absolutely impressed by the quality of the dishes.  We ordered the grilled cheese, whipped ricotta toast, buttermilk chicken sando, and a side of veggies.  I had the grilled cheese (because I'm a kid at heart and grilled cheese is amazing) and it was so delicious.  It had apple and bacon and I was in HEAVEN.  I tried the fried chicken which was perfection, as well as ricotta toast.  We left with full bellies and smilesSecond visit:We came for brunch on a Sunday and it was so crowded ( no reservations on the weekends, so come super early!). I sat at the bar and chatted with the kindest bartender, I believe her name is Lauren.  She comped my glass of Prosecco which is the ultimate act of kindness, and my friend arrived.  We were seated rather quickly (within 10m of her arrival).  We ordered buttermilk biscuits, sausage with peppers and onions/egg scramble, pork chop, and the warm cinnamon bun. Holy Toledo Batman! This was just as delectable as my first visit.  The buttermilk biscuits were so moist, flaky, and a perfect amount of fluffy.  The eggs were scrambled to perfection too. The cinnamon bun was made of a cloud of warm, sweet drizzle, and my friends porkchop was tender and juicy.I'm already planning a third visit, more than likely sooo because I don't want to share anything. Also, pricing is quite perfect, and the service is incredible accommodating and kind (hi Elijah!) Cheers to you Buttermilk Channel

I came here with reservations on a Sat (highly recommended) with a group of 6 ladies for a celebration. The waitstaff and vibe was really nice and we all enjoyed the experience. They even had a vegan option which was nice yet it had almost no protein (a spoon of quinoa?) so 2hrs later I was starving. Savagely hungry. After dinner we headed out to a location nearby where there was no food options (vegan or not) so I was a bit stuck. I thought I'd top the meal off with vegan ice cream from VanLeeuwen but that was sold out so everyone else shared desserts. I'd say as a vegan I wouldn't come back but the non-vegans seemed to enjoy and really love the options. When walking in the restaurant there had to be at least 1-2 chicken/waffles on every table so that's most likely a really popular entree people come for.

While meeting up with my sister and brother in law for a trip to Europe, we decided we should see our last night home with some good ol American Fried Chicken. This was an amazing choice. Since we went on a Tuesday night, it wasn't too busy. They have a great selection of tasty specialty cocktails and wines. Our server was friendly and prompt. We started with homemade pickles and bacon maple almonds. I will admit that my sister and I weren't so sure about the almonds, but they were scrumptious. The pickles were delish too. All four of us ordered the chicken....best choice ever. The portion was huge. It was not overly greasy and was super crispy. The meat was so juicy and tender. You basically get a half chicken and a good portion of coleslaw. The coleslaw was light and crispy. Needless to say, we were all stuffed and happily so. I'd definitely recommend this place!EDIT: I forgot the cheddar waffle!!! I dunno how,  because I hate all of them. Added a little syrup and you're in heaven. Yum!

Had dinner on Saturday evening, it was the first warm Spring day and outdoor seating was an option in which was a must. I met with the hostess on the inside which was bright and noisy, but not too loud.My date and I were the only ones outdoors in casual wear though dressy attire is nice. Service was absolutely wonderful, I definitely enjoyed our server. We did get a cocktail (Lucha Vavoom, tequila/honey/lemon) which wasn't what I call 'on the strong side' but matched well with the AMAZING meal we ate.I ordered the mushroom-barley veggie burger topped with thinly sliced bread and butter pickles, a cabbage slaw and french fries. Honestly the best veggie burger i've ever had. Split with my date was a grilled flat iron steak. Prefered on our end was rare style. Came with fingerlings and a herb salad (I disliked) and was drowned in beef au ju, yum yum slurp slurp.

Visited while on a date during the last restaurant week. I loved the decor and the service was great. We were seated at a communal table but we still had plenty of room. We ordered a salmon dish and their fried chicken. We ended up liking the salmon dish more. The fried chicken was good, but I was expecting more due to the hype I had received about Buttermilk Channel's chicken.

Was a solid 3, if it was a bit cheaper would have been a 4....but its not so its a 3.Pretty busy place so service was a little run off their feet but everyone was having a nice sunny Saturday so was cool taking our time etc.

Came here on a Sunday for brunch at 11am, and was quoted 1 hour wait for 4 people. The restaurant is rather small, with tables kinda on top of one another - definitely not a place to bring a stroller, in fact, they ask for you to leave it up front. There are also a few tables in the patio out front (less of a wait) and bar seating (first come, first served). The wait list is never ending here, it was one party after another coming into the restaurant. I believe they do take reservations, but we didn't realize until after we arrived. Finally after about 1 hour and 20 minutes, we were seated in a larger table by the front of the restaurant. We ordered their homemade pickles to start, and their buttermilk pancakes to share. The larger long pickles were delicious however, I wasn't a big fan of the ones that were sliced in thin pieces - they were very saturated in this tangy tasting pickle juice. The buttermilk pancakes came in an order of 3 super fluffy and delicious pancakes with a dusting of powdered sugar, served with butter and syrup.For the entree, I ordered the fried pork chop with cheddar waffles. It was a large piece of breaded pork chop, not too dry, and well seasoned. The cheddar waffles paired perfectly with it, just the right around of cheddar and not too heavy of a batter. It was also served with a small bed of greens. I tried my friend's mushroom scramble and it was pretty delicious. The scramble was served with a piece of hash brown that looked super crispy. I tried their classic Bloody Mary - the menu states it's very spicy (it's really not). The bloody was very thick and tasty. It is only served with a piece of pickle - no olives nor the works. They have another Bloody Mary option that is served with an east coast oyster sitting on top of the glass - it looked rather interesting. I will probably try that next time. Definitely one of my new favorite brunch spots in NYC. Highly recommend - just make sure you make a reservation!

Gotta be honest, I do not understand the hype. Am I missing something? Hour wait. Average food. I'd compare it to good airport food. We had the salmon plate and grilled cheese with a side of biscuits. Not memorable.

Smart looking restaurant dressed in buttermilk yellow.  Filling up at 6:00 packed by 7:00 on a Saturday night.  This restauarant seemed to have it all: Good service, nice ambiance, and a fine selection of seafood, vegetable and meat dishes to choose from.  Seating at the bar for drinking and eating was relaxed and enjoyable.  Started with a couple cocktails.  Oysters from PEI, Mussels in a white wine sauce and Whole Trout with charred broccolini were all well prepared, delicious and enough tfor two of us to split with some room left to spare for a desert.  Solid 4 stars.

The pork chop and cheddar waffles you must try.The biscuits are amazingly delicious I did try the pecan French toast, had to share cos it's almost impossible to eat it all again except you have a super sweet tooth.Would definitely recommend/ come here again

Ok I went here with high expectations and the fried chicken and waffle did not live up to it. The chicken was veryy dry, I had to cover it in the syrup just to make it tasty. The waffle was good but probably won't be back, I left a little underwhelmed.
* The Fried Chicken & Waffles is a MUST* The Corn Bread is delicious* The Mussles are a MUST HAVE!Overall, very good restaurant, great atmosphere.  I'll definitely be back!

My boyfriend and I shared an order of the hash short ribs, fried pork and cheddar waffles, a side of bacon and a single pancake. The portions were fairly large for my small stomach. In reality we could have probably just shared an entree with the two sides. The short rib hash were pretty disappointing. The highlight of the dish was probably just the two fried eggs. The rib was dry and had no flavor. The hash was just little pieces of potato. The next time I dine here, I would definitely skip the hash and probably just order an appetizer, the fried pork with cheddar waffles a side of bacon, and a single pancake.

I don't know if I've ever had a dish that was so good it made me angry, but the Pecan French Toast here did that. Angry because after my first bite, I didn't understand why I hadn't eaten it every weekend since moving to New York. It is a "where have you been all my life?" type dish--delicious, ethereal. Of course it's not good for you, and it's so rich I would recommend you bring along a dining companion or two and split it, but good lord, order it.The rest of the experience at Buttermilk Channel is just as good. I've only been there for brunch, but have eaten across the menu--from the scrambles to the grilled cheese--and can honestly recommend everything I've had.It is a wait, particularly if you show up at peak brunch hours (say, 11:30 onwards). There isn't much of a waiting area, either, but the waits are generally as advertised, and the weekend maitre d' is one of the nicest people I've ever met--genuine, welcoming and proactive. Give her a raise! Or maybe just free French toast for life.

This has been one of my favorite places to dine in Brooklyn because of the menu and it was the place I met the great love of my life, until yesterday. Having ordered our meal and enjoying a side of Hash Browns until a hair was the first of my disappointing experience. While the manager came over, he was rather flat in his apology and made no offer of a guest recovery until my partner interjected the fact that this issue resulted in me not wanting to continue eating my meal. Further points include, One, we only saw our server twice and the second time was him dropping check and you really don't even want to know the observations of the kitchen and the actions of the entire crew including the Chef.   I know, as an Executive Chef there are many challenges in this business but it is my absolute undeniable responsibility as the last hands and eyes on every single plate to ensure and exceed every guests expectations.
Not worth the 2 hour wait.. just to sit at a communal table. Chicken is good. Not the best.
Amazing food always, cool vibes! My go to brunch spot! The fried pork shop and their pancakes are must-haves!

Now, I wasn't sober when I went here. But I can confidently say that this place has THE best French Toast  in New York (ice cream and molasses. WHAT MORE COULD U WANT). *also* wait to be seated wasn't horrible, nor was the wait for the food!

Loved this place. Took a chance on a random Saturday that they would have a table for 2 and they did! It was definitely packed so you knew it was going to be good. It looks a bit fancy but it's very affordable. The food was delicious my boyfriend won't stop talking about it. The staff was friendly and always showed up at the right time. Can't wait to go back!

I had really high hopes for the pecan French toast after reading all the reviews but my sister and I were disappointed. My first bite of it was a letdown. It was way too sweet and indulgent for me esp since it was literally drenched in a pool of syrup. I feel like I gained 10 lbs and 4 cavities after eating this. On the other hand, the pork chop and cheddar waffles were surprisingly good. The pork chop was sliced thick, crisply breaded and seasoned well, and cooked perfectly. I didn't taste too much cheddar in the waffles but I think it was made with a corn meal batter which was an interesting change in a good way. I'll have to return for dinner to try to chicken and waffles!If you come here definitely get the buttermilk biscuits!! $6 for 2 of them that comes with butter and strawberry jam. They're huge, crispy on the outside and super soft on the inside.

Be sure to get there early as sometimes there is a wait for brunch. Truly one of the best places I have ever had brunch. Their pecan pie French toast is delicious, love their ABC Grilled Cheese too. During dinner tine I always go with the classic fried chicken and cheddar waffle. No matter how many people are in my party the service is always amazing. The decor is very homey and I always enjoy coming here to have some delicious comfort food.So happy to have this gem in my neighborhood!
Went here after graduation.  The food us great especially the popovers. The staff was so accommodating and the porkchop delicious and juicy.

Finally made my way to this gem. Upside: food and service. As good as advertised! Pancakes were HUMONGOUS (perfect for sharing) and the bacon was some of the best I've ever had! All the food that came out around me looked delish as well. Downside: The wait was close to an hour (arrived at noon on Sunday) but Lisa (who greeted us pleasantly at the door and we later discovered was the owner) made the wait enjoyable by offering us coffee and/or cocktails. If/when I'm back I'll come towards the beginning or end of the brunch rush (which was hard to gauge because even at 2pm there was still a steady crowd!)

Came here on two occasions for brunch! It gets super crowded so be prepared to wait atleast 15-20 mins. Get the homemade buttermilk biscuits!! This is a must try when here. Also get an eggs Benedict with mimosa. Amazing food, eat slow and savor!

I never ever write reviews, but this magical place deserves one.  I drove in from CT to meet my son and his friends for his birthday on Saturday night.  We were a diverse group to say the least in age, appearance (my son's newly dyed purple hair!) and culinary preferences (vegetarian to carnivorous).  The evening, thanks to the amazing hospitality of Jen (the manager) and Tom (the owner), the table service and the fabulous food was a huge success!  I honestly didn't think this kind of restaurant still existed in this day and age. They had never set eyes on us before, yet made us feel like family regulars.  We will definitely be back.

Cute restaurant! It was very busy Sunday morning for brunch but our wait was only about 20-25 min for 5 people so not too bad! Very nice customer service we ordered coffee and lattes while we waited for our table. Our waitress was very sweet as well and attentive.We first ordered a Walnut Sticky Bun to share for the table and it was pretty good! Sweet, soft texture. For my meal, I ordered the roasted mushroom, and spinach scramble with cheddar cheese instead of goat cheese. The dish also came with a hash brown and side salad which I enjoyed. I also tried a piece of my friends Pecan Pie French Toast and it was so delicious! It was really creamy and sweet with a whipped cream topping. I was in the mood for something savory but if I wanted a sweet dish for brunch I definitely would've ordered it because it was so good!

Came here at 9pm on a Sunday and it was packed! Ate at the bar. Ordered the burger (medium rare) and it did not disappoint. Delicious. Friendly bartender and wait staff. Will go back to try the fried chicken.

The food at BC brunch is amazing and the service was great. We waited 45 minutes on a busy Sunday in February to be seated by the window and they served us coffee while we waited. The French toast was the best gene ch toast I ever had. It was almost like bread pudding that melted in your mouth. My eggs Benedict was tasty but I was more focused on the French toast. The staff were very accommodating and the atmosphere is perfect for any situation.
Omg. Every thing on this menu is delish!!!!Service is wonderful, location divine and the decor is stunning.

Came here with some friends before heading to Other Half at the advice of basically everyone.I got the ABC Grilled Cheese and a walnut sticky bun, and my friends both went for short rib hash. All of our meals came with a sort of mixed green side salad.The sticky bun came out first, and was every bit as warm, gooey, soft, and sweet as hoped for. It was also much larger than expected, given the $4 price point.My sandwich was really, really good. The bacon was deeply smokey, and the cheese nice and rich and salty. The apples and aioli were less noticeable forces, though they added a subtle sweet/tartness and richness, and were excellent complements. On top of that, the bread was perfectly crisped. Though I don't typically enjoy salad much, the side salad was actually pretty good. I do, however, wish they had listed on the menu that the side a salad as I probably would have subbed it out for something else since it seemed they had many other better, more filling/indulgent sides.I did try to the short rib hash and thought it was OK though not amazing. My friends seemed to like it, but they didn't rave.Generally a really enjoyable meal, and I will probably be back when next in the area.
This place is the best place for branch and dinners Their desserts are the best thing ever!They are not cheap but worth every penny

the food was very good.  i think it's one of my favorites now.  i definitely plan to be back.  the service was incredible our waitress was so kind and extremely helpful.  great place to go with your friends and family.

Came here for my birthday dinner and couldn't have been more impressed with the meal. Started with the popovers, which is how how every meal should be started here. My steak with garlic butter was cooked perfectly and the fried chicken also received rave reviews. Finished dinner with an incredible ice cream sundae that was easily shared between 2-3 people. Highly recommend Buttermilk Channel for a nice dinner, but now I can't wait to come back to try their brunch!

Disappointed .We recently went for brunch on Sunday with a group of 6 .We had read many reviews that raved about the food .We were seated right away as we arrived just as they opened .Sadly ,we waited 55 minutes for our meal to arrive .My eggs were watery ,my friend's toast was burnt and my partner's meal was served cold and  he thought the biscuits were dry and tasted stale. The only item that was good were the pancakes .Our waitress was less than attentive ,but not unfriendly .Would not recommend .Over rated from our experience .

Really disappointed. I read amazing reviews about the ambiance, food, etc., but what a letdown.  We were the 2nd group in the restaurant on Sunday, at 10:05am, and we were finally served at 10:55am. The food was cold, the biscuits were stale and even though our server was friendly, we were neglected. The kitchen is obviously not equipped to service the crowd that appears for brunch at 10am. Our out-of-town guests said their food was awful: "how can someone mess up toast?"  Won't be coming back or recommending this overrated place. Don't believe the Hype.

Although I've been here several times since moving to the area a couple years ago, I haven't been back since our last visit. While our waitress was collecting our menus, my husband asked to have a side of fries added to his order. She replied "WE DON'T HAVE RICE" so quickly, we didn't have the chance to correct her before she turned on her heel and left to put our orders in. Uhhhh excuse me? Just because we're Asian doesn't mean we have to have rice at every meal. I was so offended and shocked that this would happen in Brooklyn in 2018, but I guess there are insulated pockets in even the most cultural cities. I get that she simply misheard, but it's the underlying prejudice that I perceived behind her reason for mishearing that offended me (husband was too nice to mention it). It's a shame; we live down the street and their fried pork chop really is delicious, but this experience left a bad taste in my mouth. For everyone saying their short rib hash is dry af, I totally agree as this used to be my go-to dish at Buttermilk. Highly recommend the hash at Stone Park Cafe instead - worth the extra walk, and the service is lovely.

I live nearby and have been coming for brunch for years but had never made it for dinner. Since my gf and I are trying to hit all the top rated burgers in the city, Buttermilk was on the list. I was not disappointed. Excellent burger and my gf had the market vegetable bowl.  We also had popovers and mussels for a first course.  It was all excellent. In addition, i had some reservation issues with open table unilaterally cancelling my reservation but the restaurant was very friendly and helpful about making sure we did not get bumped.  So, all i can say is come for any meal-you will not be disappointed!

Wonderful staff. There is always a wait for brunch but it is worth it and they really do try to seat you as soon as possible. The manager once became very upset and was sure to seat us right away and give us an item off of our bill for having to wait longer then she liked. The french toast is delicious, cheddar waffles are scrumptious, everything brunch is delicious. The burger is also delicious. Yum. Go.

This place was ehhhhh I guess because I came during the weekend where most of the dishes aren't served such as the fried chicken images as you guys see. I was so disappointed with the brunch especially the fact that the only type of meat they had was fried pork and waffles. So I went and ordered the fried pork with waffles it was extremely bland. My mother had the rib hash she enjoyed it but me personally when I tasted it I felt like the ribs hash was pretty dry. The waffles from the pork chops were pretty good such as soft and fluffy which made it more enjoyable. Also, I had the pancakes which I felt like it was pretty good and a side fries but overall this place is cool I'm never coming here for brunch on the weekends because of the menu. Maybe during the week but the staff is wonderful service was extremely great. But like I said for the weekends this won't be one of my go to restaurants.
Awesome brunch! A long wait but worth it! Pork chops are my favorite, and the fluffy pancakes are to die for so light.
This was a decent spot.  Wasn't the best thing ever but pretty solid.  Want to return for brunch/breakfast if I'm back in area

I rarely write Yelp reviews but had to for this place. I showed up and was told there was a 45 min wait so turned around and immediately began to walk out the door. The hostess not only chased me down to clarify if I would like my name on the list, she chased me down a SECOND time to let me know that two spots had opened at the bar and that if I ran to snag them we could eat immediately.Highly recommend

Would give -5 stars if I could! Had a 5 o'clock reservation for a party of 5 (including children). Showed up 14 minutes early and was asked to leave and come back at 5....it is -10 degrees outside!!Cancelled my reservation and went to the welcoming Mexican restaurant next door instead. Ridiculous!

SO GOOD. Came with a group of four for dinner and had an excellent time. This is going to be a boring review because it's so positive. Food: 5 StarsWe couldn't decide on just one thing, so we chose to order several first courses and snacks to share. I was going to list highlights but I stopped because every single thing was a highlight. Found myself wanting to meet the chef. Cocktails: 5 StarsI had a Sailor's Knot, which was like a hot toddy and aromatic and just perfect. My husband had the Old Gal and my sip of it was also excellent. Ambience: 5 StarsHas a down home, farmhouse vibe, but upscale, charming, and clean. Service: 5 StarsOur server was warm, friendly, and helpful. Very patient and kind. Answered questions with a smile and seamlessly handed us off to the next person at the end of her shift. We live on the UWS and it takes 50 minutes to get here but I don't care... we will be back to try brunch for sure!

Came here for my sisters birthday, and had a wonderful experience. The restaurant was pack and that speaks volumes of their quality of food and service. The food was amazing and the servers were quick and polite. Will definitely be coming back.
The steak was really good and so was the amaretto sours. The lighting is really dim. The service was mediocre. The desert was also super rich and good - a milkshake
Short rib was very dry.The French toast was more like cake then toast. I think this place is over hyped.

Very nice place with tasty and healthy food. We sat at the bar and was very pleased with the food and customer service. The wines are amazing. This is a neighborhood gem. The staff were very welcoming and the food was delicious I would recommend this place to all.

Service was a bit slow, and our server was pretty unenthusiastic and slow to attend to us, but I'm used to this in NYC. In terms of food, we ordered the popovers, sweet potato soup and lamb salad. The soup was incredibly sweet and must have had added sugar/honey in it, as it was literally the sweetest sweet potato soup I've ever tasted. The popovers were interesting in texture, nice and soft, but a bit too salty as they had been sprinkled with large pieces of rock salt (which stuck to the honey) - it would have been better to have the honey/salt on the side in my opinion. The lamb salad was fairly nice. The lamb was very well cooked and fell apart easily, and the cauliflower was nicely roasted, however the salad as a whole was also way too salty. Overall, the food wasn't terrible, but I think the chefs need to tone down the over seasoning, as it could have been great if not for the over sweetening/saltiness.
Good brunch place. Nice environment, delicious food. The Benedict is recommended. The service is good too. Recommend to go there whether alone or with someone.
Excellent customer service, like, over the top . Ambiance was good, food was yummy, drinks were great. I heard this is Beyoncé favorite spot, I can see why lol.

The Butter milk channel is a great place. Went there for brunch after clay church service with my Family the food was amazing. I had the red velvet waffles and pork chop. The waffles were fluffy and rich in texture but not to sweet. The pork chop was very well seasoned and mimosas were good as well but took a while to get to the table Howe it was busy at the time and my wait for the table was not very long.The service was good my server Lindsay was very attentive.

Brunch: our table ordered the pork chop with waffles, the short rib hash, the burger and the egg Huntington. The pork chop won and the burger (skip it) the alcohol was great. They were very patient and kind.
We love this place for both brunch and dinner. Lovely ambience and the food is great. The fried pork chop and scrambles are awesome.

This has been in my bookmarks forever and we FINALLY got a chance to eat brunch here. It was AMAZING. We'll definitely be adding this to our brunch rotation.My family was in town from DC & Baltimore on the weekend after Thanksgiving so I wanted to take them to eat lots of yummy food while in town. We came here for Saturday brunch because as soon as I read "Fried porkchop & cheddar waffle" out loud to the group, they were sold (in fact, clamoring to go is a better way to describe it).Half of us ordered the porkchop & waffle and the other half ordered short rib hash and the Eggs Huntington. I wanted to get the Portland but, since my boyfriend was getting it, I know I'd get to eat some of his so I went with the Eggs Huntington because I was super intrigued by the biscuits.The fried porkchop and cheddar waffle was the absolute star here. Everything else was really good too but the porkchop was UNBELIEVABLE. The most tender pork with a perfect crispy shell paired with a savory and fluffy waffle perfect, for soaking up maple syrup. YUM. Also the portion was huge but everyone finished that bad boy right up!We also got the Star of the Sea Bloody Mary. It was made with celery and peppercorn infused vodka and garnished with a shocked oyster. I loved it! Excited to go back and try the other versions too! Oh! And they have decaf coffee - YAY!

Did not eat here, just went in for a drink. Nice interior design, only one bathroom ( insufficient for the size of the place IMO) and they tax you for your drink even if you don't eat. I had a Macellan 12 and had to pay tax over the price. I think it's uncommon in NYC, but then again, correct me if I'm wrong.

I've been here quite a few times and I'm always happy and full when I leave. This week I came for brunch. The wait was 45 minutes but I knew it would be worth it. My friend and I ended up sitting at the bar after waiting about 35-40 minutes. Had a tasty Bloody Mary (they have a few options on the menu) and then we both ordered pancakes. The biggest pancakes you've ever seen. So fluffy. Neither one of us could finish so when the bartender told us they "travel well" I decided to take them to go. They were put in a container with the contents and date written on the top (cute touch). And I devoured them the next day. Still just as tasty. Buttermilk Channel never disappoints.

I came here to eat with my boyfriend and cousin as we stayed in Brooklyn for the evening. Luckily we got there before there was a wait to be seated. The restaurant is a bit tight but it adds to the charm. Our brunch was delicious and their pancakes were perfectly fluffy.

I've been here twice now and I love it!!!! Can be a long line so1 make reservations2 come early3 stalk the bar seating4 be patientThe hostess the last time I was there was crazy nice and helpful.   And remembered my name and who I was when I left!!!!! Impressive!Had the eggs benedict twice, since if that's on the menu I cant help but order it... it comes with salad which I dont eat and would prefer anything else especially potatoes.   The potatoes a la carte are really good (except the waitress forgot to put it in on my second visit and by the time I realized they were never coming just left it out... dissapointed.   I also told her to leave off the salad but she wasn't taking notes which granted many waiters don't and well... she probably should)Back to my food.  The sticky bun is also delish, ordered everything on my first visit.  Coffee extra they give in a nice little pourer container which I loved!!!! That way doesnt mess up my cream sugar ratio part way through.Ambiance is cute fancy cottage type appeal.Downside - 1 bathroom and theres always a wait...
I came for brunch for my birthday and it was delicious...Love this place I would absolutely come back

Would consider the food a solid 3.5 stars but rounding down because of the service. We were quoted 20-30 minutes when we first arrived at 1 pm or so on a Sunday, and the wait ended up being close to twice that (even more frustrating was the fact that we got a text that our table was ready and then had to stand awkwardly in the foyer for another ~20 minutes or so). Likely as an "apology" for the wait, we were brought over a walnut sticky bun before our meal, which was delicious and large - would definitely get again at $4.For our mains, my boyfriend ordered the pancakes ($12) and I had the short rib hash ($16). He also ordered a cold brew and sides of bacon and biscuits; of the three, only the biscuits came. The bacon was forgotten altogether, but the cold brew made it onto the check which we had to get taken off.  Short rib hash was meh. It was extremely, extremely dry,but did have a good flavor to it. The fried eggs on top, however, were cooked perfectly. Portion size was a little smaller than I would have liked. My boyfriend liked the pancakes, which were massive.All in all, I can't see myself rushing back. Food was solid, but nothing that could force me to overlook the major stumbles in service.

My taste buds were in heaven!! So when we arrived, for a party of 2, the wait was less than 10mins on a Sunday brunch day. We ordered an egg scramble with mushroom, spinach and subbed goat cheese for cheddar. They were very accommodating and BOY OH BOY, was this DELICIOUS! I couldn't decide on a favorite but was able to have the hash brown without ketchup and still be blown out of this world. The drinks were good but coffee is the way to go here! The atmosphere was electric with the convos of everyone in the dining room. It wasn't too loud nor quiet and it was perfect. Our waitperson was very attentive and took care of us. We plan on passing on a Monday evening for the $40, 3 course dinner. We are happy to have visited. (We ordered the scramble, pancakes, bacon and biscuits.) Oh yeah, I nearly forgot, the jelly on the biscuit . You get the jist, it is a must-try!
Took my dog here for his birthday, we sat outside. Had the chicken and waffles loved it. Shared it with my pups. A+ to any place that allows pets. food was awesome.
I had lunch time. This restaurant was very nice! I wanna try dinner next time.

If I could give a zero star, I would. This establishment wasn't welcoming to minorities and I wasn't fond on how Jennifer treated her staff, she was very passive aggressive and standoffish. They should work on their customer service in regards to people of color. I was very disappointed since I wanted to go to this restaurant for a while.

If you haven't made it to Buttermilk Channel for brunch or dinner, then you're missing out on some of the most delicious food in Carroll Gardens. I ordered the Eggs Huntington, and tried the Bourbon Pecan French Toast, Short Rib Hash. All were fantastic meals! You must come here to try their biscuits! They are the real deal!

The ambiance was super low and romantic here they play cool music ...some tracks from the 80's and the 90's cool laid back vibe ..good chicken ask for the pieces you desire as they bring out any piece of the chicken ......the waiter was really sweet. I had the flat iron steak and potatoes it was great a but under cooked for me but none the less still a good meal. Would come back when its not as much street work being done. We drove to the restaurant there was no parking which is to be expected in this area but then the streets were blocked off for road work -the staff are wonderul the foood is fresh def a lovely spot to have dinne

Dinner for five last night. Simply perfect. Best chicken liver mousse I've ever had, even better than mine. Beautiful beer-steamed mussels. Excellent cocktails, ciders, wines by the glass. Entrees sublime. Everybody "does" fried chicken and waffles, but these people do it right. Friendly AND professional service. Reasonable cost considering all the drinks, appetizers, desserts, etc. I think I'll go back for brunch tomorrow!!

A little pricy but the food is amazing! Breakfast, lunch and dinner always great, they always have an option for vegan just Incase you were wondering. For a breakfast option if you like eggs there with mushrooms this is yummy! Oh and they actually serve fresh squeeze juice for the healthy ones and if you like dessert they got it covered!
Nice place. Smallish, but good food menu. Drinks ok. Good place with kids and moderate sized groups.Staff is always friendly.

Best pecan pie French toast... the sides are crispy and perfectly custard in the center. Pictures don't do it justice. The fried pork chop is delicious as well... taste like shake and bake lolThey don't take reservations for brunch and the wait can be long. Last time I went, table for 2 was an hour wait BUT for the French toast it's worth the wait to me. Would be nice if they lower the music inside so we don't ALL have to scream to have a conversation.
I've been for brunch and dinner and had really nice experiences both times. Food is classic, well-executed and comes out pretty quickly, and the staff is friendly. A solid Brooklyn restaurant.

We got seated quickly for having arrived at 11:30. Bloody Mary's are really good. Seems like they use homemade pickles.I wasn't too excited about the food. I got the pork and waffles and the pork just looked really kinda weird, the waffles were nothing special, and it came with a salad that had enough salt on it to cure the pork. Friend got the chorizo egg scramble which was fine. The toast did not come with jam or butter. Looking at other people's food when it came out....I definitely would get the buttermilk pancakes if I go again.

Made a reservation for a Fri night pretty easily. Sat right away, very friendly and attentive service. A little too dark and tables squeezed in tightly. We had the meatloaf & the fried chicken. Both were ok, neither were stellar. They brought a candle with dessert for anniv celebration which was nice. We trekked to BK from queens based on the reputation, but would have to say the food was somewhat disappointing. Very good service, decent ambiance, but overhyped.

My sister and I rushed here on a Saturday thinking there would be a long wait time, but we were actually seated right away and even found parking right in front! Environment was very typical, your average "American bistro." We ordered fresh toast, the loax scramble, mushroom and spinach scramble, and a side of fries. The food came out rather quickly and tasted great. I was eager to try the French toast since many reviews and photos mentioned it, but I wasn't that impressed. The pecan flavor added a nice touch, though. Something to try if you're a big French toast person, I suppose. Everything else was very delicious! Service was decent, nothing outstanding. We basically had to get the staff's attention about everything (boxing food, getting check, taking our card for payment, etc.).

Food was great but service was horrible. I went with a group of friends for my birthday brunch and I felt like the kids were left at home alone to run the show. At one point both the hostess and waitress were actually seated with friends eating, While having "bottomless" drinks and therefore we couldn't get our drinks during the scheduled time. Would love to come back when the grownups are in! Loved the food!

Went here for brunch this weekend. They don't take reservations for brunch so it was a 40 wait.  Had the short rib hash. It was delicious!! Portions are generous.  My friends had the fried pork chops and cheddar waffle and pancakes. While they enjoyed the waffle and pancakes they were less than thrilled with the pork chop.  Service was ok. Not great but they were friendly and upbeat.

A decent soul food spot to get your chicken wing & waffle fix. Unfortunately I did not get a chance to try that since it was only available on the dinner menu, but I did try their buttermilk pancake & eggs benny. Very filling and tasty. Maybe I'll come again to their chicken & waffle for dinner.

Fried chicken is pretty delish! Everything is a homemade recipe and you can tell. Slaw is great also. However I did have an issue with the service. The waitresses seemed like it was an inconvenience of us being there. No smiles no pleasantries just get in and get out. Delivery is recommended.

Awesome Sauce!!!!!! So from the scrambled menu I had the Scrambled eggs with Esposito sausage with peppers & onions! It was oh so amazing! The whole dish was perfectly paired with a salad and hash brown!  Pssst the Bellini's are amazing!

Had my birthday dinner here last Saturday night. Heard great things about this place but mostly for brunch. Tried the bacon, popovers, and cornbread for appetizers which were all great. For the main course, I tried the chicken and waffles and duck meatloaf. The fried chicken was juicy and plentiful. The waffle however was on the soggy side. Still a great dish but a crispier waffle would be better. The duck meatloaf was not as good. I understand duck is kinda salty already but this meatloaf needed less salt. The mashed potato/corn sauce provided some sanctuary from the salty meatloaf. The place was busy but we had to wait more than an hour for our food. I would expect a little quicker service especially with a reservation. Nonetheless, I'll have to stop by here for brunch one day.

Finally made it for a dinner.  Got there at 5, just when they Opened for dinner. And the place was fully packed within minutes.  Great service. They were very attentive to us and our baby girl.  Great drinks selection.  My 5 stars are really for the their Saturday night lobster special. Wow.  I ordered the special and my husband got the chicken dish simply because they're know for it. And he sort of wished he went with the lobster special as well.  It was probably the best lobster dish we ever had.  We ordered a salad as appetizer but I wish our waitress would have told us both of our entrees came with salad.  Great place. Cannot wait to go back and try something else.

Ambiance is nice, waitress was pleasant, however those are the only positives about this restaurant. Food is very bland. I went with 3 other people and we were all dissatisfied with our meals (lasagna, chicken and waffles, lamb salad, poppers, cornbread, maple bacon almonds). The waffles and cornbread were dry and served lukewarm. Definitely not worth then money.

I came again for lunch for my birthday. This time I tried the ABC grilled cheese. It was pretty good. The apples gave the sandwich a nice sweetness/tartness to it. It was a nice balance against the heavy oils and salt of the bacon and cheese. The order of grilled cheese comes with a side of pickles. I'd like to thank the exceptional waiter who told me that when I tried to  order the grilled cheese AND an additional side order of pickles. He kindly told me that my grilled cheese already comes with the same amount of pickles as the side order, and asked if I wanted to order a different side instead. Which, of course I did. Thank you sir for pointing that out. It's something small but some waiters probably wouldn't care and wouldn't have said anything that you're getting the same thing twice.Fried porkchops with waffles and beer mussels were still amazing.

Lovely brunch spot but there's almost always a wait on the weekends so be prepared. Staff was friendly and service is quick. I enjoyed the welcoming rustic vibes and there's even outdoor seating!Fried pork chop and cheddar waffles: YES! The pork chop was freshly fried and came out piping hot so the coating was still nice and crunchy. The meat was flavorful and juicy (a little too salty but went well with the sweetness from the syrup). The cheddar waffles were very cheddary indeed. Not sure if I can justify paying $18 for this again but it was good.House made pickles: This is a must get it if you like pickles, especially bread and butter pickles. It comes with an assortment of pickles and went well with the pork chop.Pecan pie French toast: A lot of reviews raved about the french toast so I had to give it a try but it was just alright to me. The first couple bites were good but I wasn't the biggest fan of the texture since it resembled bread pudding more than toast. However, I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't overly sweet, in fact it was just the right amount of sweetness for someone to eat as an entree though I would say this is the perfect dish for sharing.
Standard brunch spot. The food is good. I would definitely  go back. I don't give it five stars because the food is nothing spectacular but was good.

Love this place, I have been here only for brunch on a Sunday morning. I try to get here early before they get crazy busy. The food is good the wait staff are pleasant. A great place to spend a Sunday morning.

What a great brunch spot for a double date!  Buttermilk Channel has been on my hit list for a long time, and I'm glad I finally got to experience this last Sunday, first thing in the early afternoon.Seating is first come, first brunch, so we showed up around 12:30PM for our table of four.  Luckily, we were seated in the immediate left corner upon entering and got to sit on their wooden benches by the window.  If you sweat easily, I wouldn't opt to sit here.  It was a bit warm here, but that didn't stop me from having two full coffee cups during our meal.Decisions were made with care, and I decided on the Pecan Pie French Toast.  The first word in their ingredients is "bourbon."  Boozy brunch?  Yes please!  This was PERFECT to get my sugar-y high, and really filled my sweet tooth!  Sharing is encouraged, but this was highly addictive.  French Toast lovers beware - this is your new love!My second runner up was definitely the Short Rib Hash.  Good LORD was that savory and cooked to shredded perfection!  Every offered bite from my hubby was another way he was saying, "I love you; I'm sacrificing this perfect bite."Cash and credit is welcome here, and be sure to come hungry, because you're not eating until hours later!

What a great little spot nestled in Brooklyn Heights! At first, I wasn't sure about the place because the menu was so limited - but what they do have on the menu is prepared to perfection! I had the oysters, lasagna and a lovely little cheese platter for dessert. Never had oysters so delicious! The food was great - didn't need to flicker any salt over anything. I was seated right away and the waitress was attentive while not being overly so as if to make you feel that she wanted you to vacate and turn over the table. My vodka tonic was so good, I needed to order a few more before my night ended.  I will definitely be back. This time, I am ordering a crap load of oysters!

Came here with a group of friends for my birthday celebration and when i saw the menu, i was feeling weird about the choices on the menu. We ordered food and drinks, our waitress was super nice and assistive with our choices. When the food and drinks arrived, i was like wow ok. Now mind you I ordered the chicken and waffle. I didn't think i would finish my food because i thought it was alot but nope. Man oh man i finished everything, the chicken was seasoned very well and so good although i wasn't a fan of the syrup for the waffle. Though trust the chicken is juicy enough to eat with the waffle as is in my book.I truly recommend this restaurant, it has a good atmosphere, good food and drinks.You will not be disappointed at all.

What a lovely spot ! Skip the review and just pay it a visit. The service, decor, dishes are all fantastic here.The vibe is right in here.  I saw folks with the babies, folks just hanging with the homies, dates, and that weird guy sitting by himself(just kidding).The flowers on the table were so beautiful.  Really appreciated them, most place that have flowers out don't tend to have such vibrant ones.The picnic table we sat at was nice. Really supports socializing...it worked in our favor this time :)Staff was fantastic. Talk about accommodating and following up. Really made us feel welcome and appreciated. Bravo!Food was interesting. Really had some pretty dishes. Come with an open mind :) and just make sure you order enough. I had just gotten the squash tart. Although it satisfied my eyes the tummy needed about 5 of them jk .that is just me though.Anyhow I would definitely go again and highly recommend this spot.Enjoy the pics and videos :)

This place SUUUUCKS! My husband and I are locals and we never tried this place, so we went this morning for brunch. I ordered the ABC Grilled Cheese, which is a grilled cheese with apples, bacon and cheddar. I mean, how can you screw up a grilled cheese??? Well, we now know. The cook did not ever cook the sandwich on the grill!!! He/she/they took two pieces of stale wheat bread, two plain old thin apple slices, barely cooked bacon and a massive hunk of cheese and smushed it into a panini press. The cheese was completely uncooked and not at all melted, the sandwich was not even buttered on the outside, the meat was practically raw and the apple slices were not even seasoned! They looked like those crappy sliced you get from a bag out of a kids meal at McDonalds. WORST GRILLED CHEESE EVER! I paid $14 for something that I could have made at home for less than one dollar. Not only that, it was served on a plate with a MASSIVE (and I mean massive) pile of pickles. There were more pickles than sandwich. 6 giant pickle slices topped with thin slices of pickles. Who in their right mind eats a sandwich with a bowl of pickles? There was a "salad" on top of the pickles, by that I mean 5 leaves on top of my pickle pile, which had so much salt on it that it was untouchable. My husband and I have been sick from the food all day. He vomited and has an iron stomach. I am just eating TUMS and waiting for the nausea to pass. Avoid this place at all costs. I am not writing this review because I am pissed about the price, I am writing a review this bad because it genuinely was this bad! No joke!

My wife and I went to go grab brunch today. We live in the neighborhood and was always curious about this place. I am from the south so I wanted to get a good ol southern inspired breakfast. I always saw this place packed. So I thought it was going to be great.  I am sorry to say. But this place is Not very good. It has a great atmosphere, but the food is too over priced and the food tasted very poor. Now when I say the food tastes poor, I should had said that the food just tasted like Salt. I have never had so much salt in a meal before. Hell the salad that came with my eggs Benedict tasted like a whole packet of salt was mixed in with it. The eggs Benedict was just Ok.  It was cooked right. But yet again the eggs were so salty. I don't get heart burn often, but once I got home I had to go buy some Tums and then I vomited .  Way too much salt that it has made my stomach unsettled for 6 hours now. Next the price of the meals, etc were way to over priced. I wanted to get a waffle on the side of the meal which was $6. When I got it. They only gave me one half of a waffle. I asked the waitress where the other half was and she said that that was how they serve it. Come on now, how cheap and greedy can a place be to only give a customer a half of a waffle and charge $6. I wish I could get my money back, so I could had gotten a better breakfast at my local bodega. Don't believe all the rave reviews of this place. It is all hype and not very good. I recommend going to Moms in Long Island City for good brunch.

One of the perks of NYC Restaurant Week, is exploring new neighborhoods and discovering new dishes.After my preliminary research online, I read that this American bistro in Carroll Gardens is best known for its "duck meatloaf and buttermilk fried chicken with cheddar waffles." Why not? I have had chicken and waffles before, but I love to see how chefs reinvent this popular dish. It was packed inside. Given the anticipated downpour, no one risked dining outdoors. We were warmly greeted by the hostess and server.If you want to read the menu, bring a flashlight. I am all for ambiance, but not at the detriment of my eyesight (especially since I wear glasses). Even with the candle on the table, the lighting was way too dim for me to order. Thankfully, I already knew what I had in mind for the $42 prix fixe dinner. It was a three-course meal - appetizer: market greens salad (mustard greens, peaches, radish, black olives & shallot vinaigrette); entree: buttermilk fried chicken (cheddar waffles & savoy cabbage slaw); dessert: mini pecan sundae (vanilla ice cream and whipped cream).Delicious. I will admit, I was a bit hesitant about the cheddar waffle and  maple syrup mixed with balsamic vinaigrette. When that entree was placed on the table, my eyes grew wide lol at the large portion. Delicious meal. Great service. Full tummies. All smiles. Even the bathroom was nice, neat, and spacious.I thought it was nice to see how much they value customer feedback when the server handed me a comment card, but that just isn't my style. My handwriting isn't always the greatest so I have got to give the exclusive to Yelp. :)

Love the vibe and ambiance as soon we stepped  in   It could have been a 35 minute wait at 12:30pm on a Saturday if we didn't nab a spot for two at the counter.  Coffee was immediately served ...  unfortunately didn't pass the coffee snob in me.  It was just okay.Ordered rib hash and Huntington Benedict for me and my hubbee. Finally food arrived.... hmmmm....where's my hash?  hidden behind the eggs...lol and not the hash am expecting. (see picture attached).  It was pretty salty fora me...in short a 2 star as they didn't screw up my sunnyside up.  Now for Huntington Benedict.  It was okay for my hubbee which gets a 3.  Service was great.Over all a 3 star and can give it another try if I I will be in the area.  Owner is very nice as well as the staff.

Finally made it our here for brunch (and in general). We got there right at 10 and walked in right when they opened. I enjoyed the food I I got which was the grilled cheese. My wife got the short rib hash and I wasn't really as sold on the taste of that dish. Though she liked it. The cinnamon roll is so awesome. I also really liked their biscuits. Really big and fluffy. I also got a local beer on tap. The selection wasn't huge but they had a few good choices even on their limited beer list. The bathroom was nice. It was a private one but there was only one and you could tell people were irked at the long line. I'd come back here  to try dinner for sure as their kitchen is cranking out a lot of good looking food.

The worst chicken and waffles we ever had. Don't know what all the hype about this place is. Waited 1 hour to try this place. I guess many people come here because they are curious like we were. Huge disappointment! We saw a cafe across the street, and decided to have coffee and dessert there. That was a great choice.

We came here around 11:30am on a Saturday morning and was quoted about a half hour wait. Not bad! There's a coffee place a few doors down if you want to sip while you wait.The whole restaurant is super cute and has a southern vibe, with the wooden interior design. They have a good sized menu for brunch, and we got what seemed to be the most popular items. They also have a few different bloody mary's to choose from.Bf got the pecan pie french toast, I got the short rib hash, and our friends got the fried pork chop with cheddar waffle and one of the scrambles.I enjoyed all the dishes!- short rib hash: lotssss of meat with fried eggs on top and toast. Not too salty, but a little heavy if this is all you're going to eat. I suggest sharing or splitting with a sweet dish-pecan pie french toast: suuper soft and creamy! the bread must be soakedddd before cooked. Again, I could only have a few bites of this because it's pretty sweet.-fried pork chop with cheddar waffles: delicious!! I highly recommend this. I'm a sucker for cheddar waffles, so I really wanted to get this dish but the whole thing just sounded a bit too much for me. I had a few bites from my friend though and it was just enough!! Definitely share your plates to get a good variety!

Lived everything about this place. The staff is wonderful, the food is amazing and the experience was perfect.  I had the eggs Benedict, side of Benton's bacon and a walnut sticky bun.  They serve Brooklyn Roasting Co. Cold Brew on tap.....  great flavor, strong but nice. This place is worth the trip over from Manhattan.

This place should just be renamed "Salt."  Because that's what they serve. Maybe with a side of food. Went with a group of 4 and we ordered the steak, lasagna, chicken/waffles, and duck meatloaf. Plus the flatbread, fries and mussels to start. Holy hell every item was literally like eating a pound of salt. And I love salt. But this legit made me worried about my heart, health and general well-being. Won't ever go back. The food sucks. The waitress (1 for the entire restaurant) was rude and pushy. And it's horribly overpriced.

Finally we made it out here with our 11 months old. Arrived 30mins after they're open, so we got seats right away in the perfect spot with high chair. Important to know: fried chicken are only for dinner so a bit disappointed. BUT..  other food are worth the trip. The French Toast is A MUST! It's the best one I've ever had. We got pancake as an add on, something that I'd like to give it a try. Cheddar waffle with pork chop-the waffle is my favorite. Next time on the list will be the dinner! We're coming back!!!! PS: all the crew were great with our baby so it's a plus!

If I could leave ZERO stars, I would. The hostess was short with my group and very rude, the server took 15 minute to even greet our table (not busy, tiny restaurant), larger groups that ordered after us got their food. We never saw any food after waiting 40 minutes. When asked about our food, the server was unapologetic and blamed it on a well done burger that was ordered. I've never been to any eating establishment that takes 40 minutes for a burger.
Pecan. pie. sundae.The chicken and waffles weren't bad either. I enjoyed the waffles more than the chicken.

I've been here for brunch and wanted to try the dinner menu. The hostess was incredibly rude and not accommodating. We arrived 25 minutes early and instead of politely telling us our table wasn't ready, she said "it hasn't even been 20 minutes." I was completely turned off by her poor demeanor but figured the food was always good here so it'll be worth the wait. When we arrived back for our reservations, our table wasn't quite ready so we sat by the bar. The bartender was working on our drinks when the hostess called us over. I said we were waiting for our drinks and she said "well do you want to wait for another table since you're not ready?" I could not believe it! Are you kidding?? why not offer to seat us and have someone just bring our drinks over? My husband ended up waiting behind and just brought it over. Was the food delicious? Yes. The hostess was so rude that I will never come here for dinner. This should be the first impression to your dinner experience and it really just left a bad taste in my mouth. It's a shame because the food is tasty. When I go out, I don't need attitude or snide comments with my meal.
The food here is amazing. Seriously good. They are pretty busy so be prepared to wait a bit. Try their fried chicken! Also, beet tahini-- whaaa? Delicious.

Went to this establishment with a co-worker after a meeting in Brooklyn.  Based on the yelp reviews and walking distance seemed like it would be a good choice.  I have a weak spot for fried chicken and waffles, and given the name I felt that had to be my dinner choice.Overall meal was excellent.  The chicken itself was very moist and the fry was excellent.  Paired with the cheddar waffles and the slaw, the overall meal was excellent.  Establishment is very nice, and wait staff was very attentive.  I would definitely be coming back again when in the area for more based on how good what we ordered was.
Best buttermilk biscuits. Period.Super cute place sporting a casual, cozy, elegant, ambiance.
Came here with a group to try their Chicken and waffles.I dont know, for me it was over hyped and over priced.The chicken was too sweet and very dry. Not what I was expecting.

Since I live around the corner, I decided to give them another try, even after my roach debacle a few years ago. I have to say the food quality and service has significantly diminished over the years. This place is officially of my list.

So I trekked here with friends, after hearing and reading about this place for some years. I wasn't impressed. Very basic to me. They messed up buttermilk fried chicken, like how???The chicken came out under cooked, I asked to have it sent back but the waiter told me that the organic chicken is supposed to be juicy because.... it's organic. I then proceeded to cut into the chicken and show him that I prefer my chicken juicy without BLOOD. He became befuddled and apologized, immediately sent it back. By the second act the chicken came out better and my waiter waived my meal. The two stars are solely for him because he rectified the situation.

We went 30min before the restaurant open cause I know how serious people are about Sunday brunch. It was wise because line did get long before it opens. However the food was very mediocre. Among four of us, we were able to get all the items interest us. The fried pork chop was okay, incomparable to any katsu place in the city. Probably shouldn't compare with Katy's, but the texture and flavor was just meh. The pecan French toast was too sweat, and so soft in my opinion. But the first bite was fine. The short rib hash was probably the better one we got, but nothing memorable. And the lamb salad, which was the reason why I picked this place to try out in the first place, taste like left over. In general was quite disappointed, especially given so many good places out there. Probably won't return, and definitely will not wait in line for this again.

We came here for a birthday brunch, it was a rainy Sunday so it wasn't hard to find parking. By the time we got here, there was a big line waiting to enter the restaurant. Luckily, everyone got a seat and we didn't have to wait much. A big suggestion for anyone trying out this place is to come 10-15 minutes before they open, this will guarantee you a spot. Now on to the good stuff..the food was delicious. I had the grilled cheese and it was yummy, not breathtaking but a solid choice. Someone in my party had the French toast and I had to say this was the highlight. Next time, I will most definitely get this dish with the syrup on the side. My boyfriend had the eggs Benedict and he also said it was a solid choice. The drinks were also good and strong. One star down is simply because of the service. Our waiter wasn't attentive at all and we felt like we had to constantly waive him down in order to receive a drink. Overall, our experience was tainted due to the service but we'll decide whether we want to give it another chance.

Delicious food, great service, and dog-friendly to boot! Between the table we had the walnut sticky bun, buttermilk biscuits, short rib hash, buttermilk pancakes, and one of the scrambles. All of it was amazing!

Great food and great service at brunch . Will definitely return for dinner. The eggs and lox (no cheese) were the best I have had!!! All four of us enjoyed the food especially the eggs no salt needed. The space is small but we got a table closer to the front by the bar and it didn't seem close at all. We loved it and will return as I said.

Took my friend here for his birthday. Overall the place is very cozy with friendly staff. Here is what we ordered:Apps-Popovers w. honey & salt: Overall it was super fluffy and light. Very tasty. At first I thought we might have ordered too many but it was so light.Raw oysters: We ordered 2 kinds but I only remembered the name of the one I liked the most, from New Brunswick I believe the waiter said. Roasted oysters w. green chile butter: this was so good! MUST GET!!Entrees-Pan Roasted artic char: This was delicious. The skin of the fish was crispy and the fish is so good. Might have used a little too much better in the dish. Very filling afterwards.Buttermilk Fried Chicken: 3 big pieces of chicken & a side of cole slaw. The cole slaw was good. The chicken was meh. I had better fried chicken. The breading was hard and not even the good crunchy hard. Not enough salt either. Had very little taste. I was a bit disappointed in that as I saw many people ordering this entree.Overall we enjoyed our meal. I would totally come back for the oysters.
The brunch we had here was good. We sat outside and the weather was nice. The staff was super friendly! We had the eggs Benedict, brisket hash and waffles. All meals were great.
Always delicious bites! Their brunch is also amazing with great options and friendly service!

Order the fried pork chops without the cheddar waffles & salad    Their waffles are made to be pair with the pork chop and lightly touch with the maple syrup on side. Crispy coated buttermilk batter outside the pork chop pair marry with the sweet syrup and the texture waffle is all the enjoyments in one bite

How many times am I going to stress my love-hate relationship with brunch? I was really looking forward to this! But I was once again mildly disappointed.5/5: Service. The hostess is awesome. I called the night before with the intention of making a reservation since I knew it would be packed on Sunday, but she kept reassuring me it'd be slow post-July 4. Then when we got here she was able to quickly seat us.4/5: Drinks. The bellini was just right.3/5: Food. Too bad, right? My friend and I both had the short rib hash and the meat honestly tasted like something I once had in a school lunch. Debatable though. Brunch just isn't my best friend.
Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Everything is so good. Highly recommend the bacon almonds to snack on while you wait for your meal.

It's a long commute for the city folk but totally worth it. Got a sticky bun, side of bacon, eggs Benedict, and the pecan French toast. The eggs were mediocre at best. Nothing special about it, but I'd go back for the French toast. It was delicious!

Went there yesterday for lunch with my family a party of 8. The three stars are for our server, he sat us immediately, explained the drink menu and was attentive but not over bearing. Refilled our water, was patient with the kids etc! Food is affordable, healthy options but the lunch menu is limited and it wasn't mind blowing. The complimentary pop overs were great however...Maybe we'll have to come back on the weekend for brunch?

Went here for Sunday brunch (inadvertently was Father's Day). It was understandably busy but I put my name and number down, and only waited about 30 minutes! The hostess/manager was fantastic and very accommodating. The food was so good too. As a Southerner in Brooklyn (and dining with fellow Southerners), it passed our test for authenticity! So happy I live nearby because I will definitely be back!

This restaurant was very accommodating for a last minute request for a party of 10 for a Sunday morning brunch. Our server had a bright attitude, sometimes dancing to the music, and was kind in waiting us. The food was delicious. Especially the French toast (a must get). The French toast was crusted on the outside, yet creamy / almost custard-like on the inside. The fried pork was also a must get, with such a big portion and great reading. My sister unfortunately had hers undercooked, asked for another, and still got another pork chop undercooked. I'm sure this is a strange anomaly, for 4 others of us who ordered it had ours well done.The atmosphere was very hip. The servers were dressed well, there was 80s / 90s music playing, and the type of people who came to eat here was very diverse. I will say that the music played was too loud for a Sunday morning brunch.

Buttermilk Channel just checks all the boxes- top-notch food; stylish, inviting space; and friendly staff (despite their obvious success they are always welcoming and seem happy to see you!). We had an amazing anniversary meal on a Monday night (were lucky to find a last minute spot on OpenTable). Everyone we dealt with was friendly and helpful and the food (popovers, flatbread, warm lamb salad, duck meatloaf, banana pudding) was amazing. This restaurant should be on everyone's "must-eat" list for Brooklyn.

I searched on Yelp for best brunch's in Brooklyn and i was already impressed by the amount of great reviews and the food looked delectable. Buttermilk Channel's Brunch was nothing more that Amazing.There was a small crowd outside when me and my friend arrived,They said the wait would be about 20 minutes but within maybe 10 minutes they texted me and our table was ready. AWESOME sauce!!!!The restaurant is a decent size. People were in and out which made the process of waiting for a table, eating within an amicable time frame while still enjoying the ambiance offered a good experience. Our waitress was super nice, friendly and attentive. There were so many things to try but we both wanted something a little different so we went for the fried pork chops and Cheddar waffles.  It was NOT a disappointment. I don't live in NY anymore and i know this establishment has been around for a while but i will DEFINITELY be back!

We have found our new favorite NYC.  We had brunch.  The appetizers were amazing and the brunch special was great.  For apps we got the maple bacon almonds and cornbread.  For brunch we both ordered the BLT which included rye bread, bacon, fennel, kale & a fried green tomato.  All the flavors paired extremely well together.  I ordered an espresso with Sambuca to finish the meal.  What a great experience.  These two Detroiters will return to Buttermilk Channel each time we come to NYC!!!!

What can I say, this place is a neighborhood gem and a frequent after work dinner for me. The hostess is always welcoming and greets us by name, the table is always ready at the time of reservation. Service is always great. I have tried everything on the menu and it never disappoints. My favorite items are the fried chicken, steak and duck meatloaf.

Lots of good choices here and the popularity when we showed up is evidence of it. I was torn between a few choices which doesn't happen all that often but I settled on the Short rib hash, a favorite of mine that varies at other breakfast and brunch spots I frequent. Here at Buttermilk it's eggs - sunny side, toast greens and of course I nice portion of beef short rib. I wanted to try the pork chop and the pancakes as well but I settled on the Short rib hash and was offered a single pancake to try out as well for $4. The pancakes are huge so one might have been a good number to go with and complimented my choice well. Everything hit the mark and had a nice presentation.A wait is likely on a weekend, but the surrounding area has some nice shops to poke your head in while you wait so it cuts down on the standing around waiting. Service was pretty good completing the perquisites for an awesome restaurant. I'd definitely like to try some of the things I passed on in another visit.
First of all the customer service was impeccable. The sweet tea was everything. I have to pork chops with the cheddar waffles  amazing !!

Service: our server used the word "velocity" to describe the cocktail special, so we ordered it and it was amazing!! She was really attentive and sweet and didn't bother us at all when we said we wanted to take our time. Ambiance: really calm and quiet which is hard to find in NYC. There was a lot of space between the tables and it was easy to hear the conversation at the table. Food: wowwwwwww. I got the lasagna. Thin, delicious noodles packed with slightly charred veggies that added a fresh and crunchy punch. The tomato sauce was flavorful and light, and the portion size was perfect. I loved the take on a classic dish. Thanks buttermilk!!

This review is a little bit late but we reserved a table for 10 people on a Saturday evening for one of my friend's birthday. I always wanted to try this restaurant for brunch but dinner works just fine! We sat on the long table in the middle of the restaurant - I honestly thought it would have been a bigger space but it was pretty small. Everyone ordered either rose or cocktails, which were okay but pretty pricey for small glass. Funny thing was that when the waitress brought some drinks to the table, she spilled one entire drink on my one friend who did not order any drink and left him soaked. They were pretty apologetic about it.We ordered beer-steamed mussels, brussels sprout and french fries for the table. The mussels were good, we loved dipping the bread into the sauce. I'm a sucker for quality fries - they were good but just a bit too salty. No complaints about the brussels sprout either, they were perfectly seasoned. I ordered the buttermilk fried chicken over waffles - it was pretty good. The fried chicken wasn't overly breaded but it was a little dry. I loved the waffle, it was fresh and wasn't soggy. The order of chicken and waffles was bigger than I expected - I wasn't able to finish it. I tried my friend's burger - it wasn't bad but nothing special about it. The staff was friendly especially with bringing out the cake we got our friend - they sang happy birthday with us and all. The service wasn't bad. They took off the cake cutting fees to compensate for spilling drinks on my friend. I had higher expectations but there wasn't anything special - also expensive.

Came here on a Saturday for brunch with a girlfriend and we loved it! We were seated right away but it took a while for the waiter to get our order. We ordered mimosa and bloody Maria to start, and we ordered the pecan French toast and pork chop waffle. Pecan waffle: my goodness, it was so fluffy and the sauce they had was caramely and not overly sweet. Pork chop waffle: I'm definitely ordering this again because the seasoning of the waffle was so flavorful, not a single boring bite! The meat was juicy and the crust was crispy. Overall, I'm definitely coming back!

I REALLY wanted to love this place, and for the most part I did! I ordered the fried pork chop with cheddar waffle and it was delicious.... until I cut all the way through and saw that it was not cooked fully. They brought me out a whole new plate and apologized and I was willing to put this behind me but my new plate was STILL UNDERCOOKED! I told the manager and she tried to explain to me that it's cooked just still pink. I understand these things happen, I'm just surprised that the make up pork chop was still undercooked.The food, nonetheless, was still very delicious. I had some of the pecan pie French toast and it might have been my favorite French toast ever. The biscuits we delicious as well. I'd still eat here, just be wary of the fried pork chop

If you know me, you know I am a brunch-skeptic. Those in the business know that brunch is the highest margin meal of the week, charging upwards of $10 for eggs and toast. However, Buttermilk Channel is one of few brunch places that have me looking forward to the weekend.At 11am on a drizzly Saturday, there was already a wait to be seated. Thankfully the 20 minutes passed quickly and soon enough we were ready to feast. We ordered the roasted mushroom, spinach, and goat cheese scramble, the fried pork chop and cheddar waffles, and the pecan pie French toast.- Roasted mushroom, spinach, and goat cheese scramble: For me, the winner of the meal, which is saying a lot given that this is simply an elevated take on scrambled eggs. By that I mean the eggs were pillow-soft and the mushrooms perfectly juicy. Even the side salad was more than just an afterthought.-Fried pork chop and cheddar waffles: An alternative to your standard chicken and waffles, the waffles were wonderfully savory to pair with the sweet maple syrup. The pork chop was perfectly cooked, we made sure to clean off the meat to the bone.-Pecan pie French toast: I rarely go down the sweet route, but we were feeling gluttonous on this day, and we were rewarded with this dish. The whipped cream accompanying the toast was so airy as to prompt disbelief.Next time you find yourself in Carroll Gardens or Red Hook, drop by Buttermilk Channel for what must be one of the best brunches in Brooklyn, if not New York City.

Great atmosphere. Had the flatbread, mashed potatoes and vegetarian lasagna. All was delicious. Manager came up and pitched the special; he had a very friendly demeanor. Server was a nice guy and had just the right amount of attentiveness. Would come back for sure. Good job gang ;D

I never miss a chance to eat at Buttermilk Channel when I visit New York. Everything is amazing: the fried chicken, the duck meatloaf, the fries, the desserts (coffee soda float and Doug's pecan pie sundae!). The service is also incredible, and they treat kids so well: crayons to color on the tabletop paper, amazing meal options including aclown sundae for dessert. You should venture here from anywhere in the city. You won't regret it.

Absolutely superb, I couldn't fault a thing. The food was divine, including their famous buttermilk fried chicken and waffles. The mussels, the bean soup with piment d'espelette and the chicken liver mouse were all fantastic as well. Our server was wonderful and very helpful in helping us decide on what to have. The ambience was lovely. I'm looking forward to returning soon!

We read the reviews and traveled in on a Saturday night excited to try this place.  1st and foremost the value for the money is one of the lowest places in Brooklyn. The place is mega loud and the seating is extremely uncomfortable. The food was ok -- but the service was extremely slow -- took over an hour to get our food -- and then when they served my burger the committed the ultimate no-no -- I order the burger without cheese -- and they served a burger where they had apparently made it with cheese and then scraped it off -- and my medium burger was well done -- most likely why it was taking so long.  When you are charging $20 for a burger -- you should be able to get it to the customer as they ordered. Throughout the evening -- we had to flag the server down for refills on our drinks -- it was a total bust.  I think this restaurant is living off a reputation it no longer deserves.

This is one of my favorite American restaurants. It continuously delivers on classic American fair. The burger is made up of a thick Patty. It's nicely charred on the top and juicy in the middle, as its cooked to temperature. This is one of the prime examples of what a gourmet burger should be. The burger comes with a generous side of fries which are nicely salted and crispy on the outside and soft in the middle.The fried chicken and waffles are amazing. The best part of this dish is the sauce. It is a sweet vinaigrette sauce. It acts like a maple syrup substitute. The sauce even goes well with the fries.The best part of visiting this restaurant is the desert. The pecan pie Sunday is off the hook. It is served in a glass with layers of pecan pie alternating between vanilla ice cream topped with homemade whipped cream. The whole dessert is very creamy and rich yet you can finish it between two folks. If you're looking for a good service at a restaurant in a nice neighborhood and great food this is the place to be any day of the week.

Was looking for a brunch place to eat in the neighborhood and this place came up on Yelp. Came on Sunday and had to wait around 45 minutes for a table for two before we got seated. I gave the hostess my number and she said I would receive a text when a table is ready.
