The hostess never asked us if we were okay with outside or at the bar and just assumed we wanted to sit at a table inside. We just stood there as she sat parties of two who came after us first....When we finally got seated, my friend and I were starving and already knew what we were going to get. We got the following to share:Pecan Pie French Toast ($14)- This was the bomb!! If you're looking for a dish to share this is the one for you. The syrup isn't overly sweet and the french toast was so fluffy and warm. My mouth is watering just thinking about how delicious this was!Eggs Huntington ($14)- I would give this dish a 3/5. The egg was cooked to perfection and the ham was lightly salted. The ratio of this was a little off and I just wished that there was a liiiitle bit more ham because it was sliced pretty thin. As for the buttermilk biscuit, there was a little to much biscuit to egg/ham ratio.Fried Pork Chop & Cheddar Waffles ($18)- The pork chop and waffles came with maple syrup. The pork chop was very crispy and it was packed with a lot of flavor, however I'm not sure it was worth $18 though. I had an okay brunch experience at this place but after the Pecan French Toast, I am sold on coming back again.

Oh, what a wonderful brunch spot this is! From the service, to the food, to the vibe - it was an all around wonderful experience.They do not make reservations for brunch on the weekends! As other reviews mention, I highly suggest arriving earlier than planned to anticipate a wait to be seated. If the option to make a reservation is available, definitely take the opportunity! - I came with a party of 5. When we arrived I gave my name and the kind hostess took my number. She said the wait is about an hour and that I would receive a text when the table was almost ready. The wait was worth it, trust me!We ordered the following: Buttermilk Pancakes, Eggs Huntington, Bibb Lettuce Salad, and Fried Pork Chop & Cheddar Waffles. All were exquisite. The highlight was the pancakes. They are so fluffy and delicious. I haven't had pancakes that soft and fluffy in so long. The wait to get the food wasn't too bad considering how busy they were.Our server was awesome - super nice and helpful. Checked up on us regularly despite the business.What I really loved about this place was that they did a great job of making it look and feel less crazy that it actually was. I would 100% come back!

I've been coming here for years and it's consistently good. Most recently had the pecan French toast which is amazing. The biscuits are also really good and the egg scrambles. Best brunch place in Carrol Gardens although the wait can be long owing to its popularity.
Its fine to get a bite but not a destination.  Food adequate tho not cheap and decor and service pleasant.

Amazing brunch all around. Bloody Mary's are strong, pancakes fluffy, bacon extra crispy, and you'll never have your coffee mug below half full. Top it off with a cozy yet lively ambiance. It's an ideal Brooklyn bunch.Only catch -- make a reservation or get here before 10:30am (and be willing to sit at the bar). Oh and I hear the short rib hash is also a must.Enjoy!

Let me start with the service is great busy place but only a 45 min wait on a Sunday @1130. The drinks were spot on and good. I'd go back just to sit at the bar and have a Bloody Mary the one with the wonderful briny oyster! YUM! or the mezcal drink. We had 2 orders of short rib hash (in which we both agreed was not that great) we also got an order of the cheddar waffle which was great. Friends had the egg scramble and the pancakes which were huge and they seemed to enjoy. If I was to consider going back it would be for the bar.

Wow was the wait long on Mother's day! Glad we decided to come early so by 12 something we were already called in since they don't take reservations for breakfast/brunch.The place was packed! And it can get difficult sometimes navigating yourself once inside. The wait after we got seated was tolerable and our server was pretty attentive with our needs. I chose to get the fried chops with cheddar waffle and i think it was okay. I wasnt entirely mind blown however...this is why the 4 stars instead of 3...i tasted their buttermilk pancakes and their french toast (from my sister and husband) - now those two were pretty delicious! The pancakes were thick but soft and melty in your mouth, the french toast also had a nice chewiness and sweetness to it that i really really liked. If i ever get to come back, i might have to get those for myself.

We had brunch here on a Sunday and it was packed. The ambient and decor was nice and modern. I had decided to order a specialty salad and it wasn't good. It was watery and salty. The wait staff saw that I didn't eat much of it and asked how I like it. I told them and they took the salad off. I have 4 stars because the staff was intuitive and considerate in this regard.

This brunch spot has been on my list of places to try for a long time so I finally got to try it out with my fiancé for our 7th year dating anniversary back in January 2018. We came on a Sunday around 11AM-12PM since our dating anniversary landed on a Sunday this year.  The wait was around 30-45 minutes. Parking was a bit of an issue because we just had a snowstorm a few days prior to our dating anniversary and there was a lot of snow.The restaurant has a homey and somewhat cozy atmosphere to it. The service was on point and staff is friendly. Since it was a freezing day, I started off with a cappuccino which I thought was amazing and superb! My fiancé got an iced coffee. For entrees I ordered the Eggs Huntington (buttermilk biscuit, poached eggs, Hollandaise sauce, lox and accompanied with Field Greens). It's originally suppose to have Benton's Country Ham, but I substituted it with lox instead. This was probably one of the best combinations I've had of eggs and lox because I have had it at different diners and brunch spots before and it just never satisfied my tast buds. The poached eggs were poached just perfectly and the Hollandaise sauce was just right! Field greens went very well with the entire dish.My fiancé ordered the Fried Pork Chop & Cheddar Waffles with Poorfarm Maple Syrup which looked massive and delicious! The fried pork chop was seasoned perfectly, had a slight crisp and moist texture to it. The cheddar waffles were soft, fluffy and didn't have an overwhelming cheddar taste/flavor to the waffles.Overall, a cute and comforting brunch spot minus the fact that there's a long wait. I would most definitely like to come back for brunch and perhaps enjoy their outdoor seating area. I would highly recommend coming here for brunch/comfort food and it's located on a nice and quite area of Court Street. So definitely worth checking out!

Street parking wasn't an issue since I came with my cousin on a random Thursday morning. We had the grilled cheese and fried chicken sandwiches and each loved our meals. And what a cute restaurant - loved the decor. I read a lot of reviews that expressed the astounding service but I didn't find anything remarkable. Maybe it's because I've come to an expectation that people can be... you know, nice. Not to say our service was bad, because it definitely wasn't. I loved our meal and our experience but I found this place to be overpriced - hence the four stars. I never usually mind paying a bit extra for exceptional food or great ambiance but this place didn't provide enough of that to justify their prices.

(I'm basically ranting about their great customer service)This is my second time visiting this restaurant, but my first time here for brunch. I went on Mother's Day without a reservation and I was told that the wait would be two hours for a table for two or sooner if I wanted to sit at the bar or outdoors. Even with the long wait I give them a 5/5 not only for their food but for the overall service. Here is why:1. The hostess was amazing! She had 100+ people on her list. I am sure it was a stressful situation but she handled it extremely well. She remained kind and professional. She'd check in on people who were waiting and made every mom feel special with a greeting. 2. My waitress was lovely and attentive but not overbearing. She delivered our drinks promptly. A pet peeve I have is when I am waiting forever for the bill, another forever to pay the bill, and a finally forever to receive my card/change back. That was not the case! 3. THE FOOD. Simply put the brunch was delicious and their mimosas were perfect. I was afraid that the drinks would be watered down and that the food would be rushed. But that was not the case. It was the best brunch I've had and I consider myself to be a brunch snob lol. To wrap it up if this was my experience on a very busy day this restaurant definitely has a great flow and personable touch. I commend the overall team including the bussers "busboys" and chef/kitchen staff.

Arrived an hour and 30 minutes before they closed on Sunday. I was told by the hostess, they had too long of a wait, and they "were not taking anymore guest or seating anyone". As we planned where to eat, we watched her seat 2 new parties who walked in after us. I watched her wait for us to leave to seat them. I know this because once outside, I peaked back in. I'm sure the food is tremendous, but the help lacked communication, tact and couth.

This has been one of my favorite places in Brooklyn since it opened years ago.   I've eaten here many times and it never disappoints.  We used to come for a date night and dine at the bar, but most recently we brought our teen daughters here and they enjoyed the experience here as well. The service is warm and friendly.  Service is solid.  The restaurant is candlelit and definitely charming. We have eaten at the bar and in the dining room. If I'm with just one other person I prefer dining at the bar.  Tables for two are actually too close together for my liking. Tonight, we ordered pop overs, chicken and waffles, duck meatloaf, a huge steak with disco fries and a green goddess salad. All were ample, tasty and satisfying. I strongly recommend either making a reservation or arriving early. Buttermilk still remains very popular and with good reason, they do everything right.

This place was yummy. I had the pancakes with bacon and scrambled eggs. I loved the eggs so much. My food was good. My friend had the eggs Benedict and loved it. The Bloody Mary with the oyster was great. The oyster was delicious. The coffee was also good. Definitely would return!

Absolutely love it here! One of the best fried chicken I've ever had and on the other end of the scale their vegetable bowl entree is worth going back for alone. Really great staff. Excellent gin and tonics (and trust me this is a much bigger victory than you'd imagine). Really nice dining room. Well located for subways from manhattan. If I lived closer I'd be there weekly!
Best place to eat in Brooklyn . Service was good but the food took a little bit too long but overall I'm giving it a 5 star

Been planning a trip here for 2 years. I've tried twice for a weekend brunch and the line was too long. This time I was there when they opened. It was one of the first good weather days of the years, so we sat out in the sun and had plenty of space on the patio. A bit of nice warm coffee to get us started and we were ready to eat. Tried the classic Bloody Mary and antipasto bloody as well - both with great flavor and well worth the cost. At the price you're probably not diving in for a full on boozy brunch. For entrees get the cheddar waffle and pork chop. A thick juicy chop on top of a savory waffle. Thought they'd give a full waffle, but it's only half and much smaller than the chop. Also had the short rib hash. The short rib was ok and a nice mix in for the eggs. Came with a side of nice grain toast as well. Service was a bit on the slow side but it makes sense once I saw the tons of people inside the dining room. If you're in the area and can get in or if you just have the time to wait, it's worth a visit and a stroll through the surrounding neighborhood.

5* brunch. When you want classic brunch items done really well, this is your place. The lox scramble is amazing and you can't leave without trying the biscuits. It hits that great blend of being casual but a little upscale, without feeling formal. The staff were really accommodating and cocktails were great. I'll definitely be back.

Buttermilk Channel's food and service were out of this world amazing. We walked by here on a whim on Saturday night and saw the large crowd forming outside. We checked online and saw that there was actually a reservation available 15 minutes later, at 8:45PM. Score! We came back after having a drink nearby & were welcomed by the hostess. She told us that our table was eating dessert and would be done shortly. (Meanwhile walk-ins were being quoted over a 45 minute wait......check online vs walking in people!) We were escorted to the bar to await our table and ordered a couple of cocktails-The Honey Suckle Rose (gin, sparkling rosé, lemon & honey) was smooth but also kicking my butt. This drink packed a punch. My husband loved the Fox 8 (Gin, Dolin Blanc Vermouth & Sales Aperitif). Though we ended up being seated past our reservation time, the hostess was above and beyond at informing us what our estimated seating time would be. Once seated, service continued to be very efficient and detailed. I asked about gluten free menu options and was told in detail what there was. We ordered an appetizer and our entrees, and shortly after we received a bite of house made pickles as an apology for our extra wait time. Since I had told the waitress I was gluten free, they brought these especially. This attention to detail was much appreciated. These were fantastic. Our next course, the beer-steamed mussels (cherry peppers, celery leaves, green olives, & grilled country bread) was spectacular. This soupy goodness contained endless flavors after every bite. These were some of the most succulent, juicy mussels I have ever eaten. My entree, the Pan-roasted arctic char, with crispy polenta cake, concord grapes & jalepeno brown butter was at the level of delicious where you want to just drink it out of a straw. This was many levels of perfection, from the perfectly done fish to the amazing textures and flavors in the polenta. I'm normally a super slow eater but devoured this baby quickly. My husband had the duck meatloaf  which was also friking ridiculously delicious. The entire dining experience was just so amazing here. I really felt as though the staff cared about us during our visit & it was amazing. I can't wait to come back to Buttermilk Channel for brunch or other occasions. This place completely rocked!

Came here for Sunday brunch and the place was packed. We put our names down and then walked around the neighborhood.  When the table was ready they texted us which is awesome. We were seated immediately when we arrived. We ordered drinks first then we debated on whether to get the pancakes or not. We didn't get them this time but will sure try them the next time we come. It's a great spot for brunch. I would recommend this place if you're a small party. Anything larger than 4 may be a long long wait. Service was good, food was great! Will definitely come back to try the pancakes.

Buttermilk Channel is a wonderful brunch spot in Brooklyn with delicious food, a warm cozy interior and outdoor patio. It really is the perfect place for brunch if you are in the area. The restaurant gets crowded but my fiance and I were easily able to snag a 2-seater on one of the first warm and sunny Saturdays in April around 12pm. My boyfriend and I shared the Eggs Huntington (a take on the Eggs Benedict with a biscuit) and the buttermilk pancakes. The Eggs Huntington was delicious and the biscuits definitely made the dish. The pancakes were also tasty and the portions were large - 5 fluffy pancakes stacked on top of each other. Brunch prices will run you around $12 - $20 a dish (not too expensive for NYC brunch standards). Definitely check this place out for the biscuits - they are divine.

Come for the biscuits. Seriously. These biscuits were really damn good for east coast biscuits. Buttery, flaky on the outside, soft and warm on the inside. If they let me, I would come here and just order a dozen biscuits to go. The other dishes we tried were a little more underwhelming. We had the bourbon french toast, which was WAY too rich. No balance on the plate at all, it was absolutely not something you can eat a whole plate of because you'd feel sick afterwards. I had the salad which had nice fresh ingredients but was extremely vinegar-y. Again, lacking some balance there and all I could taste was the bitter and sour shallot vinaigrette. Ambiance = super cute. Service = very good.But in conclusion, come for the biscuits.

The appetizers are the best. They put the same amount if work into each tiny dish they put into a full entree and they're even more careful I think. They Outshine the entrees.Attentive friendly staff, will respond quickly to requests. The star loss is the over salted entree sauce. Maybe the sous chef needs a palate reset. No sugar, salt or dairy for 10 days. Will higher that taste sense {everyone's goal}

The fried chicken and roasted wild boar ribs were dee-licious. I didn't like the waffles. Food took an EXTREMELY LONG time after being ordered for us to be served. It felt like an hour. If the serving time was shorter and the waffles were better, then this place would've gotten 5 stars.

I came here on a Sunday and made sure to get there before opening. Within a half hour the place was packed so if you're going for brunch ( weekend only) go early or expect to wait. The cheddar waffle was delicious, it's a must get. Parking is mostly meters around there so Sunday's are probably more optimal if you plan on going with a large party

Simply one of the best restaurants in NYC, top to bottom. Wonderful ambiance, excellent food and delightful staff. Whether it's the best thing you've ever tested is subjective, but if you leave not having enjoyed your experience, the problem is you, not them.

Came here to have lunch with my momma. It was the four of us and we were seated pretty quickly for a Saturday morning. We didn't wait at all. I ordered the egg huntington and a bellini. My twin ordered the bean stew with a mimosa. My brother had the waffles and pork chop and my mom had mushroom eggs. The restaurant is pretty nice and my mom loved it. Low noise level and pretty casual ambience . I'll be back.

Place is adorable, looks like a little ranch home! Highly recommend coming here!Ordered:Buttermilk Fried Chicken: EXCELLENT. Highly recommend ordering this! You get three pieces of fried chicken, half of a circular waffle, and Cole slaw . The fried chicken was amazing. Cooked perfectly, very moist, and bone in chicken! The waffles are equally as amazing, but I definitely wish there was more of them.  The syrup is what really surprised me. They must make it in house because it is not your traditional syrup. It is not overly sweet and does not have a syrup consistency. The combination of the three = perfection.

This was a hard review since the food was excellent (5 stars). We had very strange service. The waiter dropped a glass.. then later a plate on my partner (said sorry but...) then we ordered a third round of drinks (we were celebrating) that never came and she was kinda rude when we asked where they were... then we ordered one decaf and one regular espresso shots after dinner. She brought both as decaf when I asked which one was decaf and my friend wanted the shot for the extra caffeine boast and she was very rude that she had to bring the correct kind, even though this was her fault. After all this if the manager would have picked up a round of drinks I would be leaving 5 stars but nothing and we spent A LOT of money. Probably won't go back.

First visit to Buttermilk Channel based on all the glowing reviews. Firstly, got there about 11:30 and was told our wait time would be an hour (which am ok with, because most brunch places always have a wait, and this place not being so big was no suprise).  They were right on the mark with the hour wait time, the hostess was nice and friendly and polite.  Buttermilk channel was very busy on Sunday, the place has a nice ambience , bathrooms was also nice and clean. The food: For me it was just average,  nothing to really brag about.  The presentation can surely do with improvement (food was  on an oval plate which I think needed to be bigger so food don't fall off, eggs were in a lil cup that you would put olives in); the taste was like ok I paid my money so might as well eat some of it (however I must say the French toast and Pancakes were definitely good, only 2 things that was truly enjoyed by our table ).At our table we had mushrooms with scrambled eggs , Lox with scrambled , Eggs Huntington and Lamb Salad, French toast and Pancakes. The toast that comes with your Omelette was like one sandwich cut in four pieces and then you get 2 pieces. I have had better experiences for Brunch, I experience it to have firsthand knowledge and based of that expererience its not worth me returning. In honesty I cannot recommend Buttermilk Channel for Brunch either (if you want to experience it for yourself then just go).

Incredible fried chicken sandwich! The dark meat was juicy, and the batter was crisp. But what made the sandwich truly incredible was the combination of their tangy cole slaw and homemade pickles with the fried chicken plus the toasted bun. So delicious! Also, try their Brussels sprouts! I heard the brunch here is good too. I will have to come back!

The food is very good at this restaurant I highly recommend it you Gabe to wait a bit   However  u can sit at the bar  while u wait the drinks are really  good and before you know it you're at your table very professional and reasonably priced

Little bit of a wait. But definitely worth it. DE-FRIKIN-LISIOUS!!!!!!! Had to wait for our table after we were told it was ready, so they comp'd us one of their sweet rolls. So goood. Can't even show you guys pics, because we demolished it. lol, but try the cheddar waffles and French toast. Won't go wrong

Great bunch spot! The food is amazing. Pork chop with cheddar waffles- YUM. They don't have chicken and waffles with brunch only dinner- so beware. The pecan pie French toast was to die for- SO MUCH DELICIOUSNESS! Each person at the table said it was the best French toast they have ever eaten, ever! The short rib hash was bomb, flavor was great. The biscuits here are insane, really great base for the egg Benedicts too! The hash brown side was a bit bland, probably would skip in the future. The decor is basic, I would have loved them to do a bit more with the walls and fixtures. Not that they need to try to be something they are not, but they could do a quick few things to be more well rounded. The food is awesome though and you can tell everyone inside was enjoying their meal! YUM!

Delicious food! Cozy environment & great staff. I'm here on Easter Sunday and the staff is warm and friendly. We didn't feel rushed or pressured. Our food was also fantastic! We tried the French toast, pancakes, bacon & fried pork chop with cheddar waffle. The cheddar waffle really stood out! The French toast was indescribable! Everything was great. Great job buttermilk channel!

This review is just in regards to their buttermilk fried chicken and waffles for dinner as it's executed perfectly. The chicken has the perfect crisp and seasoning while remaining moist on the inside. The cheddar waffles are done right. The slaw adds texture and flavor, and you can almost trick yourself into thinking it's healthy because hey fiber. And the last part is the thickened balsamic syrup which ties everything together without the cloying sweetness you can get from maple syrup, just elevating the dish to the next level.Service is always friendly and they have a good assortment of cocktails as well. Highly recommend for this dish.

Cozy, warm place with amazing staff that treat you like family!!! I came here today for the first time after a long morning for brunch.  I ordered a Chicken chipotle with spinach and cheese on a gluten-free panini, it was very good and filling. Along with that I had a cappuccino made with almond milk!! I highly recommend this place. You will not be disappointed

Absolutely worth the 1.5 hour wait. The fluffiest pancakes. An incredible cheddar waffle. A delicious pecan French toast. A biscuit that melts in your mouth.Had heard incredible things and it all lived up to the hype. We definitely over ordered so I would recommend either going with a couple of people so you can share or be ready to take some food home! Decently priced (for NY brunch) and really big portions and mouthwatering food!

This place is great to go to if you want to get out of your normal breakfast/brunch meals. They provide different kind of options so definitely take time out to look at the menu before you go because there are some things you may have to google if you're not familiar with the options. Place is pretty small as well so expect a wait time (mine was about 40 min or so for two persons). Also be mindful that tables are typically placed very close to each other. I got the scrambled option, came with one hash, two pieces of rye toast, a yummy green salad, and scrambled eggs with little pieces of salmon. The toast was a bit too hard for me so it was difficult to chew. The eggs I could not eat because if tasted way too fishy. However, our waiter was so kind and had kinky offered to replace that part of my meal many times. Service is quick and very associate I encountered was very kind. I'm going to give the place a second shot though because I think it was just my meal of choice and service was awesome!

I came here for restaurant week and oh my goodness so happy I did! The potato and leek soup was pretty good, but the standout was the chicken and waffles. DELICIOUS! The chicken was so good, the cheddar waffles were great, but the best part was the balsamic maple syrup. I am still dreaming about it. AND for dessert, the banana pudding was to die for. It had caramel popcorn on it too!! It was so fun and yummy. I will definitely be going back!

All you need to know is "Chicken & Waffles".  I will never order anything else.  I even lived in TN for 7 years and still nothing compares to Buttermilk Channel's chicken and waffles.  There is something about the syrup that is super unique.  To be honest, they do everything well but you must try the chicken and waffles!It is tough to get a table for brunch but lucky for you they serve chicken and waffles for dinner too. :)

Myself and my buddy were in Brooklyn looking for some good food and stumbled across this place via Yelp. The place was really amazing. It had great reviews and lived up to that. The staff was really friendly from the minute we walked in. The decor was very dim and intimate. Our waitress gave great suggestions on food. The place had beer from Otherhalf Brewery which is close by so that was a plus. The food was excellent. I had the Duck meatloaf which came with an amazing polenta and sauce. My friend had the chicken and waffles and I snagged a taste of that. The flavor of the chicken was sooooo good. I'll definitely be back to try the Lasagna and to have the chicken and waffles...

Ok, 8 years later I still stand by this review. I went to this restaurant a long time ago for a way fancier dinner with my then vegetarian boo, but these days I go back at lunchtime, solo, eating meat. It's a pretty good neighborhood standby, with great service and solid food and veg options. Neighborhood classic. Do it.

The spit pickles were amazing! Just wish we could have swapped out all of the sweet ones. Brussels sprouts were toasty enough and had a strong hint of horse radish. But the squash tart was to die for. Corn bread was buttery and sweet. I enjoyed my fried chicken, but not as much as the cheddar waffle below it. Wish they had some fresh squeezed lemonade to go with it! Water service was exemplary.

I'm giving them 4 stars because my first visit last July 2017 the food was really good. I had the pecan French toast and it will not disappoint. However, this time I opt for the pork chop and waffles (chicken & waffles are only for dinner time) and it was very underwhelming. The most disappointing part of it all was that it was super salty. My friend had the same and they kindly sent it back. But when it returned it lacked taste. So we gave up. We didn't make a fuss but I gather they would have been pretty helpful about it. Prior to this I had an old fashion at the bar at 10;30am. Judge your mom! The service here is great and rather small. So the wait can be long but worth it for the pecan French toast and pancakes.
The almonds and pickles are a must. The mussels are delicious, but the fried chicken is the star! Veggie burger is fantastic too

Me and my wife visited this amazing brunch place. I got the pecan French toast and she got fried egg with toast. Two things really stood  out 1. the servers were really polite and warm 2. This was the amongst the top 2 French toasts I ever had.

Brunch of my dreams. I usually don't write reviews but feel the need to write one because this place is just that good. I had green tea and eggs huntington and we split the pickles. Even the green tea was fun and exciting - order it and see for yourself. I'm already looking forward to my next visit here and in the meantime I'll be dreaming about that buttermilk biscuit.

Carroll Gardens houses a handful of really good restaurants and Buttermilk Channel is right up there with the best.Service is excellent and servers are very nice and patient.Food is wonderful, from Burgers to Moule Frites. Great cocktails too.Great restaurant and I would highly recommend stopping by.

So my friends and I did brunch on a gloomy  raining day but unlike the outside inside this place was a very different atmosphere as soon as you step in. They play lively music at time people sang along what was playing, it honestly felt like an intimate party. The drinks were good but a little on the pricey side and the wait time was to be expect for a place like this.

It was a dreary, rainy cold night. Each place we happened upon was booked solid or 2 hour wait being that it was also Saturday night before Valentine's week. What a relief our quoted 2 hour wait turned into Now when we just took a chance to get out of the rain into BC. Popovers were crisp with a bit of salt and drenched in clover honey. Wonderful. Boar ribs with grape potatoes were roasted and stewed in a rich mustard tangy bbq sauce with compote. Finger licking good. Oh my.The popovers and ribs on roids should've clued us into what a bellyful meal we were about to partake...That buttermilk fried chicken and cornmeal waffles with That balsamic "crack" maple syrup... my oh my. It's really a crust to be jealous of and a well executed buttery salty sweet light waffle mix. That flat iron steak was done- perfectly. Rare with just a hit of sear even though he'd requested medium-rare. What a treat for me indeed. Moist, fork tender filet soft and sitting atop a steak au ju reduction with smashed Idaho fingerlings and my personal fave- Brussels sprouts.It was as if the Gods said- "what will you have for dinner tonight?"

Great food and also a great location. The staff was friendly and made some solid recommendations. The one drawback is that they don't take reservations for brunch or lunch so the wait was almost 2 hours. For such a small space, a lean back reservation system might be beneficial in alleviating long wait times. Overall a great experience though.

Went to Buttermilk Channel for breakfast. Got there around 11 and was told there was 40 minute wait. We ended up walking around the area - went to a cool record store/cafe down the street and some other mini stores to kill time. We came back after i got the text saying our table was ready. The menu is a bit limited - special scrambled eggs, pancakes, waffles, and some other sandwich lunch type food. Overall the food was delicious - the only thing that bothered me was that the side bread was hard as rocks lol. Other than that the best thing to be honest was their pancakes + their music selection. They played Hot in Here by Nelly and then this waitress was breaking it down. Overall I would definitely come again.

Disgusted and never again! We came there for an early dinner with our toddler, it was pouring rain, we walked in 4 minutes before they opened (literally at 4:56 pm) since the door was unlocked so we thought they were open. The hostess says, "We're not open yet!" and literally shoves us out of the restaurant into the rain and locks the door. The hosting staff is despicable! And that, to me, speaks volumes of the owners since they actually hired her - especially into what is supposed to be a neighborhood, family-friendly restaurant. Utter disbelief. Needless to say, we turned around and went to Talde since they're lovely and it's always a great experience. We frequent many other places in the surrounding neighborhoods and have NEVER had an experience like that!

Just left this place and it really met my expectations and more . I've been meaning to get here for like forever and finally was able to. I came with a party of 6 and we waited for about 30 35 minutes which wasn't bad on a Saturday . This place is small and intimate so expect to wait on a Saturday brunch morning . I don't know how they are during the week but they probably are always busy because the food is the bomb dot com. First off I had peppermint tea and it was well worth it. It came in this cool loose leaf glass and it was nice because when you go to other places it's a tea bag and that's all you get but you really get a nice size of tea . I had the one of the scrambles the house cured lox with green onions and cream cheese . It came in a little bowl mug which was really cute . It came with salad hash brown and toast . What I loved about this meal it was hearty , it was seasoned to perfection and just so good . Even down to the salad. I also had a walnut sticky bun . It was average but it may have been good if I ate it when it was hot lol. I legit ate everything . The staff was very sweet and our waiter was the cutest and attentive . I will def be back here ! Keep doing your thangggg buttermilk channel !

So glad I finally got to try out Buttermilk Channel! I've been wanting to go for a very long time and finally tried it for restaurant week. I'm not always in love with the restaurant week options but it was so much delicious food! I started with their potato soup, got the fried chicken and ended with their pecan pie sundae. It was a really delicious meal (the breading on the chicken - YUM) and I got leftovers! The only thing I'd change - the sundae was a little tough to eat. I felt like I was making a mess, trying to get whipped cream, ice cream and pecans all in one bite. Will for sure back!
The buttermilk fried chicken sandwich was delicious, I recommend getting their pre-fix options.  The banana pudding with caramel popcorn topped with bourbon whipped cream was tasty too!
This place was amazing my bf and i visited and our minds were blown. By far the best grits I've ever eaten i would def go back if i ever go back to Kentucky to visit

This might be my favorite brunch spot in all of New York City. Let's be honest, the name itself is pretty spectacular. My friends and I stumbled upon this little hidden gem during one of my random trips into the city. It's a very hipster type restaurant with a wide variety of people. The venue itself is very small so be sure to make reservations are plan to wait about 15-30 minutes for a table. I ordered the fluffy Buttermilk pancakes with bacon, eggs and sausage. I mistaking ordered the Otis which is great if you are trying to get wasted at 1 in the afternoon. It was super strong, but very flavorful. Next time I'll just have the Mimosa which is pretty darn good. Just writing this review is making me hungry, definitely heading back to this spot soon!
Nice small restaurant. The oysters with bacon bbq was delicious. The chicken sandwich was delicious too

Before Buttermilk Channel got its publicity on the Food Network it was pretty good. Now...its sub par. My boyfriend and I went for brunch about a year prior, but I have not returned. Here is why... I had the smoked salmon and two biscuits that were on the brunch menu and it completely turned me off from eating smoked salmon. The flavor was there, but nothing to write home about. It pains me to even write such a meh review about this business but they need to revamp their recipes. Oh, just so you know, never go on the weekends or you WILL wait 2 hours for a table. Reservations included you will still have to wait an additional 45 mins.

This place is amazing!! They have the nicest hostess, they were accurate with the timing (there was an hour wait) but it was SO worth it!! They played great music and the food was savory and just perfect. The biscuits were fluffy and buttery, the pancakes are sweet and fluffy (and served with real syrup)! I highly recommend this place for brunch!

As soon as I entered I was welcomed with a smile. I kinda expected it would be busy and I wouldn't be able to get a table since it's Sunday and around the time people go out for brunch. I waited 40 minutes. They were very accommodating. The Bloody Mary was excellent. The food was really good. I like the music being played inside. Great atmosphere. Most definitely go back next time I visit Brooklyn.

Heard so much about the place, unfortunately wasn't impressed. The place is small which is fine, the service during brunch was bellow average. They may want to invest into more waiting staff and possibly additional costumer service. The staff was not pleasant and the brunch felt rushed. I get that they need to rotate tables to make a profit but we were not there more then 40 minutes and the staff just kept rushing.

Currently waiting to be seated at Buttermilk Channel and just witnessed the most outrageous act! We were told the wait would be 1- 1 1/2hour wait. We agreed and wrote our names down for 4 people. 40 minutes go by and here comes another family of four to be seated. Apparently friends of the hostess, Laura. I clearly hear her say "don't worry, I'll get you right in". I COULDN'T BELIEVE MY EARS!! They wait less than 10 minutes and are seated. I ask Laura why were they seated before us when clearly we got there first and she completely disregarded the fact. Never have I ever been treated so poorly. The only reason we decide to stick around and eat at Buttermilk Channel was because I promised my readers a full review of the place. Unfortunately, after tasting the limited brunch menu I decided it would be a waist of time to even promote this place at my website. Such a disappointment!

Pancakes were good but nothing out of this world, I was expecting a lot more because of the amazing reviews. Pork chop was perfectly cooked - very tender and could cut with just a fork but slightly flavorless. My favorite was the short ribs!!!! Just wish the portion was bigger
Love this place their brunch is spectacular. The wait can be extensive but the food is worth the wait!

Wonderful brunch spot! A bit slow on the service but it's well worth the wait. The staff from the bartender, waiters to the manager were all super duper nice. I ordered the short rib hash which was slightly dry but tasty. My lady ordered the eggs Huntington, eggcellent choice. The biscuits and the hollandaise sauce just worked so well. Now the real star of this place is that damn pecan French toast! The French toast is sooo fluffy and warm like a little buttery pillow and the syrup sooo sweet and caramelly. Topped with a thick but airy cream, it was caramel pecan cake.Who ever comes here must, MUST order the pecan French toast.

I came here for brunch for New Year's Day. They were super busy at 11AM so we were really fortunate to snag seats at the bar. Their coffee here is really good. It's not bitter, and the flavor is smooth and deep. Get their coffee!Now, for the food:Walnut Sticky Bun: A delightful treat for those craving something sweet, but not big enough to be a meal. We ordered one to share for the table to get our stomach ready for the entree. It was delicious.I had the Eggs Huntington which is their version of Eggs Benedict. The biscuit was good and I normally don't like biscuit. The eggs were poached well, and there was also ham which went well altogether.I tried some of the Pecan Pie French Toast and THAT is a winner. There was plentiful of pecans in each bite and the cream on the side was SO creamy and SO good. I regret not choosing this as my entree!!The staff were all sweet. Food does take time to come out, so if you're hungry, look into ordering a starter.

I now see the fuss about this place. It has a nice vibe and ambiance. Service was great. We went for brunch on New Year's day without reservations, the wait was about 15 mins. Our food took a long time to come out and the waitress came to apologize and gave us our coffees free of charge. I had the pork chop and cheddar waffles over greens and my friend had the pancakes. The pork chop was delicious, perfectly seasoned and crispy. The cheddar waffles were crispy and well done, you could definitely taste the cheese. Pancakes were ok.

I had the steak it was lovely. My sister had the burger which was also really good. Their amaretto sour was exquisite and the desert, the pecan pie sundae was rich. I wish I had room to finish it. It's a bit too dim but the ambience is lovely. They even have a curtain blocking the door, not sure why but it was quite thick and helped block the cold. Our waitress was ok, other servers walking were awkward.
Chicken and waffles were amazing and the margaritas were my favorite! Really nice atmosphere as well

Maple Bacon almondsBanana Walnut sticky bunFried pork chop with cheddar wafflelamb and cauliflower saladWell this place sure fills up fast. Boyfriend and I got here around 9:55am and realized we were too early for the rest of the group. The restaurant was nearly empty then. We decided to take a walk around the neighborhood and came back at 10:15am. The whole place was completely full and was told there would be a 30-45min wait. Wow. Everything was delicious and the host was the friendliest.

the food was AMAZING! I got the fried chicken sandwich and it was delicious! My husband got the pork chop and it was tender and perfectly cooked. the waitress was really sweet despite being a bit short staffed on a weekday afternoon. But regardless, it didn't stop us or other costumers from making time for lunch at Buttermilk.
The short rib hash was just delish!!! Gonna come back and try their pork chops and waffles!

Worth the trip to this side of Brooklyn. This small establishment has some of the best ever I must say.To eat we started with the corn bread with a side of Chile maple sauce. Absolutely devine for a starter.Next we had the pork chop and waffle. The waffle was crispy and packed with flavor. The pork choo was a bone in with a perfect thin crispy outside, tender and juicy inside. Savory and so so good.Second entree was the chicken sandwich. The pickled veggies on the sandwich was a nice touch. It is huge! Chicken was fresh and perfectly fried up. The pork chop and waffle was still light years ahead of the chicken sammy.Get the pork chop and waffle. You must!!!!

When my sister suggested this place I was a little worried it was going to be another overpriced regular brunch spot in Brooklyn. To my surprise everything was so good. I had the pecan French toast with a side order of eggs and cheese. It was delicious the French toast wasn't overly sweet and the eggs were seasoned really well. My sister had the highly recommended pork chop with cheddar cheese waffle. She wasn't disappointed. We also had a side order of biscuit also SUPER DELICIOUS. I highly recommend this place. Also, when you put your name down on the waiting list they send you a text notifying you your table is ready. So you can go out and explore.

Stopped in on a Monday evening with a craving for fried chicken on our way home from work.  This is a really nice restaurant in Brooklyn and it was very quiet when we arrived, we were seated immediately (close to 7pm).  There was a Monday night special, I think, but it would've been too much food so we both opted for the Fried Chicken and Waffles each.  The portions are hefty and all I can say is the chicken was delicious, crispy, moist and tender, very tasty and just what I needed; excellent fried chicken.  I will be back for the same dish very soon.

2nd time around the was even better! The brunch is absolutely delicious! There are no reservations for brunch and it's pretty busy on the weekends so expect to wait about an hour. Totally worth the wait! Food came exceptionally quick- super casual which is great when you're munching out- and its in BK duh!
So good! The cocktails were awesome. The duck meatloaf was so rich and amazing. The Chicken and Waffles were the best we've ever had. MUST COME BACK!

Biscuits are hmm good like the other reviews say.  Went on a Saturday afternoon in August. The wait was about 30 min which wasn't so bad. The inside was a bit humid though, could have used the AC to cool things down.  I had the porkchop and waffles which left much to be desired. It was just okay.  The porkchop was pretty flavorless and the waffle was pretty average. What really made my meal was our order of biscuits.  Would not travel so far again for brunch but if you are close by I would stop by to try the biscuits only.

We had a great time coming in for a late dinner last Tuesday.  It was mostly empty, but service was great.  Servings were much larger than I would have anticipated and everything was delicious. We had poppems (which were delicious), fall-off-the-bone ribs, beer mussels (also amazing, nice and buttery and warm, roasted vegetables (which even my veggie-hating-bf loved) and the chicken and waffles.  It's a tad high on the price tag for a once-a-week joint, but as we wanted everything on the menu, I know we'll be back.
Consistently great food and service.  The Monday night $40 dinner special is well worth it.  Cocktails and wine are well priced.
Love, Love, Love their food. the only thing is that its always packed there. be prepared to wait. Took my kids and sisters and we had great meal and the place was cozy.

Got the fried pork chop with cheddar waffles after I was informed they didn't serve fried chicken during brunch. SAY WHAT NOW? But that fried pork chop made up for it. So crispy on the outside, so juicy on the inside. Love that farmhouse feel inside, but seating is pretty tight. Have to come back for that fried chicken!
Cute little restaurant on the corner. Great drinks and yummy good.

This place is so cute and cozy and the food is delicious! The bourbon pecan French toast was so fluffy and soft on the inside. It was so good, feels like heaven. And the hash brown, soft and warm on the inside and crunchy on the outside, delicious, never had hash brown like this before, it was delicious! Didn't like the fried pork chop but the eggs Huntington was good and the hash pork that they had was good too. Definitely gonna come back again. Very good atmosphere and good. So cozy! This is a good spot for brunch! Maybe I'll come back for dinner to try the fried chicken, they only have fried chicken during dinner time.

Ordered the fried pork chop w/cheddar waffles - okBloody Mary - good Biscuits - dry but good jelly The place is a bit pricey considering what they're actually giving you. Quality is there but nothing exceptional. I'm racking my brain trying to figure out why this place is so highly reviewed. The food was just ok. My first hipster shakedown in the gentrified part of Brooklyn.

I found buttermilk channel because I was looking for a place to take my girlfriend for dinner for her birthday.  Since she is a vegetarian living in Brooklyn I researched the best vegetarian restaurants in Brooklyn and Buttermilk Channel was in one of the articles I read.  The article went on and on about how BC isn't a vegetarian restaurant but it has several dishes that cater to them in a relaxing environment.  As a lover of fried chicken myself, I was immediately drawn to this place.  I looked at the reviews on yelp and was convinced that this was the place for us.  We started with a buttermilk ricotta tart that was honestly one of the best appetizers I've ever had.  The pomegranate and figs complimented the ricotta wonderfully.  She had veggie lasagna and I had the chicken and waffles.  Both entries were fresh and incredibly good.  On top of the wonderful food and atmosphere, our sever Catlyn was wonderful.  She was personable and friendly and knew exactly how much to interact with us.  At one point during the evening when the gf was in the bathroom I approached our server while she was inputting an order, I apologized for interrupting and explained that it was a birthday dinner and asked that if we happened to order a dessert if they could put a candle in.  She said of course and I went back to my table.  After dinner, we both agreed that we were more than satisfied and didn't want dessert but were still brought a small pastry with a candle in it.  All in all, it was one of the best meals either of us have ever had in a great setting with great service.  I can't recommend Buttermilk Channel enough.  We will certainly be back.

Fried chicken sandwich was ample, but Lacked Any Flavor ~ dry bun, barely dressed dry coleslaw that also lacked any flavor. Bun completely fell apart.  A cheap restaurant bun, they need a sturdier fresher not stale bun.  Chicken also had big pieces of fat and gristle.  Chicken needed flavor, should of been some sort of sauce  or aioli or flavored aioli on bun  or served on side as this was one of the most boring fried dried chicken sandwiches i have had!  Sad, i was excited to come here. French fries were frozen restaurant fries, boring soggy & with tiny bits that got crispy . Totally flavorless limp fries, that for $6 should at least be made fresh in house-Waitress/hostess was more preoccupied with her phone.Never came to ask me how food was, never came back once after serving.  my water glass sat empty for 20 minutes, finally the other waitor came and gave me a refill  and gave me my bill.I always leave a great tip even when food is bad!! But when service is bad, 10% is a lucky tip. Basically i was ignored and served a terrible excuse for a fried chicken sandwich. So it was bad service! And bad food!Really disappointed in whole experience.No need to come back.

I wish I could give this place 3 1/2 stars...it doesn't quite fall into the the 3 star category so I didn't think it would be fair but there are definitely enough shortcomings that I won't be coming back despite the food being very good. I think most of the issues stem from the fact that it's just too crowded. They literally have the tables one on top of another...two inches apart...not kidding...the couple next to us was having some sort of emotional conversation and we were right in it...I felt super uncomfortable through our entire meal...on the same note...the overcrowding leaves the service a little lacking...the servers are obviously trying and they're pleasant but you will still be left feeling like they're trying to rush you out to accommodate the 40 person wait. All that being said we won't be coming back...if the venue was larger or not crowded with wall to wall tables this place would be amazing.

got here pretty early on a Sunday morning, didn't have to wait for a table for two though there was a line for larger parties and twosomes that arrived after we had. I had pancakes (my favorite breakfast food), bacon, Bloody Mary. Nothing was all that great, I was pretty disappointed in these famous pancakes. Clinton Street Baking Co. was much better, as far as NYC pancakes. The Bloody Mary was probably the best thing, and that wasn't anything to write home about itself. The bacon was...not good. I'm starting to think NYC doesn't quite do breakfast/brunch the way we do in LA...smh

It's voted one of the best brunches for a reason. I can't explain it. The dishes are similar to other brunch places but so good! Get there when they open or you will wait. I have walked away a few times because the wait is just too long.

Great food, nice portions, and pretty fast service!  We enjoyed the fried pork chop+waffle and the rib let+eggs. I'm really big on service.  Let's be honest...it's the main reason we eat out vs cooking at home.  I've been known to give establishments with a mediocre menu a second look because of their outstanding service.  With that said, our server was the only negative part of our experience.  However the establishment shouldn't be avoided; as everyone else was really welcoming and accommodating!  P.S. You know the food is good when you're dancing in your seat between bites but every once in a while your moves are accompanied by great tunes played as a backdrop! Now that's NYC Brunchin'!

I've been wanting  to o check out Buttermilk channel for a while now, but due to the long weekend wait times I was never able to make it, till today. Got a reservation through opentable and ordered their famous buttermilk fried chicken sandwich! It was super crispy and juicy! Fried chicken perfection! Highly recommend it!

If I could give this place ZERO stars, I would!!!My husband and I were visiting family in NY and my sister decided to have brunch at this spot for her birthday and let me just say their customer service was HORRIBLE. Mainly the hostess, she was just RUDE, NASTY, DISRESPECTFUL and made the experience distasteful. NOTE that we were just waiting to be seated, granted the place was busy, but all my sister did was ask for a status on the time for our table to be ready, the hostess just went into straight frustration mode!!! We just decided as a group of 7 to try elsewhere because of her DISRESPECTFUL ATTITUDE, even as we were walking out the hostess continued on with her rudeness and sass. Girl bye!

I love this place.  We came for dinner and shared a fantastic chicken liver mousse, amazing popovers and a whole seabass.  The bass was quite salty.  This seems to be trend lately - to use a heavy hand with sea salt.  Next time  i will  request a lighter hand with the salt but overall it was amazingly good.  The service is outstanding.  Our waitress was very attentive, knowledgeable regarding the specials and very good about bringing share plates and serving spoons to the table.

Had brunch here today with my husband.  I'm a big brunch eater and this place gets good reviews so I thought what better for a rainy sunday afternoon?We were seated right away (it was easier to squeeze in as a two top sitting at the bar- wait was longer for other parties)i had the short rib hash, husband had the roasted mushroom scramble. Both were great. We also ordered a side of bacon which was very good, and a side of biscuits. which was MASSIVE. it comes with 2 and honestly i could have split one and been just fine.coffee was okay, not great, but not bad.Overall, a very pleasant experience. The service was great too.

If you r craving for a fried chicken this is the place! My husband and I went there for lunch on the weekday, no wait for the table.We ordered: 1) fried chicken sandwich- this is very good fried chicken. The skin is very crispy and the meat is so soft and juicy. The slaws is fresh and some hint of spicy. 2) grilled cheese sandwich- I think is ok not bad but not special.3) side of fries- just regular friesOverall in my opinion this is the place for fried chicken sandwich! Portion is big, restaurant is cute, service is ok.

Look, this isn't rocket science. You come here for brunch, you order the sticky buns, some bacon, and the chicken and waffles. You enjoy the hell out of them. You eat every last bite. You pay the bill, you tip well because the service is great, and you leave satisfied at a great price. I've been for dinner and brunch, while the dinner is good, nothing compares to the brunch. No reservations for brunch, so get there nice and early and prepare to wait. Worth the wait though.

Superb place for brunch and one of our most favourite place both in New York and Brooklyn.Today we had the pancakes and the scrambled eggs with goat cheese and mushrooms, Divine is all I can say .Extremely warm and friendly service and at the end can't really say what was better , service or food.Let us make it simple , both were superlative.Been to this place before too and will keep going back .

First time visiting this establishment was yesterday. Even though, there was a lot of ppl waiting to be seated, the wait was not bad compared to other places I have gone to. I enjoyed my brunch and so did my friend. The service was excellent. Our host was very friendly although it may have looked overwhelming for her, but she surely didn't show it. I'm glad that I went and will definitely return.
I ordered the Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwich. Very crispy on the outside tender and juicy on the inside. The staff is friendly even though they are always busy.

I went for brunch and as always it was delicious!  The food never disappoints. My sister and I shared 2 brunch entrees: cheddar waffles with pork chops and the pecan french toast with whipped cream. Yummy!!
Came here for brunch and it was okay. I ordered the French toast with a side of bacon. The menu didn't seem enticing like how everyone mentioned so I ordered what I thought was safe.

Was here several weeks ago and fell in love. To tell the whole story, something happened with our order and the food took a really long time to come out, but the service staff recognized the error, fixed it, and we all lived happily ever after. Yes. Humans make mistakes sometimes. You know what fixes mistakes, the best breakfast you've ever had. I'm trying not to be dramatic but I can't remember when I had a breakfast quite so tasty. The french toast is out of this world.

Just had brunch here with my boyfriend. He's been here once before a few years back. He told me it wasn't as great as everyone said it was but wanted me to judge for myself. Especially since I had this place bookmarked for sometime now. So we finally went today..The woman put in our name & told us a 30min wait or more but they will text us when a table is ready. It was pretty hot & since they only had 2 fans going we decided to go cool down somewhere else. We went about 5 blocks away to get some orgaic juices. 45 min past, no text so we decided to walk back. The woman must have forgotten b/c when she saw us, she reacted as if we just walked in for the first time, she got us a table though. So always check in, don't rely on that text, you may not get it. I've read about the sticky walnut bun, so l ordered that & my boyfriend asks what l thought. I said it's dry, too much cinnamon & no walnuts & barely any glaze. He said "that's exactly what l thought when l ordered it last time l was here". So strike 1.We ordered coffee & an iced coffee (if they had simple syrup to sweeten up the iced coffee). The simple syrup looked like water (not syrupy like it should hence the name). I had tasted my coffee before l used that & before l poured in the milk. It tasted horrible so l thought let me add those & see if it still sucked.. it did. I asked my boyfriend what he thought of his coffee, he says "it's really weak & tastes bad" so we called our waiter over & had him take'em back & we just stuck with water. Strike 2!Then l ordered their popular Pecan Pie French Toast, which was not bad, although mine had a smoky bacon taste to it so l'm assuming they put it on the same stove plate as someone's bacon. Not good for Vegetarians! *So you Vegetarians beware*. Still not bad & definitely better than that sticky bun! The Bf had 2 poached eggs on ham & toast w/a side of salad. He said the poached eggs were over done & the whole thing just tasted mediocre. Where are all these great reviews coming from??I went online for the bathroom at the end of our meal, the line was in view of the kitchen & l saw one of the chefs (who had a long beard but NO BEARD NET, yuck)...he grabbed a pancake (with his bare hands)..from a pile of an already cooked pancakes to heat up. l guess for whoever ordered pancakes, l'm glad l didn't order those! We definitely wouldn't come back, especially with that long of a wait, to be let down with the food. I gave the 2nd star only for ambiance & decent french toast.

I've been to this restaurant three times with friends and family, and have really enjoyed myself. The food was good with just the right twist. Chicken with pancakes, baby back ribs are just two of the delicious items on the menu. It gets crowded early and sometimes the wait is a bit long but worth it. I certainly wish it was a bit larger because it would be somewhere I'd go with a group of friends.

So last Saturday I died and went to brunch heaven!!! Literally. I had one of the best brunches I've had in a long time. It was one of those experiences that had me smiling and rubbing my belly all day.For quite some time now I've wanted to try buttermilk channel but walking by and seeing the weekend line has made me shy of the situation. I decided to finally give it a go as I couldn't resist their photos here on yelp.I came on a Saturday and showed up around 12:15pm. I was told it would take about 40 minutes to be seated which I was fine with this time around, I gave them my number and they said they would text when a table is available. About fifteen minutes later I got a text and bam I was in! So just a tip, give it a try you may get a table sooner than the expected wait time.I ended up ordering the pancakes, the short rib hash and a sticky bun. To be honest after I ordered I was worried I chose the wrong thing as the amazing french toast kept being served around me, (next time I'm trying it for sure it looks incredible)Well, let's just say I was not disappointed at all!Where do I start?....The sticky bun was sooo good. It was not too swee,t so it was enjoyable every single bite. It was soft chewy and had just the right amount of icing on it.The short rib hash, it was more than I expected. Loads of short rib with hints of potatoes here and there served with a bed of greens and mini toasts topped with two sunny side up eggs. I can still taste it now, it was so flavorful and everything on the plate complimented one another The pancakes....three fluffy, buttery fresh cakes served with the lightest and most perfect syrup I could have imagined. They were probably the best pancakes I've had.All in all I will 100 percent be back, probably in a few days as I can't wait too long to experience the goodness againAlso, the staff were all very nice!Oh wait....i also got a side of bacon.....best bacon ever!!! Really balances out the sweetness from the pancakes and the sticky bun

I had my birthday dinner here, and all of us loved our food! Great for groups, and they brought out a pecan pie sundae thing with candles for me that was honestly amazing. I've also brunched here, and it is a great spot for people watching and petting cute neighborhood dogs. Definitely a great spot to hit up in Carroll Gardens!

It was a friend's birthday and he wanted to go out for brunch, so he decided on this place. We waited an hour and 15 minutes to get in (to be fair we didn't arrive until after 1 for brunch) but it was totally worth it. I had the Eggs Huntington and two bellini's and I was stuffed and happy when I left. My friends enjoyed their own dishes and drinks as well and it concluded as a successful birthday brunch!
The brunch was so tasty here it was worth the 1.5 hr wait. I was there a while ago and had the bean stew with egg simply amazing
As busy as it gets here, the food is good and the service is on par regardless how hectic it gets. (Sunday Brunch)

Just returned from the quickest dine-in solo brunch. Not because of anything in regards to the restaurant... I guess except for the volume levels of conversational patrons and tight bar seating. After all, it is midday Saturday brunch service.Onward to the food... I've been meaning to visit this place for quite a long time. Luckily, I now live nearby. I woke up this morning with a craving for American food, so I decided to give it a go. I ordered the Eggs Huntington and a side of Cheddar Waffles. It was good. You can definitely taste the freshness and vibrancy of the ingredients; the delicious buttermilk of both the biscuits and waffles; the richness of the eggs and hollandaise; and the beautifully light, tangy dressing on the greens. I commend them for sourcing locally and ethically, which probably justifies the price. The plates came kind of room temperature, though.The service was okay. The hostess was quite lovely. The light-skinned server at the bar, not so much. I guess that's hipster Carroll Gardens for ya!Would I return? Perhaps. Not for a while though. This introvert descended from immigrants doesn't crave American food that often.PS: Kudos to whoever decided this brisk pre-autumn day needed some All Things Must Pass.

Overall Buttermilk Channel provides a pretty good dining experience. My wife and I visited shortly after opening one day because I read that they can be a line outside depending on when you visit so we wasted no time. Buttermilk Channel has been in my bookmarks for a while and so I was amped up about this meal. Walked in we were greated by a friendly hostess who showed us to our seat and followed by our waiter. Menu was provided and we ordered. I got the fried chicken that was raved about in the reviews along with a side of fries. To drink I had a beer off tap. When my meal came out it not only caught my eyes but also the family who was just seated next to us. Presentation is perfect. Food was amazing. I was so full I even had to get a take home box. I definitely recommend the fried chicken meal when visiting but other items on the menu also sound amazing. Four stars instead of five because they can surely improve on the sauce that comes with the fried chicken and the menu prices that surely did add up.

It's a cute little restaurant in Carroll gardens!The servers are very nice and attentive. The food is good, but wasn't out of this world. It's a little pricey considering it's not amazing, but the portion sizes are good. They're not too large but not too small. I had the lox for brunch and it came with a side salad- the salad was great!I would come back sometime. I don't understand why people wait in line for hours to eat here. They actually have a little crowd waiting outside on weekends before it even opens. Tip from a resident in the area: if you go before 1, there's no line. I walk by it all the time on weekend mornings and there's always empty seats. The moment 2pm rolls around, there's a crowd waiting.

Being here for brunch and lunch, the food was  good both times, I won't go as far as saying exceptionally good but very good, the service was great when we went there for lunch but it was on a Friday around 12 in the afternoon and it was not crowded, the service for the brunch was decent and the place was packed( we found out that on the weekends the chicken and waffles were only served at dinner not during brunch). All in all a good experience.

My hubby and I decided to pop into Buttermilk Channel on Labor Day 2017. Off the back I could tell it was going to be a pleasant experience. Every staff member that we encountered was professional, more particularly our waitress, who was very patient as my husband roamed the menu for 15 minutes trying to decide what to order. On the other hand I knew I wanted chicken and waffle no sides no appetizers and a glass of wine to tingle my taste buds. For the price the chicken and waffle portion is appropriate. The waffle itself is out of this world delicious: Seriously, my waffle was so good I couldn't wait to bite into it again and again, and was sad once I had eaten it all up. The chicken on the other hand was alright. Overall a very solid experience!

Brooklyn should be proud of this restaurant! Really nice place to mingle with friends!Location: It is a 5 minute walk from the subway, G or F train is the closest one. The interior is nice, not too fancy. Also it is good for groups. There is also outdoor seating.Service: The server is very nice! Eventhough it is only 3 of them they handle it well. We got seated immediately.Food: The food is really good! Let me start with the house made ricotta, I love the pecans on top of the ricotta, the bread is a little bit dry but it is okay. Second is the Buttermilk fried chicken sandwich, OMG it is so huge and two breast part, the chicken is very crispy and inside is moist and juicy, it has coleslaw as well, the bread is soft, too huge that I took home the rest. The dessert is banana pudding and pecan pie sundae. The banana pudding is just okay for me, it is like a puree banana with cream and popcorn, too sweet for my palate. The pecan pie is good, with ice cream in it.Huge servings for the money! Good food as well! A must visit restaurant in Brooklyn!

Every time I come here, the staff is always super on top of their stuff, and the food is always delicious. It's reasonably priced, in my opinion, and the portions are nicely sized. It gets a little busy around dinner time, but I've never had a problem getting a seat, and I frequently bring people here for the calm ambience and outdoor seating.

Great food!!!!! Love coming here for brunch but get here at a good time since there's a good wait to get inside. Two star knock off for the rude, sarcastic and biased receptionist (referring to the big lady, I noticed how you are with certain people and they way you look at them too, yikes :-X!!)

My neighborhood favorite. The service is always great. The staff is so well informed. The food is really awesome. Bloody Mary's amazing !!!And they have great management.  Went in here with my boyfriend once and we were seated at a tight table and I didn't want to make a stink it's New York and that's inevitable but I hate to sit so close to other people.  She saw we were uncomfortable and went out of her way to find us somewhere roomier. I was so impressed.
The hubby and I stopped in for a quick bite. I had no idea restaurant week was on! Service was nice and courteous. The ambiance was simple and comfortable, not too loud. The food was excellent.
Good service/atmosphere.  Food was meh.  Don't get the Bean Stew.
Bad Vibe!! Bad Hospitality!! Can't say much about the food. Didn't stick around to find out.

Simply delicious! The veggie burger was so yummy and the chicken sandwiches were a huge hit with friends. The corn salad and fries were perfect sides and dessert is not to be missed! The banana pudding is delicious!

Came for lunch with my significant other. We ordered the pickles as a snack and it was a weird flavored pickle. My boyfriend didn't really like it. We also ordered the avocado toast and that was good but the bread was too fluffy. I think it would've tasted a lot better if it was thin and crunchy. We shared the French fries which was amazing, each fry was thin and crunchy, just the way I love it! I had the chicken sandwich and I absolutely loved it. I was wowed at how much flavor the chicken had even after being fried. The sandwich itself was definitely a 5. My boyfriend had the grilled cheese without apples. It was about a 3. The price was right, definitely worth it. The waiter was friendly and attentive. Definitely a place to check out!

It was definitely lived up to its hype. Pro tip would be to get there early. I got lucky and arrived before a whole cluster of people. I love a good Bloody Mary and they had great options. My friends and I shared some plates like the brisket hash. I had the the pork chops with a side of poached eggs and I don't have enough words to describe how tasty and perfect it was. The service was pleasant and speedy despite how busy it was, everyone seemed to be in a good mood. Everything about the decor was simple and perfect, clean and elegant. You must come here early, go get coffee across the street and wait till your table is ready. It's worth the wait

This has been my favorite find in Brooklyn so far. The attention to detail on the menus are very well executed. The cocktails are refreshing, the serving sizes on the dishes are generous and the desserts are worth saving room for (especially the banana pudding)
The food was exceptional!! I loved the two dishes that I ordered. My only quarry was that the orange juice I ordered arrived in a child sized glass, yet I paid $4 for it.

I do love brunch, but in most places they serve things that I feel like I could just as easily make at home. Not so here. I don't know how they did it, but they were the nicest scrambled eggs I've ever tasted (they came with lox and cream cheese). The prices are really reasonable for such a nice restaurant.
Food is delicious, you will not be disappointed. Super crowded for brunch as expected, but we've managed to get a table for a large group on a Sunday. Warning: the hash browns do not need more salt.
foods good. Just over priced for what the rest of the food in the area is sold for at cheaper prices

I heart this place!  We needed a kid friendly place with amazing food and came here! The staff was attentive and patient with our little one.  Children have a kids meal as well. The cheeseburger is amazing! We enjoyed a glass of rose with out fried chicken and duck meatloaf! Holy cow the entrees were delicious!  My meatloaf was moist and the corn complemented the dish well!

Pecan Pie French Toast....I cannot get the taste of the Pecan Pie French Toast off of my mind. Yes, that is how I am choosing to start this review. Why you may ask?...Because that is exactly how delicious the french toast tasted while having Brunch at Buttermilk Channel!-lol. It was the epitome of food greatness but I will come back to that in a bit....Buttermilk Channel is located in the Carroll Gardens section of Brooklyn which is quite a quiet and neighborly place. We decided to come here for brunch after I went on Yelp and saw all of the fantastic looking food in people's postings. Once we arrived at Buttermilk Channel, we were definitely able to confirm not only great looking but fabulously smelling food! I will never be able to verbalize just how wonderful the aromas were that emanated from the various dishes. All we did was ooh and aah at every single plate that went by us....It is a true testament to them having a extraordinary selection of options on their brunch menu!The friendly hostess informed us that we will have to wait about 30 minutes, however we were probably seated in about 15 minutes which was nice. Buttermilk staff provided prompt service as we received water, napkins etc. quickly. Thanks to Allison and Laura for being so lovely!Ok....so I had the Pecan Pie French Toast w / side of bacon. I have to give Kudos to Chef Chris because that Pecan Pie French Toast is two of the best tasting buttery pieces of french toast that I have ever had! Crispy around the edges and soft, fluffy goodness in the middle. Oh my.....the syrup and marvelous pecans that complimented the french toast made it perfection throughout each and every bite! I was also told about and got to taste some of Buttermilk Pancakes....Spectacular! The Bacon went well with the French toast. We had such a pleasurable experience...I need some more of that Pecan Pie French Toast in my life!-lol

My friend and I came here for brunch after reading all the great reviews. We didn't make a reservation, so when we went to put our name in we were told it would be a 45 minute wait. We then got notified when our table was ready via text message which was great. The menu is very simple yet delicious and we were both impressed with our meals (I got the lox platter and my friend got one of the scramble dishes). Our waitress was very nice, the ambiance of the restaurant is very down to earth and comfortable and I would highly recommend coming here for brunch.

Went here at 6:30pm on Saturday and was not totally crowded yet. The atmosphere inside and outside is really comforting. My buddy and I chose to sit at the bar. We ordered the Scallops special, house bacon with figs and sea bass dish. We replaced the meatloaf after finding it too salty. The waiter was a really nice gentleman. When the dish was too salty, he helped us replace it with another dish, the sea bass. My favorite dish of the night was the scallops special with couscous and eggplant sauce. It was really yummy. Highly recommend that dish. Also, parking was easy to find at this restaurant and the restaurant replaces your plate and utensils after every dish. I like this restaurant and want to come back to try the Fried Buttermilk chicken dish next time.

Stopped in for a quick dinner and the food was good. We started with the Green Goddess salad (avocado, bacon, onions) and inhaled it in two minutes! Ordered the burger and the chicken/waffles. The entrees were good (nothing special) and the food took about 30 minutes to come out.Overall an ok place and for what we ordered I think it's a bit over priced.

A great spot for brunch- they don't take reservations so plan for a wait before being seated. That says, the food was worth the hour long wait- the pecan pie French toast was to die fir and so was the bean stew!

My family and I went here for brunch and it was great! We showed up 10 minutes before it opened and there was already a line. I would recommend getting there a little early, but they have a lot of seating and got everyone settled quickly. We came back for dinner the next night and also had a great experience. The oysters were to die for and the waitress did a great job answering all of our questions. I would love to go back

Get the maple and bacon roasted almonds. They're so yummy! Really enjoyed brunch here. This place has a great laid back vibe. Got the fried porkchop and cheddar waffle. So good! I would come back to try more! And get more of those maple bacon almonds! Drool

The food was great.... I mean that's what you want to hear right? Oh you want me to be more descriptive... gotcha. So Buttermilk Channel is an amazing breakfast, brunch and dinner restaurant. It's has a hipster vibe to it. Everyone looks so artsy but with great food on your table your tunnel vision sets in and before you know it.... wham! Your gut is full and you want the check so you could go home lay down and dream about those awesome pancakes you devoured. Great place it's a must try!

The beau and I, sat at the bar.  The place was bustling at 2pm on a Saturday.  The bartender was friendly and attentive.  I had the lox scramble.  It was the perfect armpit of food for me.  The salad was beautifully dressed.  The hash brown was rich and small, and perfectly portioned.  He had a burger and fries, both were rated "pretty good."  We liked it.  We'd go back.

The food is what you'd expect from a place catering to people with a little too much money to spend on well-prepared but pretty standard fare -- the boob-inspired avocado toast (literally, two boob-y hard-boiled eggs on a smear of alien-inspired avocado flesh), skirt steak and lettuce (seriously $27 for ingredients that don't top $7).
