But what really left the bad taste was the surly, incompetent service. Admittedly, we were a large group. But we'd made a reservation the day before and had been counseled to come in two groups. So we did -- and no reservation had been communicated to the servers. They seated us, grudgingly, then treated us with "attitude" the whole meal, as if our $200+ expenditure on a slow Wednesday was not worth their time. One meal was never delivered, and when the guest mentioned it to have it removed from the bill, the server was openly rude. There are plenty of places to eat in the area -- I'd avoid the boob toast location. PS you can make delicious boob toast for about $2.00 and none of the attitude.

Returned for dinner with three friends and had an epic meal. First, I'd recommend bringing as many people as possible and sharing everything. We had the chicken and waffles, mushroom barley burger, market vegetable bowl, a pasta special with red pepper and pork, flatbread special with ricotta, spinach and mushroom, plus the pecan pie sundae and apple galette for dessert. The chicken is a must - perfectly cooked and served with amazing coleslaw and cheddar waffles - but everything else that I tried was also incredible. The ice cream here is Van Leeuwen (one of my favorite ice cream spots) so we got to enjoy that in our sundae, which paired nicely with our hot apple dessert. Would give this place 6 stars if I could.Note to self: return to try the duck meatloaf and pork chop that everyone's going on about.Edit 6/2017:Brunch was just as great this time! I repeated my order and added a side of biscuits as well. They were awesome but definitely not necessary on top of everything else. Fried pork chop and cheddar waffles were simply phenomenal, as was the eggs and hash dish.

Do not get any salads ! They are very overpriced and nothing special. I had received 4 pieces of lettuce with massive amounts of feta cheese and shreds of bacon. The price was $14. Not worth the money.

I just came here for brunch and the maitre d' (who I think was the owner by the way she treated us) was very nice and accommodating. I am not a pork eater but the fried pork chop (which I got because they said the buttemilk chicken was only offered for dinner) was very good. The cheddar waffle was also good although I was disappointed to see that it was only half of a belglan waffle (the amount of food was sufficient but since the menu didn't say half then of course I was expecting the full thing like most other places. I think this should be stated under the entree description.) My dining partner had the short-rib which they were very happy with (I tasted it and also thought it was very good). We got biscuits on the side which were filling but rather plain and dense- I could have done without these. Overall we had a very good meal with courteous and timely service; I would recommend it.

I came here for one thing and one thing only: buttermilk fried chicken! I got the chicken sandwich and it was filled with generous portion of fried chicken pieces, a mound of vinegary rough cut cole slaw, three pickles, and a garlic mayo sauce. They were served as two halves and you the customer are left with the challenge of assembling the chicken sandwich tower without it toppling over. It was amazing! Better than chick-fil-a. Better even than shake shack. The chicken was tender and juicy with a pleasantly crispy batter. The cole slaw was excessive and drips out as you eat the sandwich. I ended up eating the remaining slaw with a fork after I demolished the contents between the fluffy yellowy buns. Service was great and friendly too. I'll be back next time I'm in the Brooklyn area.

I went here years ago for my 21st birthday. I'm now 27 and I will definitely go back! Plus I work in the area. Very warm setting little close fitting but the waiters/waitresses are wonderful! Food is great as well! Can't wait to go back soon'with some of my gfs!
We had the porkchop and waffles and the short rib hash.  We also ordered a side of biscuits.  The biscuits were ok, a little dry.  The short rib hash was really good but the porkchop was just ok.

Had the best food on a night out in ages with fresh vegetables and tender beef entres.  We were welcomed with an unexpected free glass of champagne for our date night.  Service continued to be attentive but not intrusive.  The food was even better than six months ago when  we felt it was very tasty. The  fresh corn salad hadA decadent aioli dressing. Worth having dessert to share with Doug's pecan pie sundae m m m!. Definitely Will be back.  Great spot for Saturday night date night!

Excellent! My niece and I went today for the first time and I'm so glad we did. By the time we got there they were serving brunch so we got the pancakes with smoked bacon and scrambled eggs. DELICIOUS!  Also, the wait staff was friendly and helpful. All I can say is that they exceeded our expectations and we will definitely be back!

Had brunch here. Thoroughly enjoyed everything we ordered starting with bloody. The French toast was amazing, eggs Benedict were perfect. So many choices we had hard decisions to make. You can't go wrong! Can't wait to go back

This place is so good. We went for dinner and got the popovers, green goddess salad, bass, and warm lamb salad. All were delicious! Also had two gin and rose cocktails, which were fantastic. The outdoor seating was really nice, though the inside is nice too, just a little louder.
Never made it in, the line was horrible outside, wait too long.  I tried 2 day in a row. Ended up at Prime Meat.

3 words: chicken and waffles That combination just sounds amazing And going to buttermilk channel for the first time this past week was an interesting experience. My friends and I got a table outside enjoying the scenery. The host and server were very nice and attentive to our table. So why the 3 stars?The chicken was average , I did not find a reason for the price to be higher than $20 , (that may be my inner Asian stinginess speaking)We also ordered fries & DAMNN those fried were amazingly good. The condiment that came with the fries ( I'm guessing truffle mayo ?) was so good  honestly I would just come back for fries. I'm excited to go back to buttermilk channel for brunch since the pictures seem out of this world

went here today and was pretty satisfied. I would not say it's one of the best brunches we ever had but definitely a good one. My family and I ordered pork chop and waffles, french toast, rib hash and eggs and the scrambled eggs. the best thing by far was french toast, it was outstanding and one of the best i think i have ever had. the hash and eggs were solid. the porkchop and waffles were also quite good with a good fry on them. maybe the most underwhelming thing would be the eggs. I have to say the service was amazing, we had a super nice waiter that really took care of us!

Awesome spot for brunch! The food is delicious; who would say no to cheddar waffles? Yes, it tastes like what it's called.The wait time for a table can take a long while as it's always packed on the weekends for brunch, so be prepared to wait! It can also get packed inside with limited spacing.The fried pork chop and waffles for brunch is really good. We heard they only have chicken and waffles for dinner time and it's even better! We will come back for that!

It's OK, but just OK. We went for brunch and had the sticky bun (the best part, honestly), smoked bacon, fried pork chop w/ cheddar waffles (which, hilariously, comes atop a fatally limp bed of greens - what??), biscuits, and a salad (sorry, I can't remember which one). Long story short, it was all, well, just OK. Thing is, this type of food has become relatively common in Brooklyn -- no complaints, only there are significantly better options than Buttermilk Channel.

Guys this review is SO LATE. We had a gorgeous brunch at Buttermilk Channel  on December 4th 2016, after an all-nighter that began with a light supper at The Good Fork, a Bon Iver Show at Pioneer Works, and then a late night dinner at Prime Meats, followed by hours of whiskey and cards until day broke. I haven't written about this experience because the whole time is sort of blurred together as one contiguous hedonistic stream and maybe I've only just recently recovered from the epic hangover I accomplished but don't judge y'all ok? A Bloody Mary or two, the morning after a big night, fixes all. And when the Marys are freshly made, stuffed with crispy, salty and assertively flavored garnishes, served with compassion and tenderness, one's faith that another day will be had is restored all that more quickly. I know you're nodding. I know you've been there. After a brief wait (because we chose to eat at the bar, if you're targeting a table, be prepared for a longer wait), we each ordered a Classic Bloody Mary and got to feeling human as we chose our mains. I had the house-cured lox plate because I'm a sucker for fried capers yet had I been feeling less "fragile" I would have ponied up to the warm lamb & romaine salad with roasted cauliflower and olive croutons--because you guys FRIED CAPERS!!! are featured in that dish as well. As it stood, I needed something that had nursery elements like rye toast and cream cheese. Good grief it was delicious. The fish was delicately cured and served with said fried capers and a few tomato and red onion slices. By this time I was having coffee and smiling brightly. All was well. My dining companion chose the Eggs Huntington because he is completely focused on biscuits. Perhaps a little obsessed with biscuits, if I'm to be honest. Anyway. Who am I to judge? Friends, when Hollandaise is made well it's glorious, right? Sunshine-y gold, silken and just a tiny bit sharp, either with lemon or white wine, emulsified into melted butter, yolks, a splash of water and a bit of white pepper. Guys. The Buttermilk Channel Hollandaise is the Daenarys of all Hollandaises. This sauce was so fierce two additional sides of it were ordered. Two. And were eaten with a spoon. Also, the eggs were poached perfectly so the yolks spilled over just as they should on the generous serving of ham. This is not a dish for a weak appetite, be warned. And you must speak "biscuit" to do it justice because otherwise what is the point? A few words on ordering: we noticed that people were not fooling around here. This is a multiple dishes kind of place. The couple next to us had three sides, three mains, a couple coffees and were making steady work of what seemed to be a pipeline of martinis, while softly discussing desert choices. #Goals, right?!  What I'm saying here is that even though there are salad options to be had, one comes here to get one's eat on. It's expected. I suppose we were sort of disappointment to our server as we didn't order desert, but come to think of it, we ran hard with the double Hollandaise sides so I believe we scraped by with a modicum of BMC brunch dignity. Btw, the vibe is very pleasant. The service is super efficient and cheerful and the clientele bond together united in the sheer joy of tucking into what I think is one of the best brunches in town. Can't wait to go back for that warm lamb and romaine salad (with fried capers!) after a full night's sleep. Maybe see you there!

In a search for a new brunch spot we went to Yelp to find a new hype spot to try. We landed on Buttermilk Channel and thought to ourselves "how could 1k+ people be wrong?!" So we hiked out and did the whole hour wait to see just how delicious this place was. Boy, were we sadly underwhelmed. We got menus 20 mins after being seated and only because we asked someone who was not or server for them. He was confused because he came to our table to drop our Bloody Mary's off and asked if we had in fact ordered them. We said yes we did. Then he giggled and said of course why wouldn't a brunch spot have bloody Mary's and placed them on or table. That was the nicest encounter we had had during our whole visit.Or actual server visited our table once prior to that to pour our water, took our drink order, and then he left his metal pitcher of water on our table not the normal carafe of water that all of the guests get placed on the table. A few moments later after getting our drinks our server came and finally took our order. The encounter was really brief he came up to our table and asked if we are ready to order and we ordered.When our server dropped your order off he asked if he could get us anything else we said yes pepper and hot sauce please. He returned with the hot sauce and forgot the pepper so he had to return with the pepper again. Later we asked for an additional knife because my friend and I agreed to share our orders so we needed an extra knife to cut through the pork chop. We never received it. I ended up using my butter knife to cut through it.Here is the food review:*Bloody Mary (original) was extra salty and the only flavor I could really taste was the peppercorn *Eggs so fried I had a hard time cutting them up because the bottoms were so tough from being over cooked * The brisket dry & bland. No flavor. Not even a small bit of flavor from cooking in it's own fat. Just dry meat. * I had three pieces of potato in the entire hash* The waffles were comparable to any diner waffles that I've eatenThe pork chop was good but nothing to really write about glorifying it. *The best part of the meal was the syrup for the waffles and that's not worth treking forSo all in all service wasn't great, food wasn't stellar, and I really don't see a need to go out of the way to make this a destination. I'd rather get a diner breakfast for 2 @$30 then a flavorless meal for 2 @ $60 here.

Awkwardly... my boyfriend told me about this place from a date he was on yearssss ago. Being that it was a nice day and they have outdoor seating I decided to give it a try. He ordered a burger and I decided on the chicken with cheddar waffles because I saw multiple people saying it was good. The food is huge. His burger looked so juicy and when he cut it in half it was cooked just right. My food came with balsamic maple syrup which I did not enjoy and had a difficult time getting it out the bottle. The chicken was not dried up, but it was bland. The cheddar waffles was okay, but i felt the syrup did not mix well with it. If we do come here again I will definitely just get the burger or if i come for brunch, the chicken sandwich.

They have the best chicken and waffles I've ever had. The chicken was crispy and seasoned perfectly and juicy on the inside. The waffles were cheesy savory perfection with the chicken. The pecan pie dessert was so good and a must try to end a perfect meal. The service was superb from our friendly waiter who never once rushed us as we took our time talking and eating. Will definitely be going back soon !!
My absolute favorite brunch spot in Brooklyn. Great service, always busy so there's a bit of a wait but the food is yum!

If you want to spend your money on some bland, tasteless, fried chicken, come to this place. If you want to save your money, stay home and eat a piece of cardboard.. it'll taste the same. There was not one grain of salt or seasoning on this food!! Also tried the burger and fries - I found the salt. No wonder there was no salt on the chicken, they used it all on these fries. The best part of the meal was the water.
I really have like this place. I have been here for brunch and dinner. Great place to meet family or going out on a date. The fried chicken and pork chops are delicious.

Food / patio was great, unfortunately our server kept rushing us with every aspect; we were the first customers on a Tuesday morning with nobody there and he rushed us through the jump off, we had to tell him to wait before clearing our half eaten food. Disappointment.

Brunch in Brooklyn on Sunday + Mother's Day 2017 = one hour wait but worth the taste, sense the flavor of American cuisine.  One hour wait, at the bar counter, going solo as an independent spirit was no exception to the wait.  My bill states "solo" for one guest.  I am weary from a hard and difficult work week but my spirit was strong, positive and unbreakable with great defense.  I search for a deeper meaning in life as I continue this journey.  Upon my departure I overheard from a patron who was standing outside waiting "the wait is two hours" as getting here early is a greater chance for a lesser wait.  Buttermilk Channel has a country feel, cozy phlegmatic ambiance which is very bright, homey during the daytime of white wall panels and exposed brick.  I can imagine be it very intimate for couples at night.  Customer service and hospitality is attentive and professional.  The hostess was very informative and kept cool to triage the wait and new arrivals in an orderly matter with a tablet.  Brunch classic staples as eggs Benedict, chicken and waffles, French Toast, rib hash, hash browns, fries are offered and, of course, Mimosa and Bellini.  Buttermilk Channel modified the classics by upgrading chicken and waffles with cheddar waffles and fried pork chops covered in maple syrup while poached eggs, biscuit, ham and Hollandaise are a delicious upgrade to the traditional eggs Benedict.Pecan Pie French Toast $13 - Bourbon, molasses and toasted pecansA southern version of bread pudding which I believed it tasted spiked with bourbon and sweetened with molasses topped with toasted pecans.  The bread was harden on the outside which my knife was unable to cut through. The toast is pie shaped of triangle dimension.  There are no fresh fruit accompanied with this entrée.Hash browns $5 - an addition of two round slightly burnt hash browns with ketchup accompanied.  The inner potato filling was comforting.Bellini $10 - perfect pairing for brunch.One unisex facility is available for the entire business, thus watch your time and be mindful of the line.  All major credit cards are accepted.  Business cards are available and pstrons receive a comment card to make any critical comments as well as the option to be on their email list.  Buttermilk Channel is refines brunch where folks flock to respond the calling.  Come for the biscuits, come for the French toast, come for the eggs - stay for a quality meal.

It's a really nice restaurant. The lines are crazy. It's always almost packed. Aside from these reasons. My food was really good. But my husband had chicken and waffles. The chicken was almost burnt.  They is why I took a star out.

Yummy!!! Fried chicken & waffles are one of their dishes that they're known for and it sure lives up to the hype. The kale salad here is also really good and I don't even like kale but I finished the entire salad. There is one thing I wouldn't get and that would be the skate fish. It was extremely salty... so salty that it tasted bitter. So stay away from that dish!

Wow! I loved the vibe here. Saturday 3pm we walked in without reservation and apparently nobody else in the area was hungry. How lucky! Super friendly staff I would give 10 stars if I could. With great service came the amazing FOOD! Fried pork chop with cheddar waffle was a perfect combination. I will be back for you!!!!!!!

My review would easily be 5 stars if the brunch was bottomless! French toast and pancakes are so good though! But buttermilk channel insists on making me choose! If you are looking for good food in a comfortable setting, go here. If you are looking to down several mimosas or bloodys while eating, do not go here.

This place has the makings of getting it right, but they failed on my 1st visit. They open at 10am Sunday, we arrived at 10:30 and found a 1 hours wait time. This place is really popular! We waited and when we were finally seated we order french toast. The problem is our french toast was extremely hard (both plates). Hard as a ROCK! The sauce our french toast was covered in was delicious. So I ate around the hard parts, and when I was left with only hard pieces I gave up. The wait staff is extremely over worked. They are handling many tables at once, so I wasn't surprised when she made a error on our bill. Truly undecided if I will give them another chance.
Terrible over rated place. The service is good. But the food is terrible I don't understand what the hype is about.

I wished I lived in Carroll Gardens because I would go to Buttermilk Channel every Friday night for dinner. Everyone is so friendly at the restaurant. They accommodated us outside because we had our dog in tow. Everything from the cheery blue paint, the funny name of the restaurant to the beautiful gems salad--Green Goddess, chicken liver pate, wonderful fried chicken and waffles to the duck meatloaf was so memorable. My hubby and I enjoyed a beautiful Cote de Rhone wine. I cannot say enough.

The flavors in this place are what you're looking for in a brunch spot. Everything we ordered was delicious from the plates to their syrup! The buttermilk pancakes were super moist and fluffy. The friend pork chop and waffles came with a big piece so you get your fill. The chop was very crispy and somehow paired just perfectly with the cheddar waffle and syrup. I had to take away a star since we had to wait 2 hours for a table so we walked down the block to start off our boozy brunch. Also, the place is SMALL! It gets super busy so your waitress can take a while to get to you. I would love to try this place again on a less busy day. I'm sure the beautiful sunny day contributed to the big wait. Overall, great brunch!

Love their brunch! I have been coming for years and wish I lived in the area so I could come all the time. I really hate French Toast... everywhere! Except for here. It is so delicious and when I go for too long without it in my life I actually crave it. It is usually packed so get there early to put your name on the list.

Food was great ! We went to celebrate my mothers early birthday and we all loved it ! They had a steak special that night so of course the birthday girl ordered that. Me and my little brother both had the chicken and waffles except he had his with fries.... mine was regular and both were hella tasty !! Then the pop oversssss omg we ordered one per person and ultimately had to order two additional orders!!!! Drinks were Ok of course everyone wanted to order a different cocktail but ultimately ordered the same drink, I forget the name now but it was the one with rum ! We all also ordered dessert and they were all good. No complaints here.

Yummy food and good service. We also enjoyed the vibe and decor. I had the Eggs Huntington and my husband had the pancakes with a side of bacon. Both were very tasty. Would definitely recommend and come again.

I came here for Brunch and I enjoyed my food! The Brunch menu is very limited so don't expect to see many options. I ordered the Cheddar waffles with the pork chops (chicken and waffles are only on the dinner menu)... You may be hesitant because it's not chicken but trust me when I say this meal was on point!! The pork chop was not greasy at all. I only rated 4 stars because I wanted more food on my plate. I felt it was a bit of a tease and I wasn't full.

Went for brunch on a Saturday and we were lucky to get seats. If was extremely crowded because the place isn't very large. The food was great and the workers were friendly. I think I would go back in the future.

Great food, great service. Their brunch is amazing especially the eggs with biscuit. The portion sizes are pretty good. We also ordered the beans but the portion size was bigger than we thought so we took it to go an ordered another eggs with biscuit. The atmosphere was very nice as well. Very romantic and quaint for a date or a friend get together. Will definitely recommend it to my friends and family.
5 Stars for the Brusselsprouts!!!!!! YUMWe want on Saturday 5:30 PM and for table of 2, no wait, sat with another group

Not worth the hour wait. Ordered the hash. Brisket was EXCELLENT. Everything else was not. Eggs were unevenly cooked. Salad was overdressed. Bread was inedible. Service, while prompt, felt awkward. Won't be coming back here.

I absolutely love how consistent Buttermilk Channel is with the quality of their food. I've been here 3 times and the pork chop with waffles is always my go to dish, The wait for brunch is quite long (usually 30-45 minutes) if you don't make it to the first round. However, it is absolutely worth the wait! If you want to avoid the wait, I suggest trying to come as soon as they open. I got here about 30 minutes after the opening time and was able to snag the last bar seat. Eggs Huntington- These were just okay. I feel like it should have came with a thick slice of ham rather than the thin slice. The hollandaise sauce could have been better.Fried Pork Chop and Cheddar waffles- This dish was definitely the star of the show! The pork chop was delicious and fried to perfection. It paired perfectly well with the waffles and syrup.Pecan Pie French Toast- This was delicious! However, I wish there was an option to order a smaller side of this dish.To sum things up, definitely get the Fried pork chop and cheddar fries! The portions are quite large, so bring a friend or two and sample multiple dishes.

We must have ordered the wrong things cuz nothing would make me want to go back to this place! The short rib hash entree was dry and tasteless even after I sent it back asking for eggs that were a little less cooked; they just couldn't get it right. The eggs Benedict was okay but it was served on a very dense hard biscuit. I must say the entire staff was very attentive and accommodating though and did their best to make our brunch a pleasant experience. We noticed most tables had the pecan pie French toast so this must be their draw! Sorry we didn't order it.

We came here for dinner and I was left unimpressed. Had the poppers, terrine, and brussel sprouts as appetizers and the cod for my main course. It was ok but not exciting or worth the hype. The place is small and cozy. They let us sit down even though our whole party was not there. Our waiter was super friendly and attentive. Maybe brunch is the way to go with this place.

Love this place the ambiance is GREAT! The feel of the space is very quaint with great lighting for dinner and lots of natural light for brunch. The food is phenomenal! I've been here twice and I've had the pecan pie french toast & the bacon  as well as the porkchop and greens for brunch. Both were so good! Then for dinner I've had the Kale salad, Mussels, hanger steak and chicken and cheddar waffles ALL TO DIE FOR! I have never had anything from here that I didn't like. The price of eating here can be expensive but really worth it.

I finally went to buttermilk channel last night It was good not great. I really don't see all the hype about this place. The staff was great but food just okay nothing spectacular that stood out. I definitely wouldn't wait for a table here
Sooo good. The Honeysuckle cocktail is so yummy and I love their veggie burger. Brunch gets very crowded but is worth it - best bet is to get there 20 minutes before they open!

Went there a few times for brunch and enjoyed the atmosphere and trendy neighborhood.I didn't eat the fried chicken, but it made a hit with my group.Service was good and overall meal very tasty.  Delicious fries!I'll go back again for another birthday brunch!

I stumbled across this spot from online because I was looking to eat by myself for the first time . Besides it being overly packed and a fairly long wait time . I really enjoyed myself ; the food was delicious and the customer service was more than excellent . I would have enjoyed myself even more if I had loosened up a bit but heyy it was my first time taking myself to brunch . I can't wait to go back
Amazing brunch! Sticky buns, almonds with bacon and cheddar waffles were my favorites.

Grabbed lunch and I was reallyyyy looking forward to getting chicken and waffles!! It wasn't my lucky day and I found out that they only only serve c & w for dinner. I ended up getting the fried chicken burger which was really good! Not greasy at all and it was very flavorful. Overall good service and good food. It also wasn't pricy so that's always a plus!

My friend and I decided to go here on a whim because we couldn't decide where to eat brunch on Saturday afternoon. We usually grab food in the city but since we were both already in Brooklyn, we saw how many reviews this place got and wanted to try it out for ourselves.Because it was freezing outside, we only had to wait 20-30 minutes, but we were immediately greeted and felt welcome. The host and servers were really sweet even though it's probably always hella packed which made for a great experience.I got the pork chop and cheddar waffles. AMAZING. This dish made Buttermilk my top brunch spot. My friend got their version of lox benedict and she thought it was good, but i found it too salty and buttery. Then we shared some buttermilk pancakes because... that's the name of the restaurant sooooo duh. We were not at all disappointed. They were super fluffy and delicious and legit soaked up all the syrup mad quick. I will say the portions were good and worth the price, since it's average NYC brunch prices. Coffee is free refills, which is pretty great too, and rare for where we are.And shoutout to Samuel. Great guy!Can't wait for an excuse to come back here again.

Almost always a wait on weekends. They text you when your table is ready. The waiter seemed too over enthusiastic that it seemed fake. After the food arrived and the waiter asked if everything was alright, he never really came back. It took a but to get my water refilled. Got the fried pork chop and cheddar waffles. It was delicious. My only issue is that my pork chop wasnt cooked and still pink in some areas. This may be because it was very big. My boyfriend got the same thing and his was cooked all the way through.  Also got the short rib hash. I wouldnt recommend it. Its not real hash; there were like three pieces of potato in it. Overall i think this place is a bit overrated because all the reviews make it seem amazing.

Had very bad experience, walked into Buttermilk  Channel at 6:30 pm on Sunday & told no tables available for 3 people for a hour. "You can sit at bar & wait for hour..., we have a lot of reservations coming in soon." There were several open tables. Left restaurant & their reservation website which indicated tables available for 6:45, 7:00, 7:30,etc. Don't go there if hungry & person of color!!! Have been there several times before & never had that experience.

Surprised by all the hype about this place. I've gone three times for dinner and it's been average every time. The chicken and waffles are by far the best thing on the menu. The brussel sprouts were decent too but I wasn't impressed otherwise.  I probably won't go back except maybe to give brunch a shot.

I am giving Buttermilk Channel 5 stars for now having lunch availabe from monday thru friday. They have also busted out the best buttermilk fried chicken sandwich I have ever had. Two giant pieces of delicious chicken on an amazingly soft yet toasted brioche bun. Topped with their housemade slaw and pickles, this sandwich is to die for. At $13.00 a sandwich, it may seem like a steep price but is not once you take your first bite. Everyone should experience this level of deliciousness when it comes to a chicken sandwich. Get over to Buttermilk Channel and have yourself some beers and chicken sandwiches, you will not regret it.

I got fried chicken sandwich and my friend got grilled cheese. My chicken was greasy and not really tasty. My friend's grilled cheese was okay, but not amazing. I would go once more for weekend brunch, but lunch today was not a good experience. I think that this place is overrated.

Food was good but I'm giving it 2 stars I ordered the pork chop and waffle it was good but the pork chop was burnt everything else was excellent really disappointed giving it 2 stars the food was good  ):

So good!! Fried chicken all day errryday. Everything was amazing especially their pickles. Def try the fried chicken sandwich and veggie burger both are really great. Service is amazing. Super friendly and attentive. Only good things about this place. Def want to go back for dinner and try more things.

Where do we even begin?  My (now) husband and I planned our civil ceremony celebration dinner with our immediate families at Buttermilk Channel, and we could not have been happier with the way the whole experience turned out. We were a bit late with the whole planning of the event (three weeks out?), and were overwhelmed with finding the right place to celebrate in such a big city, but working with Jennifer was wonderful. She made us feel like family, and she seemed genuinely excited to help us plan our dinner. (Meanwhile, a few other places we queried made us feel like a hassle.)  While we initially had an idea of what we wanted to order for our families, she also made a few very helpful suggestions. When we arrived, the whole table was set with candles and special menus made just for us.  (What a wonderful keepsake!!)  We started off with two kinds of champagne, and a few small snacks/appetizers (pop-overs and pickles... both delicious!).  We had the squash tart to start, and steaks for the main course (both melt-in-your-mouth fantastic), and then Jennifer had planned a special berry tart for our dessert, which she brought out on a cake platter first. The service was superbly friendly and talented, and they made the experience that much more enjoyable.  All-in-all, the food was top-notch, and the ambiance was lively, but romantic. We will remember this dinner for a long time to come.  While we don't live in NYC, we will definitely be back... if their dinner experience was that fantastic, I can't imagine how good their brunch must be! : )  Thanks again to Buttermilk Channel!!

Went there tonight for valentines dinner.  Not worth the money at all.  Last year we went to Riverpark and spent less money for way better ambiance, way better food, and a much better cocktail list.  First time to this place (and I've been wanting to try it) and it's the last, although the normal dinner menu looks much better.  We had the winter salad (literally 6 slices of various citrus fruit, a few roasted root vegetables, tiny micro greens, and very very little yogurt dressing with no taste so you didn't even know it was there), the squash tart (the pastry was WAY over cooked that when I cut it it almost flew off the plate and table), the vegetarian pasta (this was good with a respectable portion), scallops (delicious with a respectable portion), and the pecan sundae (this was really good).  The apps were horrible, but the entrees and dessert were good (but not great).  The fact that they charge $90 for this meal was ridiculous.  If you look at their normal menu, the same meal would have cost maybe $60 per person including the "complimentary" popovers they served (they are $3 a la carte on the normal dinner menu).  Maybe it would have been worth it if the ambiance was better, but this place was crawling with children - most were well behaved, but still, if it's a family-friendly restaurant, then price it accordingly.  We got a sitter, I don't know why it's impossible for other Brooklyn parents to do the same on a special occasion.  If you don't have a sitter, go to Bare Burger like the rest of us.   I expected much more from the place that had the highest priced prix fix menu for comparable restaurants in Brooklyn.

I was here for Restaurant Week's menu which is surprisingly similar to the Valentine's Day menu. I will list in order of most love: Buttermilk Fried Chicken Cheddar Waffles & Savory Cabbage Slaw with Balsamic Maple syrup: I felt the crust was very salty( I was the only one of four who thought that)but that the accompaniments effectively complemented one another to make a very tasty dish., Mini Pecan Sundae: Just delicious!,  Cauliflower & Leek Soup was very good, and finally the Pan-Seared Cod ( Again very salty to my taste) but it looked so appealing and everyone loved it. Drinks were very good. All in all A-OK but I have only eaten here once I intend to give it a second chance.

I had the smoked salmon platter and my girlfriend had the fried pork chop with waffles. There was no wait for a table during Saturday brunch despite the restaurant being busy.The lox is smoked in house. It has a deep orange hue and had a great balance of saltiness and savoriness. The platter came with toasted capers which toned down the flavor of the capers yet added a crunchy texture to the platter.The fried pork chop and waffles was interesting twist on chicken and waffles. The breading in the pork chop was crispy and flavorful. The pork chop came out very juicy. I liked that both of the dishes cake with a small serving of salad.They have a small selection of draft beers all of which were craft options. There was even an option from a brand new brewery (Folksbier) which is a short walk away.
This place is pretty good. Obviously there's always a wait to get in but the food is decent. Not great! It's really the ambience that you pay for.

One word: Amazing! I was visiting from San Francisco for the week and decided to spend a day in Brooklyn with a friend to eat and shop. We stumbled across Buttermilk while searching for a decent brunch spot and decided to dine in. So glad we did! We were greeted with a smile and the hostess was welcoming and friendly. We were seated immediately, which was a plus. We started with a round of cocktails (which were delicious!) and placed our order for food. I decided to order the Fried Chicken Sandwich and my friend ordered the Hanger Steak Salad in addition to a side of fries and side salad. Our drinks came out soon after ordering, and were some of the best drinks i've had at a brunch spot in quite some time (which says A LOT considering how much of a foodie I am). The bartender was extremely friendly and personable. Our entrees were unbelievably flavorful and the chicken was to die for. The combination of coleslaw, pickles and the side salad I ordered really completed the meal. Everything tasted so fresh! The side of fries were perfect for munching on and sharing as well. As we continued to sip and eat, we were consistently checked-in on by both our server and those who just happened to pass by. As someone who works in the service industry, I know how frustrating it can be to be left alone or even ignored - so i'm thankful I didn't experience that here. We contemplated ordering another round of drinks, since they were just so good, but were running behind schedule, so decided to take our last few sips and asked for the bill. Overall, it was a 10/10 experience for my friend and I. I want to thank the staff at Buttermilk for creating such an amazing and memorable experience for a first-time like myself. The decor, ambiance, and quality of food and service is what really won me over and I hope to return again soon.
Great brunch and dinner spot on Court Street

OOOOOOOOO....So sweet the buttermilk making that yummy goodness and bless your heart Ryan for filling our tummies with your yummies! We stumbled out of an abysmal disaster down the street with a burning hunger and Jennifer, Ryan and the amazing staff converted us to viral fan boys in less than an hour! The oaky bourbon steaming from the pecan pie French toast sent our hairs standing and our budds ablazing. If you are truly adventurous and ready to playfully slap yo mammy, chomp down slowly and savor the gooy goodness oozing from the cheddar waffles in concert with the spicy snap crackle-n-pop of the French fried pork chop. Our chops still get stimulated just thinking about it! Tip of Simmons tongue to ya Doug and we gonna see you again soon!

When we first walked into the restaurant and saw how crowded it was we knew it was going to be a long wait. The women who greeted us concerned our thoughts but telling us it he wait would be just over an hour. After killing time for an hour we were told we had a table ready for us to sit at. After looking at the menu we got grapefruit, the walnut sticky bun, and the pickles as our appetizers. The grapefruit was refreshing but pretty sour though I guess that was to be expected. The pickles were a tab sweet but still had that "pickley" taste despite the seasoning. The sticky bun was my favorite appetizer by far. It was warm, sweet, crispy on the outside. I will defiantly get it again the next time I come here. For our entrees we got the pancakes, French toast, eggs Huntington, and the pork chops with cheddar waffles. The pancakes were HUGE and fluffy. Though they were nice and crispy on the edges the serving size was so large my sister could only eat 1.5 of them out of the three they provided. The French toast was fantastic though part of mine was a bit overdone. It was hard to cut the outside layers but the inside was soft and warm. It was all topped off was a hazelnut syrup that really brought the meal to the next level. My father got the eggs Huntington and he said it was good. Since he is vegetarian he replaced the meat that was supposed to come with it with spinach; he said the substitution was very good. The only meat eater at the table ordered the pork chops with waffles and their verdict of the taste was that it was "really good"All in all, my only complaint about this restaurant was how hard it was for me to cut a part of my French toast since it was over cooked but even that small mistake was overshadowed by how delicious everything else was. I recommend this place to people who won't mind a hit of a wait. Also, people who are vegetarian will have no problem finding something scrumptious to order. If an entree with meat takes your fancy the waiters are perfectly fine with substituting the part with meat with something else.

Service was good our waitress Grace was sweet , the establishment is very small and the tables are close together which I didn't like.Now on to the food we started off with some poppers which were basically mini croissants with honey and sea salt , (not a fan ) but my sisters liked it we all got the cheddar waffles and fried chicken which is served with coleslaw and I'm not a major fan of coleslaw but this one was amazing lol the waffles were good as well chicken need some work it was under cooked think it should of been fried a little harder. Overall ok experience for a last minute birthday dinner for my sister party of 3 we were told it was an hour wait but a 9:15 reservation canceled so we got seated shortly after arriving ! Dress is casual.

We tried this spot out for Restaurant Week and had a mixed experience. The hostess was cold and rude, which was jarring since she kept us waiting by the door for several minutes as she chatted with other diners, giving them hugs goodbye. Seemed like a friendly place, but what a icy reception. When we sat, our waitress darted by several times before eventually coming back to take our drink order. She was also quite clipped, rude, and completely unfriendly. I've rarely ever come to a restaurant and had TWO staffer come out so inhospitable to their diners. She came back and mustered out maybe a handful of words to take our order and then bristled away. Our drinks and BBQ oysters (delicious!) were brought out by other staff who were actually very friendly. The girl who came by to refill our water was also great. We wish we had ANY of those people as our server, as the one we had was ridiculously rude as the night rolled on. She came back to the table behind us to chat casually with them throughout the night, but ignored us as we tried to get more water, drinks, or ANYTHING. We would have loved another round of drinks, but she never came by to ask. Once the food came, we were hoping to be blown away, but sadly it wasn't that great. The duck meatloaf, which we both were looking forward to was dry and bland. The chicken and waffles came accompanied with a balsamic syrup reduction. Thankfully so since the chicken was under-seasoned and the waffles were soggy. The pecan pie sundae was tasty, but the chocolate pot de creme was lacking any real chocolate flavor.I'm not going to paint the whole staff with the same brush, but the hostess and waitress were enough to put us off permanently. The busboys/girl, and I think even a manger (owner?) were great. The food...not so much. Well, those oysters were phenomenal, but at $3.75 a piece, you'll go broke before you can make a meal out of them. Thanks, but I think I'd rather dine in friendlier places.

Was very disappointed with this dinner. We thought we were getting the restaurant week price, but they only participate on weekdays. Ok, fine, the discount isn't that much anyway. I ordered the same food I would have and was sorely disappointed in the flavor. The cauliflower and leek soup was beyond bland. The chicken and waffles had NO flavor. Oh and one of my chicken breast was totally undercooked, like bloody insides. I tried to compensate with the syrup, but it had balsamic flavor in it which was very strange. The drinks were awesome (I had the honeysuckle one and my boyfriend had an old fashion) and the dessert was delicious, but it wasn't enough to make up for the rest of it. I had the chocolate pot, best part of the meal. We also made a reservation for 7:45 and weren't seated until after 8. Probably won't be back.

2 years after bookmarking this place I finally get to try it! I brunched here on a Saturday. A friend arrived before me and said the wait was going to be approximately 40 minutes, but 20 minutes later she got a text saying our table was ready! Given the name "buttermilk", I figured I'd had to get something made with flour or milk here. I got the eggs huntington, their variation on eggs benedict I suppose, and my friend got their buttermilk pancakes with a side hashbrowns. Key note: you can either get the full size of pancakes which has 3 large stacks, or just one stack! It's not on the menu, but my friend asked the waiter if she could get less and its totally doable! One thing I gotta say about the eggs huntington: goodbye overrated eggs benny! They replace your usual english muffin with their homemade buttermilk biscuit and my god. It's a game changer, especially with their's. Highly recommend this!My tried my friend's buttermilk pancakes 15 minutes after it came out, and it was still warm, crispy on the outside, and fluffy on the inside. Imagine your usual pancakes, but with quality. Must be that buttermilk they use lol. Brunch alcoholic drink prices were a bit steep, especially for Brooklyn so I decided to opt out on that. But I absolutely enjoyed the food here. I feel like most brunch places on average will cost you $16 per plate and $8 for an adult drink. So price wise, it's not outrageously overpriced. Super jealous of those who are close to this area, would love to come here often if I lived closer!

Ok first off..im from the South. Texas to be exact so i was raised on southern cooking. I went in with low  expectations because..this is Brooklyn...and a hipster area...so im thinking to myself "what do they know about southern cooking" (snarky i know! But hey now..i love my southetn food and dont feel like flying back to Texas to get my fix). So the appetizers were yum...we had the cornbread with the bacon sauce..so goood. Amazingly overpriced for a mini piece..but hey..its Brooklyn/NY. Now my bone to pick is with the chicken & waffles...the waffles were yum but the  chicken was awful! Im black...so i knoow my chicken  My mama makes better chicken ..hell just roll up to Harlem to Jay Jays Chicken  Shack ( not a real place...or maybe it is) and you could prob get a bucket  of amazing chicken for half the price and has freakin more flavor than this place. But im pretty sure most of the patrons who frequent here wouldnt dare step in the hood so they will just enjoy mediocore overpriced chicken. It literally tasted like they soaked the chicken  in salt & pepper water...bleh.

First off, the restaurant is adorable, inside and out. The wait was not too bad. Brunch was good. I had the eggs Benedict that came with a side salad, an iced coffee, and a side of bacon. There wasn't anything that stood out for me. It felt just like any other place that offered brunch. The waiter was slow, but maybe it was because he was swamped with Sunday's crowd.

You ever notice how the crowd in Carroll Gardens is pretty much the same as the crowd which recently departed the Upper West Side? Well, the restaurants which pack em in along this stretch of New Brooklyn are pretty darned similar to Columbus Avenue as well. All faux concept and very little quality. Cliched 1980s era  "comfort food" for those who lack culinary imagination.This crowdsourced craphouse seems to attract the "lets wait a couple hours on line for Brunch" crowd admixed with the Time Out New York Tourists. What do they get after their agonizing wait? Inauthentic Southern kitsch at sky high prices, that's what.

Southern food with zero Southern hospitality. A friend (from Atlanta) and I went for brunch on the hunt for waffles and fried chicken. We settled on Buttermilk Channel for their fried pork chop and waffles. The staff is cold and up to their eyeballs in tables. We weren't greeted by our waitress--she kind of just appeared and waited for us to give our order--waters were always empty, and there was no thought put into the service. The whole time, there were two members of staff drinking coffees by the bar, meanwhile, there were visibly irritated patrons staring around waiting for anyone to acknowledge them.The food was good, but the service was so lacking (ex. no plates for us to use because there wasn't room to cut the food on the entree plate) that I can't recommend the place to anyone except for drinks at the bar.

The wait was long on a Sunday morning. Make sure you make reservations. Brunch was great and so was the service and atmosphere. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a cozy, hipster brunch spot in Brooklyn with delicious food.

Went in with a group of 5 on a busy Saturday afternoon. The wait was 1 hour. Which wasn't to bad because we all took a tour of the neighborhood. Within a hour and 10min, They texted me, letting me know that our table was ready The lady who is charge of the seating was so inviting and wonderful!Now on to the food! The food was absolutely delicious! I ordered the Fried Pork chop with a Belini and it blew my mind away! Everyone loved their food and the staff! A little on the expensive side but definitely worth it. Will definitely be back again and again and again!

It was ok...expected more since I heard so many good things about it and the hype from t.v. but the chicken and waffles for the price!  Good but didn't think it was worth that much! Have tasted better....sorry....

Tasted 3 dishes during brunch... burger was tasty, the "Huntington" delicious, and the rib hash left a lot more to be desired. Staff very friendly... price reasonable. I would recommend if your looking for a trendy brunch spot in the area.

Great Gem in Brooklyn. Went there for dinner, and it was amazing. Friendly staff, amazing waitress and the food was incredible. We went on a very cold day, and the soup was perfect. Can't wait to take my out of town guest there

Great place for brunch but very busy. I've been here twice and both times we had to sit at the bar because it was packed. Both times the food was great so it was worth it. If you want a table go early.

On a busy Saturday night, our party of three was seated immediately upon entering at 8:30pm.  We started off with scallops: delicious, lightly seasoned, and cooked well; seared on the outside while the inside remained soft, warm, and moist.  However, at $17 for two pieces my taste buds were struggling to find the dynamite in each bite.  Everyone in our party of three ordered the hanger steak medium rare.  On this evening, the restaurant had the opposite problem of most others: the meat was under doneness on all of our dishes.  One of us obliged to our server's offer to take the steak back for more time over the fire.  I didn't mind the rare temperature and found the flavor average for this cut.  For dessert, I had the phenomenal pecan pie sundae and would have it again if I were to return for dinner.  Our server called the expertise of another when I asked for a digestif suggestion.  I was pleased by this wonderful woman's suggestion of a delicious amaro with ice.To sum it up, I give my experience three stars.  The service was excellent, staff courteous and attentive, and the ambiance mature and intimate.  I'd previously come here for an excellent five star brunch and was disappointed with the mediocrity of the evening's meal.  If I'd never been to this restaurant, I probably wouldn't return.  I'd give dinner another chance with a different entree, but not anytime soon.

Maybe we went on a bad day but the best part of our meal were the cokes we ordered. It seems many people go for brunch, we went for dinner. Based on the reviews on Yelp I would of still tried this spot if I took a look at Yelp beforehand. The service and atmosphere was nice. The place packed but the hostess with a little finagling was able to sit us quickly. Again, service was very good.But you go to a restaurant primarily for the food. We ordered the fried chicken with waffles. The fried chicken had entirely too much salt and pepper and the breading was not crunchy but just thick and hard. I tried more than one piece in the hopes the poor flavor was a fluke but that was not the case. The waffles were doughy and slightly tough, even for non Belgium waffles.  The cheese flavor was not particularly good and they were barely lukewarm when they arrived. Perhaps the brunch is better, maybe their food was different when many of the reviews and the top 10 lists were created. The waiter removed one of our dishes from the bill so I felt I should include that in this review.

Everyone kept telling me how amazing this place was an that I absolutely needed to try the pancakes but unfortunately it was a bust. It's a nice spot that serves mostly the standard NYC fancy brunch fare. Everything was tasty but my mine.was.not.blown.

Went here for dinner while in town. We arrived a little early and were seated at the bar and selected drinks. Almost immediately after getting our drinks, we were shown to our table. I ordered the veg bowl and my partner got the much-hyped fried chicken and waffles. The food did not disappoint. It was tasty, filling and arrived quickly. I loved the exposed brick, lighting and ambiance, and was really pleased afterwards to have a reason to walk around Carroll Gardens and check our the great neighborhood.

Not just another brunch restaurant in the Park Slope/Carroll Gardens neighborhoods.Having now been here twice for brunch, with both experiences with the food being just as good as the other, I officially give my nod of approval for the brunch experience here. In my recent visit with my girlfriend, we visited on New Year's Day for brunch. Surprise, surprise -- unlike many businesses where the employees are catching up on their sleep from the previous evening's debauchery, Buttermilk Channel is up and running for brunch from 11am-3pm!On New Year's Day, most of the businesses were closed around the area so it was pretty much an errie and unusually quiet day in the neighborhood .... except for Buttermilk Channel where it was bustling with a pack of hungry (potentially hungover) customers. We put our name/phone number on their waiting list and received a text from them when our table was ready, which was about in 1 hour. Not too bad for a wait considering we arrived at around 1pm.When we walked in, the restaurant was indeed alive and well with brunch lovers alike. We were seated promptly, with which I immediately noticed how close the tables were scrunched up next to each other. A little breathing room between tables would have definitely been appreciated, but we didn't let that tidbit ruin our brunch at all.From my previous experience and current knowledge of the more popular brunch dishes here, my girlfriend and I went with the Fried Pork Chop & Cheddar Waffles, the Eggs Huntington .... and, for good measure, the Pecan Pie French Toast to shre. Honestly, I don't know what we were thinking, but we were in a really good mood so we completely obliterated one New Year's resolution just like that.EGGS HUNTINGTONThis was my main entree and it was a bit disappointing. Just like my 1st time here, it was nothing more than an Eggs Benedict to me. The poached eggs were good and it spilled all over the buttermilk biscuits beautifully, but it left me wanting more. It was just "OK" to me. Eggs Benedict lovers will love it, but I'm more of a hearty breakfast person.FRIED PORK CHOP & CHEDDAR WAFFLESThis was my girlfriend's entree and it was absolutely a winner! I had this the 1st time I came here too and the pork chop was fried thoroughly, but the meat itself was tender, juicy and savory. It didn't hurt that there was maple syrup to not only pour onto the waffles, but also onto the pork chop. Each bite of pork chop, waffle and syrup was a bite of heaven.PECAN PIE FRENCH TOASTThis one was the wild card, but overall it delivered. The pieces of french toast were huge and sat in a river of really sweet, but savory syrup. We didn't touch it for the 1st few minutes, which was a mistake. Although the french toast was very good, it was also very sweet and got a bit soggy because it sat in the syrup for too long. If you have a sweet tooth though, then this dish is clearly for you. It has all the components in it to melt your teeth like a sugar cane.To close, the service was quick and prompt and our waiter came back to fill our coffee and water. The food took a bit long to come out, not only for us, but also for the table next to us. To me, it was a bit too loud for brunch as all of the conversations were bouncing off of the walls making it difficult for me to hear my girlfriend talk. However, the food was good and the place was really pumping, which is a good sign of success. Not sure if we'd be back here again for brunch since there are just so many options in the area, but it's a great choice for any one who hasn't been.

Whenever trying a new brunch place, I always start with trying their French toast because I'm a big big fan of French toast. A soft warm delicious French toast would start the morning just right!The French toast at Buttermilk Channel was relatively smaller portion compared to those at other brunch places.  It was delicious at the first few bites, but even though the portion was smaller I couldn't finish it because I felt it was too much too sweet towards the end. Also, the texture was way too creamy so that it was more like eating creme brulee than eating French toast.And my friend said that the scrambled egg she ordered was ordinary.They don't take reservation, and expect to wait 1+ hour please.Overall, it was definitely worth the try given its popularity on Yelp, but it's probably not worth the wait.

Buttermilk Channel is a well known brunch spot in Brooklyn but it's out of the way for me so I haven't had a chance to try it until today, which happens to be New Years day 2017. We arrived around 1:11 and put our names down for a table of four, we were estimated an hour and fifteen minute wait. We were seated at around 2:50. For any well known brunch place in NYC during prime time, that wait is pretty normal. They take your phone number and text you when it's time for you to come back and especially if the weather is nice it's a cute area to walk around. I just suggest having this in mind - that this place will have some kind of wait, probably at minimum like 30 minutes.  All of this is to say, we weren't angry or surprised by the wait, but what was pleasantly surprising was how kind the hostess was to our party. Though we were seated pretty much around the same time she estimated the wait would be, she was super apologetic and even gave our party complimentary drinks. We didn't have to mention this to our waitress after we sat, ordered, or ate, we received the bill and the waitress confirmed at that time the drinks were on them. This service was really exceptional, which is something you don't get at every trendy restaurant in the city, and I appreciated it a lot. The Food - I ordered the short rib hash, my boyfriend ordered the fried pork chop and cheddar waffles. We also ordered a short stack of pancakes to share (because what better way to start the new year?) The good: My eggs were cooked perfectly, the pancakes are seriously divine. The kind of average: I think that my food may have suffered as a result of our table being one of the last ones served (they end brunch at 3 pm) - I felt that my food was over salted, the hash was rather dry and tough, and even the vinaigrette on my side salad was quite salty. The cheddar waffles seemed to be normal waffles, not cheddar ones, or the cheddar flavor didn't come out very well. Also, the pork chop was a little dry and sort of tasteless. That said, for both meals, the perfect bite where you get a little bit of everything was quite tasty, but I can't say that each component of the meal stood out on their own. The star of the day was absolutely the pancakes - slightly crispy but big, fluffy, and soft in the middle - the perfect receptacle for some butter and syrup. I would definitely make the trip and wait again for these pancakes, which are truly crave worthy.   Ultimately, this isn't a place that I may often go to because the distance plus the wait are pretty large. That said, I can absolutely see me craving these pancakes once in a while and braving any storm to get them. The restaurant is cute and the service is really so stellar that I certainly recommend this as a spot for any person (especially a pancake fan) to try at least once.
YUM! body mary's were great. and the buttermilk pancake to die for. a bit of a wait, but usually can get spot at bar in under 20 minutes.

Had a great Thanksgiving dinner at Buttermilk Channel.  I wouldn't have changed a thing.We showed up 45 minutes early for our reservation and were still seated right away.  Food and service were both great.

My wife and I finally got a babysitter so we can go out and have brunch together.  Saw this place on yelp and was excited to eat here.  However, our experience was very disappointing.  We sat and waited 50 minutes for our food.  I saw several people receive same dish I ordered that came after my wife and myself.  When the food finally came it was cold like its been just sitting somewhere.   Waitress was horrible never came to ask if we were alright.  Smh some people could say this happened because we were black but Im just gonna say. I will never go there again. Period and dont recommend anyone going there. Its a bunch of hype that the food and service cannot match up to.

I just paid a visit for dinner to this popular spot in Carroll Gardens and am glad I did. The interior/ambiance is very cute, with beautiful lighting and an exposed brick wall. The service is professional and attentive. A great spot for a date. Duck meatloaf: very unique and beautifully presented. It could have been warmer, though.Braised pork shank (special): a huge portion of succulent meat. The meat is tender and well cooked, and is nicely complemented by its sauce and the grits. Bread pudding with rum caramel sauce: delicious. Jennifer was a wonderful host.

Not sure what the hype is about with this place. My boyfriend and I came here for dinner last week. His beer and my cocktail were good, but our entrees were both pretty disgusting. The fried chicken was over-cooked, the waffles tasted like plastic, and the fettuccine had a ton of burnt kale on top. We didn't even finish the dishes because they were so unremarkable. Unfortunate because I'm a huge fan of southern food and always in search of good food in NY that will take me back to my roots. This was not it.

This restaurant has a really nice atmosphere and the food/service are always solid. On Monday nights they have a prefix menu that is a pretty good deal. It gets crowded so it's worth making a reservation.
Neighborhood brunch place - we didn't think it was worth the long wait for average brunch food which was very basic! Not sure why this place has become so popular!
Came here but the chicken and waffles. It was good but I don't know if I would come back here for that. Maybe to try something else.

Came here for brunch this past weekend with a girlfriend of mine. We waited only 10 min for a table on a Saturday which I was nervous based on the wait times other people claimed to have waited. I'm guessing because it was only 2 of us and others had larger groups.I wanted the waffles (I'm a waffle girl) but they didn't have the option for chicken and waffles, only pork chop and waffles and I don't eat pork. So I opted to get the side of cheddar waffles, a side of turkey sausage, and a side of hashbrowns. My friend got the pecan pie French toast and a side of bacon. I must say the food (although the portion size was seemingly small) was AMAZING. I loved the cheddar flavor in the waffles and the hashbrowns were seasoned well. My friend couldn't stop raving about the pecans from the French toast. We were sitting within elbow space of another family and the guy basically sucked the pork chop bone dry so I think it's safe to say that he enjoyed it. All in all the atmosphere is very cozy, the music was good and the food was amazing.

This place seriously needs to make an effort to get the basics right. My wife and I arrived on time for a 9pm reservation -  wait 20 minutes for a waiter to come to the table. No big deal, but the guy that shows up is flustered and clearly coked up. No "my name is Jim, yada yada yada", just kinda rushing the entire thing - we felt like we were delaying him somehow. That really set the tone for the whole experience- while eating we're constantly asked if we're "finished with that" while we're both mid-meal, by him the busboys- we're not eating slow at all. Also, at this point in the evening there's plenty of tables open but also plenty of other customers there too - not like we were keeping anyone there. We've both NY'rs who've waited tables before and don't expect too much - staff at this place are seriously a little rude. Nice wine list  - but food was weak. If you stay home and cook for yourself, you're probably better off. Go to Frankie's or Prime Meats across the street - food is better and you'll find a way friendlier atmosphere.

Excellent brunch with great service!Although the place is terribly busy on weekends for brunch, they seem to have a pretty organized process. We did have to wait but it was almost the exact time they said. The food is great and creative. Loved the menu and had a hard time deciding what to get, but the server was helpful in making suggestions. The biscuits were very good. Wish they were included in more dishes.

First time eating here over the weekend. Food was amazing! We sat outside due to the long wait (about 1 hour) to eat inside but well worth it. Still 5 stars in my opinion due to the great food and the fact that the waiter did a great job and was courteous, nice and cater to our needs. Will be returning!
This place is absolutely amazing! I had the pecan pie french toast, and it was delicious. I will defintely be going back for brunch!

I want everything on the menu!I'm with my son at the Brooklyn Museum and I asked him what are we doing for lunch. Pizza? BBQ? Sangwich? Nah, how about Chicken and Waffles! Great, I got a place I've been dying to try, Buttermilk Channel. I look at my watch and know I gotta hustle up before this place gets packed out. I zoom to Court St, find a great parking spot and walk inside to a packed restaurant. sigh..I'm told a one hour wait. I hate waiting, how about the bar? Well its first come first served and there's no one waiting. Great! I see the all the guests and theres a couple getting up, perfect. We sit down and we had the cutest bartender! She had these big glasses, I even had to say to her, those glasses look so cute!My son & are on a mission but the brunch menu doesn't have Chicken & Waffles. I ask the bartender, why is there a pork chop offering and not chicken? Well the chicken is offered for dinner, after 5pm. Dang. Two Porkchop & Waffles please. Oh and a classic Bloody Mary!My drink comes out, man its bangin'. Spicy and thick with a good Vodka and topped with a homemade spicy pickle. I love Brunch!Our main entree comes out and its huge. One thick pork chop that's heavily seasoned. I took a knife to the chop and its cooked perfectly. Nice & juicy. Mmmm mmNow add to the mix the savory waffles, this is one funky porky breakfast. Mmmm mm!The restaurant itself is lively, the dining room is packed as well as the bar and sidewalk tables. Last but not least is the brunch menu. Man, this menu is geared towards brunchin', munchin', lunchin'! Pancakes, Eggs Benedict and Short Rib Hash sound like a fun time. From the amazing cocktails to the exciting entrees, you will leave here happy.
Me, Jay and Bae get brunch here all the time, you know.Can be crowded. I guess people flock to the good stuff.

We've been here three times already and we are very pleased with the food here. The place is clean and the waiters are efficient and polite. The food is very good, tasty and fresh. We highly recommend trying the fabulous popovers and the excellent fried chicken with waffles. The dessert menu could have a few more options, but after such hearty dinner it's easy to skip it altogether. On the downside is the fact the tables are too crowded and it feels more like a communal dinning room than a fine dining restaurant. When combined with the lack of sound insulation, it can be overwhelming. If you're into relaxed dining experience that involves some quiet conversation, bear in mind that this is not the place for it.

I didn't realize Buttermilk Channel what such a popular place until we got there (around 10:15) and saw the line begin to form around the corner. Although the lines are long, the hostess does a great job at getting all parties seated quickly. It was a nice fall day, so they seated us outdoors since there was no available seating inside. This was probably a bad idea because 5 minutes after sitting, we were freezing cold. I did enjoy my food however. I ordered the pancakes, which can fill you up all by itself. I also ordered a side of smoked bacon and hash browns. Overall pretty decent, but nothing memorable.

Terrible experience on Saturday 10.29.16.  The hostess was inattentive and rude.  She was seating people haphazardly.  Food was sub par and service was sluggish.  They made a mistake with the check and we're too eager to get us out so they could flip the table. But the worst part of the experience was the nasty hostess.  There are much better places for brunch in the area.  #overrated.

I went here this past Sunday for brunch. The wait was over an hour. We received a free sticky bun and drinks for our patience. The sticky bun was pretty much a cinnamon bun with nuts. It was fine, I wouldn't order it though. The drinks took 30 minutes. The food: my kids had bacon, pancakes and scrambled eggs. It was fine, nothing exciting at all. I had the pork chop and cheddar waffles. The waffle portion was very small, pretty much half of a waffle. It was fine, basic. The pork chop lacked flavor and seasoning but it was cooked well. I wouldn't order it again. My partner had the French toast. She sent it back. It was gooey on the inside. Weird and gross. She decided to just get biscuits instead. Biscuits taste like flour only. She had a bite and didn't want it. They didn't charge us for the items we didn't like. Which was good. I didn't try the friend chicken, it's not served during brunch. But if it was anything like the fried pork chop, I'll pass. I've been wanting to try this place, but I don't see the hype. It is very busy during brunch.
i was dying to eat here. they told us 30 minute wait for 3 people.. turned into an hour. i will try to re visit again when i'm not as hungry & can wait

Came here on a recommendation from a family member. The wait looked super intimidating when we first got there, but it moved quickly. The service was good - fast. The food was so yummy. We tried a cinnamon roll to start because we were starving and it might have been my favorite thing we had. I had the short rib hash and it was yummy, but I was jealous when my boyfriends fried pork chop and waffles came out. It was a lot so neither of us finished our dishes, but what we had was great. If I ever get back here I'm definitely trying the pecan pie French toast because the girl next to me got them and they looked heavenly.

This neighborhood has many great restaurants that we love to go to. Buttermilk Channel is one of our "great" and "favorite" ones for both brunch and dinner.  Although sometimes hard to get a reservation there, my husband and I love everything on their menu and the service is impeccable.  My 12 yr-old twin boys love chatting with anyone on their staff, which says a lot about how anyone of any age can have a good time there.  We also love the stylish, yet casual ambiance it has overall.

One of the best.  However, the great food and hype comes at a price -- it can be downright unpleasant to get a table and wait for your food here.  That's not really their fault, though -- blame us hordes of people.  Great date spot and nice brunch, but go early.
thanksgiving was fantastic. I messed up my reservation and they let us in to eat at the bar anyway. Very hospitable. Great meal!
Food was delicious, service was incredible and the restaurant along with the bathroom seemed super clean. Plenty of parking on the street and their outdoor seating area is pretty cool
Back before I went Vegan their chicken and waffles were superb. There was a long wait to get in for my party, but it was well worth the wait.

I absolutely love love love this brunch spot and wish I didn't live so far from it! Their pork and waffles are super savory ( like who thinks of pork and waffles? I've only had chicken and waffles) I have also ordered their pecan french toast and it just melts in your mouth without being too sweet. Even their biscuits are perf! I rave about this place to all my bklyn friends and tell them they HAVE to go- yea you reading this post, you NEED to go. TRUST!

A short walk from the Smith 9th Street station to Court street and you arrive at Buttermilk Channel.They prepare and serve the best brussel sprouts I've ever tasted. First bite gave me such a strong, physical reaction of flavor, that my friends immediately pierced my plate with their forks and were not disappointed... Hands off, ladies!!!... Get your own!!Mussels served in a rich broth with thick crusty bread, heavenly popovers that my friends refused to allow the waitstaff to remove from the table, crispy, spicy buttermilk fried chicken with waffles. I enjoyed the skirt steak with charred broccoli rabe.  The girls enjoyed the prefix menu with appetizer, entrée and dessert, finally indulging in pecan pie sundaes...Friendly waitstaff, knowledgeable about the menu, and a very lovely, quiet space... Can't wait to return for brunch and dinner - it is casual dining, but very refined food and it feels like a special occasion destination ... Go during the week, before 6:30 PM and you should not have trouble being seated. Note: they do not take reservations... but the have a full  bar and they except credit cards.

Went here for dinner on a Tuesday night, date night for my wife's birthday. Free corkage. Service was great, they were both attentive and friendly. Cocktails are perfectly balanced, had 'the old gal'. Fried chicken is a must have. Would definitely recommend for any occasion.

Went here last night for my birthday with two friends, and we had a wonderful time! Service was SPOT ON, friendly and accommodating but not intrusive. Our waiter was 3 for 3 in excellent wine recommendations for varying palates. We shared the cornbread to start, all ordered the fried chicken, and shared the bread pudding, and chocolate pot de creme for dessert. The food was delicious, and the desserts were INSANELY GOOD. Like I'd go back just for the desserts. Kudos to the pastry chef!So why not 5 stars?It's overpriced. The portion of cornbread for $6 was laughable, in fact, that's what we did when we realized that was it. The fried chicken entree is $27, and while sizeable and "elevated" - it's still fried chicken and waffles. Also - you can't substitute all white meat (even for an upcharge), which means that for $27, I really got a breast and wing of chicken, and took home the dark meat for my pup.It's a great spot, and I enjoyed the whole experience, but I'll be a less frequent diner because it's expensive for what it is. But I'll definitely be back to try brunch!

Love Love Love this place but why always an 1 1/12 wait !? Cant make reservations for brunch either.  But I do love everything on the menu especially the Pork Chop & Cheddar Waffle, paired with a mimosa of course ;-)

If you're in the area it's a great spot! Don't know if I'd go out of my way to go there though. Walked from crown heights and there was a long wait but if you're having a lazy day and out for a stroll, it's a great neighbourhood spot.
Such amazing food and service! I have been at least 10 times and have never been disappointed. Go on a Tuesday when they waive their corkage fees and bring your favorite bottle of wine.
Four types of kickass Bloody Mary drinks. Pork chop and waffle was fantastic and enormous.
Great brunch.  We've been here twice and loved it both times.  I recommend the Eggs Huntington or the Waffle and Pork Chop.  Outstanding.

I've been there twice - not bad but not impressed. It does not live up to the hypeMy fish tasted faintly of sewage and was overcooked around the edges.The server forgot our salad entirely and when we inquired as to to the whereabouts of our salad after the course was finished, she did not admit to any mistake, instead saying "oh, I'm sure it'll come out soon". It's as if they are so accustomed to beautiful instagram photos and good reviews that they feel they can do no wrong, and that has made them a little lazy.A tip: Always put in extra effort, especially when things are going well.

Went to buttermilk channel with my bf for brunch because he was dying to try their French toast. It was crowded when we got there at around 1pm but luckily we snagged 2 bar seats as soon as we walked in, so definitely keep that in mind when going for brunch. I had the mushroom/spinach/goat cheese scramble w/o mushrooms and it was okay but too much goat cheese for me so I ended up not finishing it. I also tried their house made turkey sausage patty which was very tasty. My BF had the pecan pie French toast and I HIGHLY recommend. It was the right amount of sweet and was perfectly put together. We also had mimosas which had a perfect OJ to Champagne ratio. Would come back for brunch if I was in the neighborhood, and definitely would get the French Toast.

This place was packed and busy, but the service was pretty good. I took my server's recommendation to try the Fried Pork Chop and Cheddar Waffle. It was a nice size portion. Wasn't sure how I would like the waffle, but it was good. My only critique that limit the rating is the pork chop needed some seasoning. It was just fried Panko Breadcrumbs with no flavor
