I have been on the hunt for good pancakes.  Unfortunately, this place did not meet the mark.  The order came with 3 pancakes.  The first one was good.  It was fluffy, crispy and well cook, the 2nd one was just ok, and the last one tasted like a biscuit.  I think they pre-make the pancakes and heat them on the griddle before serving.  My sister said she peeked in the kitchen and there as a huge stack of already cooked pancakes.  Too bad...so sad...

After all the hype I read about when it came to this restaurant I was so excited to try out the food and write a glowing review.This will not be one of those reviews When we arrived there was already a line (and trust you will need to stand in it) because the restaurant fills up quick, fast, and in a hurry. Even with the flurry of people coming and going, we were able to get a nice table outside and enjoy the weather to people watch. Our waitress arrived and immediately took our drink orders and placed menus in front of us. Excited to try the short rib hash I placed my order and wasted no time seeing what my mother wanted to order as well. It was Sunday, so to our surprise there was no chicken and waffles, but instead pork chops with waffles (no thanks). Instead, my mother opted for the A-B-C grilled cheese.The short rib hash comes with sunny side up eggs (I had my scrambled with cheese), toast, and organic greens. Let me just say the best food on my plate was the organic greens salad. I was let down by overcooked and dry meat, it could only be saved with a large amount of ketchup and even though it was a struggle for me because I was expecting juicy and savory meat, unfortunately none of that was on my plate, but a girl can dreamAs for my mother's A-B-C grilled cheese (apples, double- smoked bacon, aioli and new york state cheddar) it was served on what appeared to be toasted panini bread causing each bite to be a hard one. The best part of her meal was the fresh cranberry juice Buttermilk Channel was a big disappointment (and lets not get started on the one bathroom but that is to be expect at a NYC restaurant) and I will not be returning. The best part of my experience was the coffee, excellent service, people watching, and the beautiful neighborhood

IT WAS GOOD. love it here. I had dinner with my girlies on a friday and we didnt have to wait long for our seats. We shared all our dishes. We ordered too many things to remember which ones I ordered. Great atmosphere. Will be back soon. Can't wait to try out their Brunch Menu.
Food is fantastic! Everything was delicious. We were able to sit outside so that was great, otherwise indoors is insanely loud and difficult to enjoy a dinner.

When I went to this place I tried the chicken waffle, I wouldn't say it was the best but it was okay, I was making a line for a table, I nearly waited 30 minutes for a table and the only way this place got popular was because of beyonce, I wouldn't come back ever.

I've been twice now for weekend breakfast and can safely say they do good work here. Great service with a smile goes a long way, and the food is always very good. You'd be hard-pressed to find a better breakfast/brunch in the area. Get the pork chop and waffles. Decent bloody marys too.

Food was good but nothing I've never experienced before at the dozens of brunch spots I've visited in NYC in my 30 years on earth. It would've have changed everything had we not practically been treated as invisible and had our server been less absent and more considerate of the fact that we waited MUCH longer than a number of the people that arrived after we did to even GET a chance to order our food. We got our food after they got their checks and were prepping to go. NOT ONCE did our server come by to apologize nor explain to us what the hold up had been all about. I think that was what was most disappointing about the entire experience. I understand that things happen and I like to think of myself as pretty considerate but the fact that there was NOT an ounce of acknowledgment for such a long wait is what really made the experience very very subpar and which makes me very very unlikely to want to go again. Very disappointing especially after being so excited to go. For some attentive and quick service and some really amazing chicken and waffles go to "Amy Ruth's" in Harlem or "Sweet Chick" in Williamsburg.

maybe i should've gone for brunch, idk. but myself and a group went for dinner last night, and i was thoroughly unimpressed. the fried chicken they're supposedly famous for was completely burnt, the cheddar waffles were extremely dry with only a faint hint of cheese in it. my friend ordered the steak which was extremely chewy. a plus is that the mashed potatoes were very buttery and delicious. service was pretty good, i liked our server. again, i would maybe come back for brunch but dinner was lackluster.

We had great service although we did wait outside in a line for 15 minutes in order to get a seat right when they opened. We ordered the pecan French toast which was okay. We also ordered some sides, bacon, biscuits and French fries. The French fries were cold. All of the sides were also overpriced....$6 for 2 biscuits (a bag of flour costs $3....). The side of bacon was $7????? It was nice and smoky but undercooked and thin. There is no fresh fruit on the menu........well other than grapefruit and endive....no thanks. Not worth the hype.

One of the yummiest brunches I've had in New York. It's a bit of a trek for those that don't live in Brooklyn but totally worth it. Was quoted a wait of 45 minutes for table of three but only waited about 25 minutes on a Saturday for brunch. Ordered the pancakes, pecan French toast, mushroom/spinach/goat cheese scramble and fried pork chop & waffle. Took a while for the food to come out but we ordered coffee beforehand so had something to sip on while we waited. Everything came out at once and was delicious with a capital D. Pancakes were nice and fluffy sprinkled with powdered sugar. Pecan French toast was the winner, came with two large pieces and a light whipped cream that went great with the syrup that the toast came dipped in. Scramble was good  and came with a salad and small hash brown. Fried pork chop & waffle was huge and well made but we couldn't finish it and ended up taking to go. Great good and service, definitely on the same level as Manhattan brunch spots.
Disappointing! I had heard SUCH good things about this place. The pancakes are below average. I came here for the pancakes!!! Oh well.

Went here for my birthday brunch with a group of 6 ppl and everyone loved their food including myself! Only negative was that we had to wait an hour, but we just went across the street to a cafe and had some coffee and waited for the hostess to call us when our table was ready. I tried everyone's food so I can say everything was delicious. Buttermilk biscuits were perfectly moist and butteryFried pork chop and cheddar waffle was amazing, everyone gnawed on their pork chop bone.   Pecan pie French toast, perfectly sweet!The blood Mary's were great as well.

The food was pretty good, but not sure if it is worth the 2 hour wait for Sunday Brunch. The food is very similar to other brunch places in Brooklyn, pork cutlet waffles was really good, the fluffy pancakes were also good, but everything else was not that memorable. Also try arriving after the brunch prime time, around 2:30, you'll get seated much faster, but the only downfall to that is they tend to run out of things around that time.

Service was not good.  Slow and inattentive.  Not unfriendly though, just disorganized.  Food was average (I had eggs benny on  biscuit and hubs had the fried pork w/ waffle) and slightly over priced.  I'd return, but this place isn't anything special.  And definitely will do a number on your waistline.  Good coffee.  And the pancakes looked really good on our neighbor's plate.  3 stars is perfect for this place.

I think my deserted island food would be the hash browns at Buttermilk Channel. How are they so fluffy? How are they never burnt or over-salted? It's a mystery for the ages. I take every out-of-towner here at 10AM on the weekends, so we don't have to wait for a table. The trick is to pick up a coffee at Court Street Grocers, across the street, so you're extra alert...to better enjoy the hash browns.

Had a great dinner and overall experience here on a Wednesday night. We were a group 6 and everyone enjoyed the food and drinks. Some highlights: popovers, mussels, bacon appetizer, lamb salad, and fried chicken. The food was delicious and the service spot on. We were seated even though our whole party wasn't there, which has become an annoying thing with other restaurants, and they were understanding when 2 of our guests couldn't make it. Our waters were constantly refilled and when we finished the bread that came with our mussels a server brought out more without us even asking. Such a great spot for a large group of friends or for a date night, will definitely be back.

Been here twice but posting a late review. One of my favorite restaurants in brooklyn. Only one star off because they don't take reservations, but gotta respect that policy since they are a high traffic restaurant.They make an AMAZING Bloody Mary which is great to wake you up from the prior day's hangover. Really great selections and pairings. Would highly recommend.

Since this is the sister resto of French Louis I knew I had to check it out. The wait for brunch wasn't terrible -- only 20 minutes, so we sat at the bar for a beer. They had a nice beer selection, I settled on a gose. Although, I do hate when Gose's are put in 9.5 oz pours, it is not like they are high alcohol or anything..why are Gose's so expensive damn it??I was in the mood for Chicken and Waffles --and was a little disappointed to see they only had a pork chop and waffles -- I tentatively ordered.Silly me, it was DELICIOUS. I have never had a pork chop cooked so well. It was juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. Worth the trip to the far off land of Carroll Gardens.The inside is a little sparse -- maybe they can hang up some art and look like they live there?
Best brunch spot I have been to in YEARS! Everything is savory, satiating, and absolutely better than I would have imagined!

It's really hard to give this restaurant this little stars, but after thinking a lot about it, I did not have a good experience. I'm moving away from NYC and have been dying to go here for a very long time. I had my going away part in Brooklyn and we wanted to do brunch beforehand. It was a few weeks ago when it was close to 100 degrees, so just totally uncomfortable outside. My friend had put her name in before we got there, so we had a 45 min wait (no reservations for brunch) - no big deal. After getting a drink near by, we were called and headed in to our table. The place is very cute, quaint, very Brooklyn. The food started to come out to other guests and it looked amazing. The Bloody Marys were good - BUT it was hot. AT first we thought we were just cooling down and then I can't imagine the temperature got below 85 at any point. It seemed like the air wasn't working, but everyone was hot, uncomfortable and it was very hard to enjoy the food from there. And while the food was good, it was NOT worth sitting in an UNHEALTHY temperature. The service wasn't good either and no one seemed to care that the patrons were uncomfortable. If you go, go in the winter. Not worth it otherwise.

Went for brunch on Sunday morning at 10:30. As expected, it was already bumping! We snagged a table outside without waiting but the umbrella did not hit our table with any shade... Thankfully the hostess came out with some sunscreen so we didn't burn but it was too darn hot! Our waitress seemed a bit overloaded with all the tables and I didn't get any coffee refills in the 1.5 hours we were there but otherwise she was nice and attentive. The menu is interesting and seems to have a lot of good dishes but almost none of them were gluten free so I ended up with a salad.

The service was good. They took my name and # down to text when a table was ready. Food was good. The cheddar waffles were excellent. The pork chop was huge but not seasoned to my liking but ok. Overall nice spot.

We made a reservation for RW on a Friday night. Hub and I both had the beer-steamed mussels as a starter. The broth would had been spot on except it was drenched with salt. Other than that, the mussels were good. The bread was completely charred and burnt. For the entrees, we both had the infamous buttermilk batter fried chicken and cheddar waffles w/ sweet balsamic maple syrup. Wow, the savory waffles really balances with the sweet syrup! The chicken was actually succulent and moist unlike experiences with dry chicken meat elsewhere. It was so good! Now we see what the hype and rave is all about! For dessert, Hub opt for the pecan sundae while I had the chocolate pot de creme. Both were exceptionally wonderful but we were beyond full especially after our cooking class. The food is great but the lighting is dimly lit and dark. Except for the candle lit tables and chandelier, it's hard to see the food or the menu. Their brunch looks delicious so we'll def return to try it. As for the dinner, I think it's a good experience. Still, it's a bit overpriced for fried chicken even if it is insanely good. Service was great though. Our server kept coming back to check on us in addition to asking if everything was ok.

First, I would like to say that the ambiance is super chic and cute. Upon walking in I expected the space to be small because of all the reviews I read on here. We waited a bit to get seated,but it wasn't long because we made prior reservations for my friends birthday. The reason I gave 3 stars is because of the food. I was sadly disappointed by the fettuccine and sent it back for chicken & waffles in exchange. When presented with the chicken & waffles I was excited to try it, but yet confused as to why the chicken looked super over cooked. I tasted it and I was super unsatisfied with the lack of seasoning applied on the chicken. The waffle was super salty. I knew it was a cheddar waffle..but still. Now, I've tried chicken & waffles at multiple places and enjoyed it, but here was by far the worst. I would definitely go to Sweet Chick If you would like to try a quality chicken & waffles.
By far the best fried chicken I've ever hadThe cocktails are a little pricey but hey don't come here to drink - eat the fried chicken - yes just order it and eat it!!!!

First time visiting this part of Brooklyn and obviously, first time at Buttermilk Channel.My cousin and I went for brunch on Saturday around 10:30am and the place was already filled up (inside and outside), but luckily, we snagged a couple seats at the bar and were ready to chow down.I decided to go with the short rib hash; my cousin chose the mushroom scramble; we shared the buttermilk pancakes. The short rib hash with sunnyside eggs on top was delish and whatever they put on their mixed green side salad was so good and a perfect add to the whole dish. I didn't try my cousin's scramble, but she loved it and ate up the whole plate. The pancakes were HUGE to say the least. They were both heavy yet fluffy at the same time with a nice crisp on the outside and super soft on the inside. Overall, we were both extremely satisfied with our meal and left feeling happy and full. Coffee was pretty good, too!A little bit on the expensive side, but it's brunch, so whatevs. Definitely wouldn't mind returning if I ever decide to venture out to Brooklyn again!

I went here for Saturday brunch . Seating is a little close but the food is pretty good . I had the short rib hash which was seasoned pretty well . The staff was very nice and friendly . I will definitely be coming back again

I went there for the restaurant week 3-course dinner. When I entered, the host placed me at a spot at the bar. It's a nice bar with friendly bartenders. I love their beer selection. I saw labels I had never seen before. The atmosphere was intimate, relaxing, and dark with warm lights. I felt comfortable sitting where I was.I chose mussels for my appetizer. It came with a thick piece of toast. The broth was buttery and spicy, perfect for soaking pieces of toast. The entree was a whole roasted porgy fish with pinto beans on the side. I did not like the fish. It was too salty in places. The dessert was delicious: chocolate mousse topped with cream and super thin cookie.There was another highlight to the experience. When I went into the bathroom, the atmosphere was floating with scents of cinnamon. A scented candle was burning by the corner of the bathroom. Little things like that lift the whole experience.+ Good bar+ Good beer+ Good mussels+ Delicious dessert+ Clean and cinnamon-scented bathroom- Salty roasted porgy

can I say yum- a bit crowded on the weekends but totally yummy!can here twice on the same weekend after I was cleared to enjoy life after giving birth.like that I was able to sit outside with my large stroller!

It's been on my list forever. I'm so grateful that we found two seats by the bar so we don't have to wait in line (they also have two outdoor tables).All sorts of Bloody Mary but they also do other drinks I think if you ask.See pic for the food. Biscuit was so good I had to get it on the side besides all the food we ordered.
Had a GREAT time with family, good food & cozy ambience. Plus, it's located in a very cool & friendly neighborhood in Brooklyn with many things to do!

Amazing amazing amazing!!! Their cheddar waffles, buttermilk biscuits, and walnut sticky buns are the best items on the menu!! The service was excellent! They accommodated our party of 10 for brunch, even though they don't normally take a table that big at that time. The line was down the block before they even opened, so that's a good sign of how great they are! You need to try this place for sure.
Service was good. Food did not match the hype. And there were mosquitoes and flies throughout the place. Drinks are very weak as well.

Worst money spent. This was not worth the hype. My quinoa was not cooked and I almost broke my tooth. The fried chicken was absolutely appalling. The only saving grace was the ketel one on the rocks, something they didn't have to work hard to do. The service was horrible. It took 20 minutes for a server to get my mother and grandmother a club soda when there was barely anyone in the restaurant. I understand now why the restaurant was not filled.

This place was a nice classic traditional atmosphere. It was cozy but warm. The food was DELISH! My husband had the most decadent pancakes that almost melted in your mouth. The pork chop was also very tasty and had just enough flavors. The mimosas were yummy as it seemed like they used fresh squeezed OJ. It's a MUST go!

Went there for brunch before 10am. Once it's open, half of the restaurant is full. So if you want brunch, come early as this place is so popular. We ordered the pork chop waffles (salty), and pecan French toast (sweet). Both are amazing.

Came here during a weeknight with reservations. It was not too packed, but the seating is pretty tight.There was a special that night for Monday night. $38 for 3 course menu.Summer Salad: it was good. It was warm though. I was expecting a coldness to it, but it was tasty.Buttermilk Fried Chicken: Cheddar waffles and cabbage slaw.  The chicken was good, but it was about par compared to all the fried chicken I've had.  hand cute fettucine: this was flavorful. I enjoyed it.  I liked this better than the fried chicken.Mini Pecan Pie: My favorite part of the meal. They did this right. I'd come back just for this.Overall: I'd come back for the mini pecan pie sundae.
Came here for Sunday brunch. Had the grilled cheese with apples. It was tasty. The only reason for 4 stars is that we had to wait almost 30 minutes even though we had a reservation.

Went for brunch with a friend. As she was waiting for me they moved her from the table multiple times, and the venue was extremely hot on an already hot day- thus the four stars.On the upside, the food was delicious! We had the French toast - amazing, eggs with cheese, homemade turkey sausage, and the summer salad- the dressing had too much vinegar for my liking. The mimosas were good, and my friend enjoyed her bloody Mary. The Bellini's had an awful after taste, I wasn't a fan.Overall good experience and wait service. They do need to put the AC on.

I've been coming here for years-specifically because they have a separate vegetarian menu. But they got rid of the veggie menu, and combined it into the regular menu, which means, there are far fewer veg options. My friend got the veggie burger and said it was average ($18), I got the market plate, and while it was good, it was not interesting enough to be on the menu. I'm disappointed to write this review-this used to be my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. I've been coming here for years and years, but I won't be back. Popovers used to be a lovely complimentary snack, and now you have to order them on the menu. I'm sure it's hard to keep a restaurant afloat, but removing a vegetarian menu-one that makes you stand out in a city of meat-centric restaurants, is not a great way to improve business. Such a bummer!

With all the hype about this place me and my fiancé finally made it out here on a Sunday for brunch. It was definitely one of a kind place. We wanted outdoor seating so waited about 40min the hostess up front was very sweet and attentive. Between me and my fiancé we couldn't decide what to get with all the great choices but ended up getting the eggs Benedict with a side order of pancakes! The pancakes are to die for definitely getting that next time. My eggs Benedict was good and the coffee was great. The place is definitely a great place to go, we are going back for brunch and having the pancakes and French toast. The only down side to my whole experience was our waitress was a little off. She was very forgetful and just not all there that day. Other than that it's Def a place to try don't hesitate!  Go early as it does get packed

I'm normally not one to post reviews being  that I'm in the restaurant business and know how hard it can be to please a patron. But today I felt the need to express my concerns about a place that I felt was on top of their game. I've been there on various occasion for brunch and enjoyed the service and the food. I normally sit with my girlfriend at the bar, we feel is more quaint. As we waited for some bar stools to clear up, I decided to order some drinks, that project took 15 minutes, I was never acknowledged or even glanced at so I can place my order. I literally had to wave my hands in the air so that I could be noticed, mind you it's a small bar. Now we are sitting at the bar for another 10 minutes without menus, the bartenders were just engaging in their personal conversation. Fifteens minutes after receiving our menus, we finally get to order our meal. So now I'm feeling a bit excited because I usually go there for the pork chops and waffles and was looking forward to it. Guess what? I was disappointed once again, the pork chop was half the normal size they usually serve, there was no crisp breading like it normally comes and the pork chop was extremely dry, really not edible. My girlfriend's meal was just as bad, she didn't finish it. Feeling all depressed now, we decided to try to end on a good note by ordering their deliciousness sticky buns but guess what? They didn't have any.  Pretty sad to see such a good restaurant starting to roll down hill hopefully the can remedy their situation but it's not looking good.
Great food but kind of a scene. LOTS of tourists come by here. Brunch is good but will require a wait. Dinner's better but service is relatively slow.
This is a great place to have brunch! I was there yesterday and I had the Eggs Huntington and it was so good! I can't wait to dine there again.

I have heard good things about this place for years and finally checked it out recently.  I must say I was not disappointed.  The food was amazing (do yourself a favor and try the mussels or the bacon appetizer).  The environment was great and conducive to talking and having  great time with your party.What truly made the experience one of the best I have had in recent years was the service.  We were fortunate enough to be seated in Grace's section.  She is witty, attentive, warm, friendly, and made excellent recommendations.  Her service was just as terrific as the food.  At the end of the night she transitioned to one of her colleagues Kristen who was also terrific and a great dancer :).Overall, Buttermilk Channel is worth the hype and do yourself a favor and check it out!

First off I will start off with the amazing service. Our waiter Grace was very welcoming and knew how to keep the conversation going. Now for the food it was just as good as the service. I had the burger with fries and it was very flavorful. For sure a spot I will revisit.

Eggs Benedict, Cheddar Cheese Waffles, Kale salad and the short stack of pancakes. After 1,000 plus reviews I don't think I can shed another insight into this classy restaurant. Just go and see what you think!

Came here for Sunday Brunch. Packed as expected but I arrived much earlier than the rest of my party (1.5 hours) and the front of house was very accommodating. She kept us in mind and once the whole party arrived we were seated very quickly. I ordered the short rib hash and it was very rich and flavorful. Imagine a corned beef hash with a more gamey taste. The pancakes were something I'd definitely come back and order instead. They were so huge and fluffy and a competitor to some of the top pancakes in Brooklyn. If you go, make sure to head over around opening time to get seated quickly as this is a hot spot!
Dinner was amazing, great fresh menu that had lots of seasonal options.  Salads and chicken & waffles stood out. Ambiance was really warm and cozy, definitely a great place to go back.
I love brunch @ this place. Service is excellent, fast, and food is so delicious! I love their eggs huntington and their pecan pie french toasts! A must to go to!

Really great dinner. We were going to a show nearby and came across Buttermilk Channel for dinner. The mushroom barley burger exceeded expectations. Husband had the duck meatloaf, which he really enjoyed. Staff were very pleasant. We will be back!

The weekends are made for brunch and New York is renound for its selection. Buttermilk Channel has a lovely organic brunch spread with many of the items sourced from local farms. I brought a brunch buddy as an excuse to try multiple items. The short rib hash comes with eggs sunny-side up, toast, and organic greens. Also pictured is the fried pork chop and cheddar waffle. We also added an extra side of waffles and bacon, because...bacon. And what better way to top off brunch, than with a classic bloody mary. We then capped off our meal with a warm walnut sticky bun.Brunch spread has a nice selection and so does the cocktail menu. Food was great.

This place, especially with weekend service on the subways, felt impossible to get to. Were it not for that, I'd totally come here more.Caught up with an old coworker here at her recommendation. Ordered brunch (me the sausage scramble, her the pancakes) on a warm Saturday around noon.I loved the:- ambience, very casual and not too loud- place, plenty of natural light- service, incredibly friendly and responsive - food, filling and deliciousNoticed also that:- orange juice is great, freshly squeezed?- toast (with the scramble) was not was I was expecting, but still very good- portions were generous, the pancakes for sure could serve at least two

One of the few times when I wish I could rate each aspect of the experience individually.  The service was excellent, staff are pleasant and cordial at all times.   The atmosphere is just right.  The multiple times I've been here for brunch, have never left disappointed. Hence, my strong interest in giving Buttermilk Channel a try for dinner.  Oh how I wanted to love it! Alas, it wasn't meant to be as pleasing. For dinner tonight, we ordered the Waffles with Fried Chicken - "dish we're known for", as well as the beer-steamed mussels, and sides of asparagus and mashed potatoes. Quite frankly, my initial reaction was - "OMG!" but then I had a few more bites ....  I can't say everything was just terrible.  It really wasn't; however, it all fell so short of the expectations set by my own past experience, as well as that of others (and the various reviews).  The further into the meal we got, the more I wanted to ask - "did the chef have an accident with the salt?" Absolutely everything was just entirely too salty (and I do love salt btw).  It completely overwhelmed any other flavors I tried to hold on to.Aside from that, the mashed potatoes were very good ... almost good enough not to pay attention to how salty they were.  The chicken - moist on the inside and crispy on the outside, just how it should be but ... well you know, the salt ... the mussels, we were really not impressed with and I won't even mention the S word again ... It was very gracious of the GM to offer dessert on the house but being that were were quite full, we politely declined.  She was kind enough to comp the asparagus and the mashed potatoes.  So sad ... may be another time ...

The hash is killer - just enough spice and still tender, nice greens, runny eggs. Classic bloody was tasty too, like the pickle addition. We ordered a side of hash browns as an afterthought, scarfed immediately. We wrestled with a pancake v. French toast decision, were impressed with the Fr toast - it's kind of an eggy pound cake in a bed of syrup. This place lives up to the hype.

I really wanted to love you buttermilk channel. But I just cannot. I came here on a weekend with my Best friend that was visiting from Philadelphia. Our tradition is that we must have brunch whenever we go visit one another. The wait was 30-35 mins wait for a party of two however they were full and there were plenty of waiters. Maybe I was just hangry. After waiting in the hot sticky weather for 30 mins we finally got sat down in a tiny corner with a tiny table. Our server took a while to come but he came after 5 mins ish. He started our order with some coffee. First things first thing place only has cocktails and alcoholic drinks no where on the menu offers anything else so I guess you have to ask them what they have. I was super disappointed. The coffee isn't good at all. I ordered the egg Huntington with ham. My best friend got the egg mushroom with goat cheese that comes with hash brown and toast. we shared an order of buttermilk pancakes and a order of cheddar waffles. First of the egg huntington was SUPER SUPER SALTY. I knew the ham was going to be salty but the biscuit and cheese was SUPER SALTY as well to the point where it removed a layer on top of my mouth. As for the egg mushroom and goat cheese it was okay. The hash brown didn't look like a hash brown at all it just looked like a sad piece of potatoe. The cheddar waffles didn't have much taste to it. Just a plain waffle nothing amazing. The best part about this place is the pancake. It was nice big and FLUFFY. YUMMMMMMMMM. The service here is just OK. My cousin paid for the meal so she asked for change back. Waiter gave her a nasty look as if she wasn't going to tip him. but we obviously did a large amount. Then he decieded to smile. Anyways I had higher expectations for this place. Disappointed.

This place is still packed and I like the vibe, bar, the menu, and in general the service. But dinner the other night was horrible. The server misunderstood one order and though he was apologetic, the wait was 25 minutes to fix the mistake. A cod dish was so wildly over-salted that it was inedible. I'm sorry I didn't send it back. (I never send things back, which is a mistake. But I'd lost my appetite by then.) Others in the group reported over-salting, too. Bad nights can happen, but at these prices... I'll probably be back though because I had good experiences when the place first opened and hope springs eternal.
I had the eggs benedict. Great. Friends had the French toast, which looked heavenly, and the pancakes which were fluffy and a mile high. Restaurant was on the small side but the service was great.
Brunch Review.Overpriced. Small portions. Long waits. Unexciting dishes. Not worth it.Just walk the 20 more minutes to Red Hook and go somewhere there.

Nice place, good food and nice waitress. There is highchair but no baby change table. Today it was crowded and we wait 1 hour to get our table. The music is too loud. I had the cauliflower and lamb salad that i shared with my baby girl and we both loved it !
Excellent dinner!   Wife had the chicken and waffles which were really good and I had a delicious whole fish done just right.  The mix drinks were very good.

My husband and I were out in Brooklyn and decided to drop by Buttermilk Channel for brunch. Fortunately we arrived early and though we had to wait until they opened, we got a table without further wait.  The room is attractive and the atmosphere is lively and fun. The team couldn't have been nicer.  I had the pork chop with cheddar waffle (way too much food so fortunately hubby helped out) and he had the burger.  We enjoyed both dishes very much, though I thought the pork was far better than the waffle. I cannot recall the wine I drank but I recall that they had good choices by the glass. I wouldn't make a special trip to Brooklyn to eat here, but if we find ourselves in the neighborhood again, we'd go back.

The service is really good. Everyone is super friendly. They talk with you deeply and interact with you. Servers are really knowledgeable about the menu and how the food tastes. The food is really good. The barbecue oysters are amazing. And for my entree I had barbecue duck with grits. The sauce was not overwhelming, it was just right. The grits were different in that they fried it but very good. The food is kind of pricey which is why I only my gave 4 stars but overall it was really really good.

I haven't ordered anything here that's been short of amazing. The always popular pecan french toast can only be described as decadent. My personal favorite is the pork chop and cheddar waffles. I mostly come here for brunch, but they make a mean dinner, too.

I think this place is definitely overprice for what it is worth. The portions were small. My pouch eggs with smoked salmon were good however there were barely any food and it is more expensive than the large porkchop  with waffles my friend has got. My friend's waffle was burnt. I don't understand what's the hype of this place. My dinner last night was half of what I ordered here. The hash brown was expensive for two pieces. Got coffee, ice coffee and mimosa. The mimosa was alright.

They initially quoted an hour wait but we ended up only waiting 20 minutes, we went next door for a drink while we waited on our text. Once we were seated our waitress was wonderful and very attentive our food was amazing. Although I live in the Bronx it was well worth the travel, I will be returning for sure!!!

I came here for brunch and had the Fried pork chops and cheddar waffles.Pork chops- 5 out of 10Cheddar Waffles- 4 out of 10The pork chops weren't really seasoned, they tasted bland. I had to eat it with hot sauce to finish it. If you love cheddar cheese and a good waffle combo, then this may be good to you. I hated it because I preferred a plain waffle.

Came here for a friends birthday dinner party. We had reservations but still had to wait near an hour to get our seats. The restaurant did give our party some complementary snacks for our trouble. I found the menu to be a bit too restrictive and settled on the chicken and waffles which was OK. The cabbage slaw was a nice touch to this dish. However, the chicken and waffles was a whopping $27 which to be frank is just robbery. I can name 5 places I could get chicken and waffles for less than $20. Anyway there isn't much incentive for me to return.

See picture.That French Toast with syrup and pecan was heavenly. And that iced latte is probably the best in the area.I've come here a few times and never had a chance to eat here because of the wait, but I gave it a try thinking that the only way to get a table is a table for one. And I did, gladly sat at a table instead of a bar (you'd think they'd seat me at the bar).I originally wanted to try their pancakes cause when you speak of pancakes in NYC, Buttermilk Channel is always high up there in the rankings. But that French Toast caught my eyes and I just couldn't resist, it turned out that it's warm, crispy on the outside, sweet, with a soft texture that melts away in your mouth. It's so buttery. I ordered a side of harsh browns and they were so tasty and crispy without being burning hot. Their staff is quite friendly, even though the hostess could be a little "cold" to my liking but she got me a table. :) I am dying to come back for other dishes.
The short rib hash/eggs and pecan French toast were great! Service was good and loved the bloody marys.

I had dinner and brunch here, and I have to say I loved their friend chicken (dinner) and pork chop (brunch).  Great service and loved the shared table concept (in center of the restaurant).  Brunch gets busy but you should know that already!

Good brunch place, reasonable prices, and the portions are just right (if not huge - sometimes you want a pile o' food and this place is not that). No bottomless drink options, so not super boozy. Lots of kids but not overwhelming/loud. Expect a wait during peak hours - though our wait has never been too long somehow. Perhaps we've been lucky.

Really yummy fried chicken and waffles. SUPER bummed that they no longer serve complimentary popover baskets. I have been here many times and it's always a nice staff and atmosphere. Love rose as well!

I have been here so many times and it is excellent every single time. This review will focus on brunch, but their dinner is stellar as well.Ok, let's talk about the food. S#!T it is good. My wife and I consider ourselves brunch aficionados, connoisseurs even, and this is consistently the best brunch we have had in all of NYC. Normally when we go to brunch we have a standard order, split an eggs benedict then split a french toast, because why decide whether you want savory or sweet when you can have both (see, I told you we were experts). The problem is their other savory dishes here are too good to skip. Their eggs benedict (technically called eggs huntington) is what all other eggs benedicts hope they can become when they grow up. First off, it is served on a biscuit and then the biscuit is topped with thinly shaved country ham (it is like they crafted this benedict specifically for this VA boy). Next, sitting atop the biscuit and ham is a perfectly poached egg...seriously...every time is had been perfectly cooked...how is that possible. Next they top the egg with a lemon-y hollandaise, some scallions and just a pinch of maldon sea salt. Simply amazing. I love my wife a lot, so I let her order that.My decision comes down to choosing between the short rib hash or the pork chop and waffles. It is impossible to go wrong here (except that I can't eat them both). The short rib hash has a delicious and tender short rib which is balanced with a hint of sweetness from sweet potatoes, all topped with two fried eggs and paired with some seriously good toast. The pork chop and waffle amps up both the saltiness and the sweetness. A Fred Flintstone sized pork chop smothers a nicely cheddar laced waffle and when you pour the maple syrup on top it creates heaven in your mouth.Because I can't skip the savory dish, we tend to invite along others to join us for brunch. We pretend it is so we can show our friends this great restaurant, but it is really so we can split "Table Toast" (french toast shared with the table, it's my own phrase, you can use it just remember where you got it). Regardless of whether you are full at this point in the meal, DO NOT LEAVE THIS PLACE WITHOUT GETTING THE PECAN PIE FRENCH TOAST. Two super thick pieces of, crispy outside, custard-y inside, french toast sit on the plate covered in the most delicious pecan pie sauce (I mean it really tastes like pecan pie) with a big heaping scoop of home made whipped cream. It is so good, you'll pretend that you're just going to have one bite...and then after tasting it you'll be fighting your table mates to scoop up the last bits of pecans.Oh, and I almost forgot about Doug and the great service. All of the servers are pretty great. Plus, on most days Doug, one of the co-owners can be found at the restaurant greeting everyone who comes in with a welcoming smile. If you go, be sure to say hi and tell him I sent you.

This place is incredible! You have to get the walnut sticky bun. It tastes so fresh and homemade. They even make their own smoked salmon! The biscuits were so light and airy. Service was good! Everything was absolutely perfect. Worth the 30 minute wait:)

The food here was good and all, but for the amount of attention this place gets I honestly expected it to be way better. The service was decent, not spectacular but definitely not bad. Maybe it's something more special on account of the wasteland its surrounding neighborhood used to be, but it's changed a lot over the last 5 years so I don't get why there's hours-long waits for this place when the chicken and waffles over at Sidecar on 5th Avenue are *way* better. The same dish is also pretty good over at The Dram Shop on 9th Street. As for pancakes, they were OK here, but again, for the money and quality, Dizzy's and Daisy's are two go-to spots in Park Slope that are pretty unbeatable in comparison, without the hours-long wait.It's entirely possible I just haven't had their signature dish (whatever that may be), but with so many great options close by that don't require starving for hours before being seated, it's just not worth the wait for decent but not incredible food.
Came all the way from Hawaii to eat here and it was well worth it!  The fried chicken with cheddar waffles and cole slaw was amazing, as were the desserts!  The service was excellent!
The poached eggs were amazing. The staff wasn't  really friendly but they were professional. I would definitely go back because the food was just great.
Everything in the menu is amazing. The wait time for a table is off putting, but its worth the wait I guess. Enjoy!

I came here recently after many years away! I was wanting pancakes and when I looked on Yelp they were highly recommended. On a Saturday at prime time brunch the wait for 2 was 30-40 minutes. Pancakes were really good but not so amazing that I'd come back just for them.Returned for dinner on a Sunday night at 8pm and the atmosphere was quiet and relaxed with candlelight. We were seated immediately. Popovers with honey and sea salt were each devoured in a bit each. Delicious. Husbands mushroom and barley burger was SUPERB!!! He loved it (he's a meat eater and I'm surprised he ordered it no less enjoyed it so much). It was served with their slaw and pickles on brioche bun. Although I didn't care for the pickles (I dislike mustard flavor), I actually enjoyed the slaw which I never ever eat. I ordered the vegetable bowl with ancient grains. Although seemingly simple , the flavors of the beet tahini and yogurt were quite unique and delicious ! I can't wait to bring my parents and friends here.Excellent, attentive, classy service

It was an amazing place my and my best friend came to New York for my 30th, I wanted to do brunch but because it is soooo many places to choose from I could not make up my mind. I initially wanted to go to a different spot but something caught my eye about this place. For one lol we walked about 15 blocks lol !!!! to get to the place we parked so far because we where unsure of the parking. and down those blocks there where so many other restaurants that caught our eye ! but we stuck it thru and kept walking. We got there and brunch was almost over but they where such friendly people that they took us for there last customers for brunch and we even got to sit in the nice cozy spot rignt in front of the restaurant where the window is that outlooks to the street. To make a long review short lol we enjoyed every bit of our meal and we didn't eat until later on that night. So great job on the outstanding service and the warming welcomes keep up the good work.

I called to reserve a table. the recorded message played each time, even though it was well after the opening time. When we arrived at the restaurant we were told it would be an hour wait. I mentioned that there might be a problem with the phone. The response from the woman taking names was, "Oh yeah, sorry to busy". The place is very cute, but extremely loud. The food is mediocre and another long wait. The server was busy but disinterested in the work. I would have rated average if not for the to busy to answer the phone thing. By the way, I have been in the restaurant business for over 30 yrs. Trust me, you could do better.

Really enjoyed Buttermilk Channel! Everything was amazingly fresh and well presented! I had the fried chicken & waffles with balsamic maple syrup and a martini! Terrific friendly service with a "no hurry.. Take your time and enjoy" vibe..

The menu says "seasonal." It has never changed from season to season, year to year. Also- not sure if she's still there, but the blonde woman hostess is a real witch out and about the neighborhood. I have never heard someone be so nasty when ordering coffee from the local deli.

The food is good but several times the food has been slow out of the kitchen. That happens. The reaction tonight, when I brought the slow arrival of the food to the attention of the hostess, was defensive. Maybe I had ordered appetizers. Maybe this and maybe that.I don't consider this a service oriented response. Our deserts were comped, but the attitude of the hostess was negative and our dining  experience was compromised. Alas. A nice neighborhood restaurant, but my experience with the service and management's response has decided me not to return.

I've been here for brunch twice and dinner once. I don't get the hype at all. It's good but there are other places in the neighborhood that are better. There is always a wait here though so the masses are pleased.

Have been here for dinner a while ago and finally came for brunch last weekend. It was a rainy Sunday and on the early side (11:30ish) so thought there wouldn't be much of a wait. The wait was about 30-45 minutes which was fine since I wanted to be super hungry when we sat down and it worked! The bf and I ordered a few things to share with our plates, he had the short rib hash and i had the mushroom, spinach scramble - eggs were cooked perfectly fluffy and slightly under done. As sides we shared a cheddar waffle, bacon and hashbrowns, everything was delicious. I loved the waffle since the cheddar comes through in every bite and is crispy on the outside with a little chewiness. To top it off, we had a cinnamon bun which I wish was a bit warmer but was still great. Service was on point as well, attentive, quick and not overbearing.
Really cute and delicious chicken and waffles!
Group of four- not one complaint. Need I say more?  One regret- after I went, everyone said "I hope you had the chicken and waffle."  I didn't.

Simply as good as it gets!I LOVE the fried chicken and waffles and the mashed potatoes are so good. If you are going to go here, I suggest at night, even though it is probably the busiest time of day for this place. They have countless sweet and savory dishes that you can pick one. Honestly, whichever you pick, you can count on one of the best meals of your life. I bet you, the only accounts that give this bad reviews are fake accounts.
Must admit though sticking to the appetizers makes for a more interesting meal as the amount of work they put into them is obviously extraordinary.

Buttermilk Channel is probably one of the best brunch spots in all of NYC! The food is unimaginable. I've been there twice and both times it was an amazing experience. They have a very friendly and attentive staff and the service was excellent.The food! OMG! I had the sticky bun and it was to die for! Also the pancakes are insane.Highly recommend!!!!

I have been here often. It is so beyond good and amazing. The menu is limited, but what they do have is definitely worth tasting. I have never had anything bad but my personal favorite are the buttermilk pancakes for brunch. They are thick and delicious slice of heaven.

This place is has a nice southern feel, it's super bright and cozy. I love it! I really enjoyed their brunch and Bloody Mary. Worth the travel and the money. I would totally come back for more. Advice: If you are waiting in line to grab a table. You may provide them with your name and number, they will directly text you when your table is ready. Why not walk around and enjoy the scenery or grab a drink at a local sit down bar.

This place had a lot of hype to live up to and I did not feel let down at all.  I went here for brunch on a Sunday and it was definitely top three brunches I've had in recent memory.  I got there 10 minutes before they opened and there was already a line starting to form outside.  If you don't want to wait for hours, get there early.  I split an eggs Benedict and a fried pork chop & cheddar waffle with someone else.  They were both good but the pork chop and waffle was like last meal worthy.  The one thing I missed out on was their bloody Mary's, thanks to that stupid blue law preventing alcohol sales before noon on Sunday.  I'll be going back to try their cocktails.  There's actually a bloody Mary list which I found very intriguing.  I would for sure recommend this place to friends, even as a destination worthy restaurant.

I came here with a party of 5 on a Sunday morning around 10:30 and they told me we had to wait an hour. So we hanged out around the area until they texted me. Unfortunately I only got to try the scramble eggs :( because all of my friends ordered the same thing. The mushroom, spinach, and goat cheese scramble was tasty and in my opinion it was a good portion of eggs. The scrambles came with a side salad (that was delicious), a hashbrown (delicious also) and two half peaces of a seeded whole wheat toast that was also good. I am definitely coming back to try the eggs Benedict and the pecan French Toast.

Walked in today for brunch with the wife around 11 and waited about 20 min for a table not bad seeing that the place was on and poppin. I had the Eggs Huntington which was there take on a classic eggs benedict with a biscuit versus the classic muffin. My only complaint was wish this dish was bigger! It was well executed. It had all the components I look for it  a good brunch dish. To finish my meal I ordered the Sticky Bun! It's a must have for a small sweet treat. Take a look!!!

So my husband and I arrived yesterday around 7:30 the hostess took my husbands name and told us it would be a 45 minute wait which was fine. We went down the block to a cute little bar called Mini Bar which had some really stellar cocktails you must check that spot out if your ever in the area. Anywho so we have a round of drinks and before you know it its 8:30 and still no call from the waitress about our table which seemed odd. We walk back down to the restaurant and are instantly greeted by the hostess who seemed a little "disheveled" and maybe even "tipsy" my husband inquires about our table and she says "oh yeah what was your name Sean right?" mind you my husbands name is Henry. The Hostess then taps a few buttons on her tablet and tells us she has a table ready for us now no apology just a big ole goofy smile on her face. So basically if we had not walked back into this place we would have never gotten a table because the Hostess totally forgot about us which is a friggin mess. We sit we are greeted we order drinks and food from the waitress and the wait begins. I ordered the Fried Chicken and Waffles and a side of roasted veggies and my hubby got the Hanger steak and whipped mash. We got our drinks and waited 45 minutes for our food to arrive by the time the food got to us we were starving. I mean we had expected dinner at 8 not 10 so we dug in. The  chicken was overly breaded and tough with little seasoning and hardly any meat under all the coating my waffle was cold like it was actually cool instead of warm but I could imagine if it had been hot it would have been pretty good. My husbands steak was good but the portion size was laughable for the price like literally 5 or 6 little tiny slices of steak and a spoon full of spinach. The veggies were pretty good you cant really mess up roasted veggies to much but the large brussel sprouts didn't seem edible so I left those alone. All in all the best thing about the meal was the healthy portion of whipped mash potatoes which now that I think about it did kinda taste like instant lunch room mash, so maybe there really wasn't anything special about the meal at all. When it was time to leave the server told us that she in fact was leaving so her partner would be taking over but he never came to the table and we ended up getting the check from the drunken red headed hostess. We paid someone else and when we left a waitress from outside grabbed our bill off the table and that was that, no goodbyes no "sorry we forgot about you" and no "please come agains". The bill came to about 120.00 with tip but the food did not reflect those prices AT ALL. I mean for 120.00 dollars I could have went to Sweet Chick and gotten way more food with way more flavor. I was really looking forward to this experience from all the reviews I was expecting to really be wowed but instead I was WTFed instead I mean the food was so sub par the menu prices almost seem like a bad prank. I'm actually really sad I wasted a babysitter, 120.00 and a nice dress on this place. Next time we head to Sweet Chick and get some real food.

This place is always packed, managed to get a reservation for a table of 4 at the last minute. Food, especially the buttermilk fried chicken, was good. Service was excellent despite a full house. Really nice ambience, would definitely be a good date night spot.

Finally had the opportunity to try Buttermilk Channel. Excelllent service and staff. Bloody Mary Star of the Sea rocks.! Great housemadepickles.I tried the mussels and swordfish.. Both excellent. Wife had the mushroom barley burger which was just ok.Place is always packed but the staff are amazing!we had excellent service.

Returned to this fantastic place after more than a year, and it's great to see that everything is still running beautifully.We showed up without a reservation around 5:30 and was seated at the bar (the place was packed not long after, so you want to score a reservation to be safe). The cocktails are great and pretty stiff (The Fair Harbor was a favorite). The chicken and waffles is probably the Thing You Have to Eat here. Likewise, the duck meatloaf was delicious.Service is great. The aforementioned Fair Harbor cocktail slipped out of my hands and crashed onto the bar (to my great embarrassment). They cleaned the mess promptly and served me a new drink without any problems. And considering how busy the place became, the staff seemed to be comfortable handling it all.A solid option that won't disappoint.
Nice place for dinner or brunch in Carroll Gardens area.  The vibe inside is easy-going and the food is tasty.  It's not out-of-this-world good but it's one of the best options in the area!

Decent food and service, but not as memorable as I would have liked. We stopped by as a party of two on a weekend with a reservation, and it was pretty packed throughout most of our meal. We split the house-made pappardelle and the Buttermilk fried chicken, and I thought it was just fine, although not as amazing as I had expected given the rave reviews for the latter (the cheddar waffles didn't really do much for me). The ambiance was nice and the service generally very good, but I didn't find the meal to be as unique.

Things look better than they taste. We came here for Sunday brunch and end up sitting at the bar with my two babies which was fine I guess =L. The fluffy pancakes looks delicious but it was bland, totally flavorless. The short rib hash was too bland too. The Maple pecan French toast was really good but the edges can be really hard. The cinnamon bun was ok wish it was a bit more moist.

Only been here once, and we sat outside. Although the place is small, we, a party of 3, had no problem getting a table immediately on an early fall evening (beautiful weather). The waitress was very friendly and accommodating. I had to get the chicken and waffles of course, which was absolutely delicious, but to be honest, is hard to justify at $25 or so. I know these boutique restaurant prices are somewhat par for the course in Carroll Gardens, but still... Anyhow, my two friends (visiting from France, and thus with the sort of palates one would be wise to place stock in) loved the burger ($16!) and whatever else it was the other got. All said, it's a sort of one and done place for me, just to say I've been, however, this is mostly reflecting what is overpriced in my opinion. I could not complain about the food, service, atmosphere whatsoever.

Went here for brunch today with my family, there was a wait out the door ofcourse.. But to me that only means how good the food must be. I do not mind waiting for GOOD food! So our wait was 1 hour long but we are a family of 5 so no complaints!! When we were seated we were immediately greeted by our server. I ordered the eggs Huntington along with a side order of bacon, hash browns and buttermilk biscuits to share. My 2 daughters both ordered the ABC grilled cheese, which came with a salad our server asked if I'd like to change the side to fries but since my kids are pretty good with salad they said they'd rather that! My husband ordered the pork chop & waffles, and my aunt ordered a egg scramble with roasted mushrooms, spinach and goat cheese. Everybody was completely happy with their meals and I had a bite of the ABC grilled cheese and OMG!!!! It was so full of flavor I loved it! Everything was amazing, definitely will be back!

I love this place.  My favorites are the nuts with bacon, the chicken and waffles, and the pecan pie ice cream sundae.  The food is rich and the flavor pairings are complex.  The atmosphere is comfortable but the dim lighting, deep woods, and clean whites make it work for a nice date or a place to take the family.  The last time I went I made an error on Open Table where I booked the reservation, accidentally reserving for the next day.  The hostess was so incredibly kind and accommodating, she reassured us and had a table ready on a busy night in 5 min.

Their chicken & waffles dish is THE BEST I have ever come across. They have this insanely good syrup that goes with both the chicken & the waffle. I'm not a coleslaw fan BUT theirs makes me want about a pint of it. The atmosphere is always wonderful & the owner/manager is always at the door to greet you. Go on a monday & get their special prefix menu if you're a bargain hunter & want a sample of what this place has to offer. They never fail me & I will ALWAYS go back. Sat at the bar once since there were no table available & the bartender was great & friendly. Everything about this place is just what you would want in a nice dinner date night spot. Did I mention their chicken is AMAZING?!

Amazing...be prepared to wait. Have patience, it's worth the wait. Try the pickles and sweet bun...weird combination? Yep, but it's delicious. Great service btw...refilled our coffee 3 times... And not too expensive... Definitely will come back here...

The wait is typically long for brunch. BUT on a nice day you might be able to snag a seat outside pretty quickly. Especially if one chair is in the sun. The donuts/muffins are always good. I highly recommend the Pecan Pie French Toast and the Pecan Pie Ice Cream Sunday. Monday Night Prix Fixe Dinner's are also pretty good. It's also very child friendly, so don't go around 5-6, if you don't like children.
Buttermilk Channel is so nice. I am never disappointed when I go there for lunch or dinner. Although I am bummed the popovers are longer complimentary.

Even though I've lived in the area for 18 years, I have only been able to eat here twice, and only recently. What a fabulous restaurant! Beautiful setting, great, sensitive & skilled cooking, and excellent service as well. A true successor to Grocery-- although more hearty -- and certainly the equal of Rucola, or now-gone Saul. Very tough to get into at brunch time, this is for dinner in my book!

This place is a bit further from my house than i expected so getting here was definitely a trek but i had heard great things about the food so i expecting the trip to be well worth it. We were a party of 4, i went in gave my name to the hostess she told me it was a 40 minute wait and I'd get a text notification. I think this is a pretty cool system. It was a bit crowded at the door during this time; people were adding their names to the waitlist, trying to enter, trying to leave, looking to see where the hostess was at one point i was standing really close in-between a party of 2 eating at the bar. In about 35 minutes my phone buzzed letting me know our table was ready. I like the ambiance of the place, very homey environment. It was fully packed and the noise level reflected that. The customers were a mixed crowd which i always like, lots of families with their children brunching. Our server was very pleasant, quick (for it to be that busy) and accommodating. We ordered; short rib hash w/ sunny side up eggs (2x), buttermilk pancakes and bacon, fried pork chops and cheddar waffle. The hash (my order) was decent, i had to add some salt and pepper it needed a bit more seasoning but i was satisfied with the portion, presentation and overall taste of the meal. The pancakes (my daughters order) were ok, she did not enjoy them too much which made me have to taste them because "come on 7 yr old they are pancake!!" but i was with her on it; they weren't that great. The fried pork chop (my moms order) i only had an amuse bouche taste and it was delicious. When i later asked my mom if she enjoyed her response was "ehhh, it was food so i ate it!" She was thrown off by the cheddar waffle. I would maybe go another time to explore the menu more. I was a bit underwhelmed this first time.

You are not here to read a thesis on their cuisine. The food is delicious,  bookmarked this restaurant months ago,  but couldn't schelp all the way down Court Street. Today it was worth the wait. No lines surprisingly for Easter Sunday (noon), enjoyed the Eggs Huntington (that buttermilk biscuit=delightful), cozy venue, typical brunch prices (takes CC).

This was a good dinner experience; the wait was a bit long though. It took us a hour and a half to get seated. Your best bet is to call ahead ask for the wait time and reserve your seat accordingly. Once we were seated our waitress came over,she was very attentive (not in an obnoxious way). We placed our order and received it in a timely fashion, food was warm and looked appetizing. I had the chicken and cheddar waffle entree, which was good but my only qualm was that I felt that the chicken could have been seasoned a bit more it was a little on the boring side. The cheddar waffles though were on point they tasted like macaroni and cheese in waffle form . The place had a good atmosphere, conversation  flowed, music wasn't loud and overbearing. Definitely a place to stop in and check out if you're thinking about it. P.S Their  menu is a little limited I'm guessing it changes with the season or at leisure Idk just a heads up!

I've been here for brunch a couple of times. Yes the wait is intimidating, but it goes faster than you think. I would just go for the different types of Bloody Mary's. Those alone made me a fan. The scrabbles are delicious and the perfect size so you have room for dessert - French toast!!! Delish!

Have only been for dinner. Food was delicious. We split the burger and friend chicken on waffles. The burger was perfectly cooked and the chicken lived up to its legacy (although the waffles were a little dry and bland). Waiter was great. Atmosphere was OK. Make sure that it is not kids hour before you go if you don't want to be surrounded by tons of children for a nice meal.
The salmon eggs were off the chain!!!!!!!!! I tried to replicate it at home...A DISASTER.
Actually found a table as we walked in!!! Never happened to me before brunch!!! The pecan french toast were delicious!!!!! And the also had excellent coffee. Great food and great service!!

Came here last night for dinner/drinks with a friend! We got really lucky and didn't have to wait at all (party of 2 on Thursday night at around 8:30pm).ATMOSPHERE: 4 starsVery charming, dimly lit restaurant. Good for date night or just for dinner with friends. Some of the tables were very close together, though, and when it was full, it felt a LITTLE cramped, but what else is new in NY.FOOD: 4 stars- Oysters with Grapefruit Mignonette: the mignonette was great! We ordered a dozen oysters and had a mix of the two types of oysters for the day, one of which was saltier, while the other was creamier. I personally preferred the creamier one, but both were solid selections. Very fresh!- Buttermilk Fried Chicken with Cheddar Waffles and Savoy Cabbage Slaw: AMAZING. As someone who takes her fried chicken very seriously (I'm currently at three meals in a row of fried chicken), I must say this fried chicken was really on point. The portions are rather large -- one wing, one drumstick, and one breast, but I couldn't get enough. The skin is perfectly crispy and peppery (mmm), while the inside is juicy, tender, and all kinds of delicious. It went really well with the savory cheddar waffle -- yum. The slaw was also a great complement to add a bit of freshness to the dish. Highly recommend you also drizzle lots of maple syrup on top of the chicken AND the waffles. Salivating just thinking about this.- Buttermilk Whipped Potatoes: objectively, very tasty whipped potatoes, however I was so blown away by the fried chicken that I kind of forgot about this dish.DRINKS: 4 stars- The Westlake (Bourbon, Elderflower Liqueur & Regan's No. 6 Orange Bitters): solid drink. The elderflower adds an interesting twist, and the drink is strong without being overly sweet. I had two!- Old Fashioned: my friend ordered an Old Fashioned and liked it!SERVICE: 3.5 starsWasn't TERRIBLE, but it did take a while to get our food orders in, and to get the check.PRICE: 4 starsTotal per person came out to $75 post-tax, pre-tip. With 20% tip, the total was $90/person. This includes two drinks each, a dozen oysters, two entrees, and one side, so I felt it was well worth the price tag, especially considering how good the fried chicken was!OVERALL: 4 starsVery solid restaurant in BK. I would definitely come back. I think on Mondays they offer a $35 fixed price, three-course menu (yes, the fried chicken is one of the entree options).

I give this location a four.The waitress in this place was so great.Since my family and I were newbies to the place she recommended everything even dowm to our wine selection lol.The ambiance of the place is nice for a date night.Nice lit candles on the table,so the place has a dim setting.I would say I wasnt too crazy about the food.We had chicken and waffles with a maple vingerette syrup.Pretty interested combo but it was ok.I just feel like for the price I expected my meal to be better.I wont give up on this place just yet,I heard the brunch is awesome.To be cont..d

With the exception of the obnoxiously long wait; it was fantastic. The long wait gave us just enough time to get buzzed next door on margaritas and then come back an hour later for our brunch.  There were 4 of us and we all ordered something different - and they were all equally delicious. I had the pancakes. It's a huge order. Way more pancake than one person needs. Biscuits were great too. Overall a great brunch.
Came here for Sunday Brunch, the wait was over an hour but the food was good.

Yummo! I had the french toast which was exquisite. Only wish it came with some fruit. Other than that it was amazing. My friend had the scramble which she said was good. I will definitely come back here to try more of the dishes (everything looked amazing) and the drinks.
Get here early and expect to wait, but it is all worth it! One of my absolute favorite brunch spots in the city. Coming here is always a treat. I dream about their pancakes!
Wait was about 45mins on a Saturday, food was good. Fried Pork Chop & Cheddar Waffles, poker chop was dry. Everything else we had was good

Amazing Easily a favorite reoccurring spotSo everything We had here was amazing Important tip: this place fills up fast and stays pretty busy throughout the day. Keep that in mind when heading there for a meal.We had smoked salmon, burger, and pecan French toast and a few cocktails.Cocktails were top notch, imaginative and delicious (with the exception of the westlake cocktail)The food was spectacular. Even the damn toast was perfectly toasted, lolThe salmon pieces (4 large) were nice and big and were not too salty. They cure it to perfection over. The burger was very well prepared. Juicy, crispy, flavored well. One of the best I've ever had anywhere.The pecan pie French toast was decadent. Crispy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside. Perfectly flavored- we had it as dessert.Each dish we ordered stood out as something special.It's hard to choose what to order there. Everything on the menu looks killer.Anyway, it's pricey but worth every cent. The service is friendly and attentive Very clean and well kept establishment The patrons are pleasant as wellNot noisy or obnoxious Everything about this place is 5 starsMust try!

I could not have possibly had a better experience. My boyfriend and I came in to celebrate our anniversary, after hearing bits and pieces from the public ether that Buttermilk Channel served up impeccably delicious food. Our server was Erin, who was attentive and sweet (I will be requesting to sit in her section for the next time we visit). We started off with the Green Goddess Salad, where neither of us held any complaints; bleu cheese, bacon, and avocado make a tasty trifecta. My boyfriend ordered the Warm Lamb salad whereas I chose the Hanger Steak (rare, of course). The steak, I must say, was by far the best I've ever ingested, and I'm from Texas. Both the meal and service were en pointe, I can't wait to return.
Great neighborhood restaurant. You can go with the kids or for a date night. Delicious food and friendly service.

Yum, really lucky we only had to wait less than 30 minutes for a table for 2 on a saturday in the dead of winter when i hear the wait can be 1 hour to 1.5 hours!they take down your number and text you when the table is ready so that you can explore or chill while you are waiting for your tableone of the best southern brunches i've had, worth the trek out to brooklyn, very close to the F train--fried pork chop with cheddar waffle: loved the light cheddar waffle! the fried pork chop was good too but some parts were too thick so it got a bit dry--SHORT RIB HASH: i heard people complain that it's too fatty but that's what makes it so good!! sure it's a bit salty but with that runny egg and buttery toast on the side, this was so good!NOTE: they also have bar seating

Let's just start by saying this is the best decision we made by going to Buttermilk Channel for brunch. Although there was a wait to be seated we got a nice cozy area near the bar. It was well worth the wait the service was excellent our waiter was very friendly. Food was as good as the reviews.

Excellent neighborhood restaurant. Wonderful Pecan Pie French toast, great pancakes, delicious fried chicken, nice grilled fish, friendly wait staff. Sometimes very good music playlist. Perfect place for weekend breakfast/brunch, but get there a little before 10 AM when it opens, otherwise you'll be waiting on line for an hour.

We had a lovely dinner here with out-of-town visitors. Yummy food, nice atmosphere, and good service. We asked about a drink on the menu and were promptly all brought samples. The only down side is that it's so popular, we've never been able to get in before making a reservation weeks in advance!

Lived up to our expectations. Got there around 10:20 am and only had a 15 minute wait..they text you when your table is ready. Started with grapefruit juice and coffee....both hit the spot. Loved how thin the ham was and how light the Hollandaise sauce was on the Eggs Huntington. My husband loved their house- cured salmon and house-made sausage (spicy and a bit sweet) but wished the capers were not fried on his salmon dish....said they were rendered tasteless.Had to have extra bisquits of course.Service was excellent and lively atmosphere but never too loud. They had started serving liquor and opened the outside tables by the time we left. Definitely a hit for our birthday brunch! Will be back.
The fried chicken - the popovers, nothing more needs to be said. Dinner or brunch is the best in the neighborhood!

I'm stuck on ordering three things here: alcohol, pancakes and chicken and waffles! Sadly you can't get the chicken and waffles for brunch, and its only available for dinner or at smorgasbord.Honestly my favorite place for pancakes and chicken and waffles. The pancakes have such an overwhelmingly light vanilla flavor that you just can't stop eating it! The chicken is well seasoned and the waffles are perfect cheddar waffles! Crisp and fluffy!Cons my friends and I had... Super salty fries. Like unlimited salt. Pop over were also either flavorless or salty too. So quality may vary per dish.
Delicious! Went on a double date with some friends and everyone was super impressed. Drinks were great too.

Didn't live up to the hype for me.  I ordered the chicken and waffles and I was underwhelmed, seeing as how that was their specialty.  I think it was a little pricey.  One thing I did like was the selection of cocktails and drinks.  Not sure I would go back but happy to have tried it.
Really yummy high quality food. Definitely going to wait for brunch on the weekend. Sometimes the staff think they're cooler than they are but all in all a good experience.

This is one of my all time favorite restaurants in all of Brooklyn. The ambience is amazing, the wine list long, the wait staff polite and helpful and everything we ordered was amazingSome of our favorites were the Squash tart, burrata, linguini, sides of mushrooms and Brussels sproutsAnd they have oysters!Everything served was fresh and delicious.
Overrated food-wise and a big, fat roach was crawling up the wall behind me while I sat with my husband and friends. When I mentioned the bug to the manager, his reply was, "Oh."

Rating is for overall service and not the food, it was four+ stars!   Since we are big fans of French Louie, we decided to give it a go at the owners original "claim- to -fame".   Was there for V-day fixe menu with another couple, the food was up to par with French Louie and rightfully so but somewhere between mains and desserts there was a considerable lag with service.  Our very nice waitress (or bus service) who probably had too many tables to work that night somehow "forgot" about us.  Our mains were done for over about 20 minutes as we waited for someone to clear our plates or even asked if we were finished with our mains.  Now in all fairness, the restaurant was very packed during the 8pm hour and there was a complaint with the table next to ours.  So we wonder if we were just collateral damage or did the other table leave them in shock n awe?!?  Nevertheless, we are glad to have tried Buttermilk and will continue to be loyal to French Louie!

One of my favorite places to eat in Brooklyn, Farm to table. Fried Chicken and waffles are the best.  Comfortable ambience, Typical Brooklyn place you can either get dressed up or dressed down, that's how great Brooklyn restaurants do it.

The menu was a bit limited, maybe redesigning it. We wanted drinks but there weren't any drinks listed. We did ask for what we already knew and they had it. The place is super crowded and popular for sure. It is somewhat baby friendly, loud but still fun to enjoy. The food was delicious, organic and fresh. Big portions!! Another plus was that our table wasn't ready yet and we had reservations they gave us a snack while we waited for our table.
Never had a bad meal here. Their chicken and waffles is great!
Awesome selections of Bloody Mary.. And of course the pork chop and waffles.

Excellent food and service. My husband took me there for my birthday and I wasn't disappointed. We didn't end up ordering the fried chicken which seemed to be the speciality of the house but we still enjoyed our food tremendously. Will be back for the chicken for sure!
I had the pork chops and they were so good and tasty.  Great environment for kids also but we ate dinner early.

The ambiance of this place is PERFECTION! I've come here twice, once for brunch and once for lunch and both times I almost teared up seeing the family style tables, the church pew seating, and all the happy families that come to this restaurant. I know that I'll be coming back to Buttermilk Channel again and again for the country-chic atmosphere and personal touches.The food is okay but nothing extraordinary. When I came for lunch, I ordered several sides as they don't have many options for vegetarians. They were all very delicious but I wish they had something substantial and affordable for those who don't eat meat. When I came for brunch, I ordered nearly one of everything on the menu. The cheddar waffle sounded like such a good idea but didn't taste much like anything. I was expecting a better tasting hash brown, which sadly fell short. The buttermilk pancakes really are decadent, super fluffy and flavorful although I would have liked some choice of topping (perhaps blueberries or chocolate chips?) It's generally just three very dense and fluffy pancakes with nothing on the side. We also got the biscuits (how can a southern girl not?) and despite the awesome jams and butters that came with it, I was left unimpressed. The biscuits were dry, flaky...dare I say, basic. I think we also ordered the hash browns but I honestly can't remember because they were that unremarkable. The food is bland and uninspired in my opinion, but the decor/style/charm of Buttermilk Channel is everything!

I don't know if Yelp is reliable anymore. One word overrated!!!! Pork chop is under seasoned and I couldn't even remember anything anymore because it wasn't a memorable moment. Not worth the 1.30 hour wait
Not impressed at all with the food! Service was good. Pancakes didn't taste like much of anything. Pecan French toast was dried out and the syrup definitely didn't meet my expectations.
Well worth the wait for brunch. Pork chops are delicious and the French Toast is to die for. Did I say the Bloody Mary's are awesome too?? And the music?? Wouldn't change a thing!
